loans.name: Mwamvua

texts.en: Mwamvua R., a Tanzanian businesswoman, has retailed both fried and fresh fish in Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam for the past three years, purchasing the fish wholesale from local fisheries.  She is now requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to extend her business.

loans.use: To extend her business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia P. is a 41-year-old mother of three. Her husband, Rolly, is a farmer. Herminia has been in business since she was a child. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get access to more capital for her sari-sari "variety store" store. Her business has had to be put on hold at times due to insufficient funds for the operations of her business as she finds it hard to obtain credit. She will use this loan to buy assorted foods to maintain her regular customers. She wants to expand to a bigger store in the future so she could stock in bulk in order to take advantage of discounts and earn more income. She hopes to save for the education of her three kids. She is thankful to the lenders for helping her realize her dreams.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for her variety store

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Oumar Dembélé  est un célibataire de 31 ans qui réside  à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école en classe de neuvième année scolaire, il  tenta  plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès. Il opta finalement de s’initier aux activités  d’achat et de vente des matériels électroniques (T.V., Radios Mini chaîne, DVD, VCD, Panneaux Sattelitaires, Antennes Paraboliques, etc.) depuis maintenant trois ans. Il jouit d’une forte réputation et  reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout des  jeunes gens.
Dans ses recherches de financement complémentaires, il sollicite la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier  prêt  individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter, 2 T.V., 3 radios Mini chaîne, 2 panneaux satellitaires, 2 antennes paraboliques, 2 DVD, 3 VCD, et 100 CD afin de pouvoir satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre. 
Il  s’approvisionne à Accra (république du Ghana) pour venir les revendre à Sikasso dans son vidéo club sis à Wayerma. En plus de vente de matériels, il les loue. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autres à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Oumar Dembélé is 31 years old, single, and lives in Wayerma I, a working-class area in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Having left junior high school in the final year, he tried his hand unsuccessfully at various incoming-generating activities. He eventually decided to start buying and selling electrical goods (TVs, radio hi-fis, DVDs, VCDs, solar panels, satellite dishes, etc.) three years ago now. He enjoys a well-established reputation and receives a lot of orders, particularly from young people. In his search for financial assistance he is requesting the help of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom this will be his first individual loan. This will allow him to buy 2 TVs, 3 radio hi-fis, 2 solar panels, 2 satellite dishes, 2 DVDs, 3 VCDs and 100 CDs in order to meet ever-increasing customer demand. He gets his supplies in Accra (Republic of Ghana) and sells them on at his video store in Wayerma. He both sells and rents out equipment. Some of his customers pay in cash and others by credit. He intends to bring in a monthly profit of 200,000 CFA francs using this loan. Having achieved his profit target he hopes to make back the bulk of his outgoings, including family expenses, pay off the interest on his loan, and invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electronic equipment (TVs, radio hi-fis, CDs, DVDs and VCDs, solar satellite panels, satellite dishes etc.)

loans.name: Nawaf

texts.en:
Nawaf, 33, lives with his wife in Aley, Mount Lebanon, where he has owned a bakery for a year. He makes bread, “saj”and “mankoucheh.” The “saj” is the metal oven where the saj bread is made, and the saj bread is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and its most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). It can be eaten at any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. 

Nawaf is special in his work because he does it well and is known for the quality of his mankoucheh. His clients are friends, neighbors and people from the region. He embarked upon this business to improve his family’s income and is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw material for his bakery. This is his first  loan request, and in the future he plans to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his bakery.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is 30 years old and married with a child. He sells medicine to his customers.

Godwin hopes for the loan of N30,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He hopes to expand this business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Having recently joined GHAPE, Naomi is taking out her first loan to purchase bean, vegetable and corn seeds, as well as to pay for labor for her farm, and also to buy oil for her shop in the market. Naomi hopes to have a good harvest this year and she believes that bringing her produce to the market will help the community. 

With the profits from her farming and market business, Naomi plans to expand her farm further by purchasing additional seedlings so that she can take even better care of her family. Naomi is married with six children and two of them are under the age of fifteen. 

Naomi has faced adversity in her life, like deep poverty and sickness, but with the help of this loan, she will be able to pay for her children's school fees and help her community in general through her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account, and most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Bean seeds, vegetable seeds, corn seeds, and oil

loans.name: Nuhwuin

texts.en:
As a new member of GHAPE, R. is taking out her first loan of 40,000 CFA to pay for labor on her farm, which produces cassava, a popular vegetable in Cameroon. R. is married and a mother of two children, as well as a grandmother of two children under the age of fifteen.  She is helping the community by hiring workers to clear the farmland and by selling her produce in large quantities. 

R. and her family have faced the problem of sickness and poverty, but with the profits she will earn from her business, she will be able to pay for her children's school fees. Because of the gradual repayment plan, R. appreciates the policies of GHAPE and Kiva. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account, and most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: The clearing and tilling of farmland

loans.name: Gamali

texts.en: Food shops are very common businesses in populated areas like Dar es Salaam and other cities in developing countries. Gamaly Joseph runs a food shop at the Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells varied food products to retail customers. He purchases the business items from wholesale shops and sometimes direct from the producers. The business income generated is used to meet his daily family demands and also for business capitalization. He needs a loan of TZS 800,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To buy more business items

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old and married with six children. She is a tailor and she also sells sarongs and laces. She has been in this business for a long time.

Victoria hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purcahse more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase and re-sale of vegetables, cereals, and fabrics

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:

This is Fatimah’s second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loan helped her improve her work. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Fatimah decided on starting her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Fatimah has requested a loan of 1000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

Mahmoud decided on his business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his store.

Mahmoud has requested a loan of 1500 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store and to change the décor.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their ten children. Ali has been selling agricultural products in his truck since 1993. His clients can be anybody.

Ali has been a microcredit client for eleven years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his work and diversify his merchandise. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Ali decided on starting his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his work by attracting more clients.

Ali requested a loan of 2000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and do some maintenance work on his truck.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and do some maintenance work on his truck.

Nada has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her work. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. He requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. Hsien has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work. Hsien's work is special because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane has owned a garage for twenty years and works as a car repair man. He is 35 years old and lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their child.

Hassane decided on this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation as well as to work independently. He is especially skilled at his job. His clients are people from his region. When he first started this business, he had to face the competition.

Hassane is now requesting a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for a garage.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan has owned a bakery for a year. He is 37 years old and lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Marwan is special in his work because he opened his bakery in front of a school. His clients are mainly students as well as people from his region. He does “mankoucheh”. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Marwan decided on this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. When he first started, he had to face the competition. Thanks to his previous loans, Marwan was able to open his bakery and did improve his financial situation. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. Marwan is requesting a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase baking supplies like flour and oil. In the future, he plans on improving his bakery.

loans.use: To purchase baking supplies like flour and oil

Nawaf decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation as well as work independently. When he first started, he had to face competition. This is the first time that Nawfal is requesting a loan. He wants to borrow $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.name: Halim

Halim decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his income. His business has done well right from the start. This is the first time that Halim is requesting a loan. He wants to borrow $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise needed for his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase used car spare parts

Husein decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. When he first started, he had to face competition. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan. Her previous loans helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Mariam is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and family members. When she first started her work, she didn’t have enough startup capital. His previous loan helped him improve his clothing shop by diversifying his merchandise. Abed A. Fattah is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. Abed A. Fattah is an active man who wants to improve his family’s income. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capitA.. In the future, he plans on improving his businesses.

Her previous loan helped her improve her shop. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capital. Souhayla decided on doing her business because she had experience in computers. In the future, she plans expanding her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and change her shop décor.

Mhamad requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase food for his animals and tools for his work. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work. His clients are traders. Mhamad decided on doing his work because he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his cattle in order to increase his production.

loans.use: To purchase food for his animals and tools for his work.

loans.name: Añoranza Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento AÑORANZA se encuentra en ciclo 6, está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la zona D. Llojeta, la mayoría D. las socias se dedica al comercio.
Carmen M., es la líder del grupo desD. sus inicios, ella tiene una pensión, donD. también venD. material D. escritorio, bebidas, frutas y también cuenta con una fotocopiadora. La señora Carmencita tiene visión futurista, demuestra bastante responsabilidad y compromiso con su grupo y sus compañeras.
 Arminda M. es otra integrante del Banco que refleja rasgos D. liderazgo, ella tiene el negocio D. bazar librería, es una persona muy alegre y emprendedora, además ella se dedica a la dotación y comercialización D. los productos Herbalife. 
Nelly Alarcón cuenta con un almacén y punto D. llamadas entel en la parada del micro 31.
Maria Eugenia Yujra  se dedica a la venta D. CDs y DVDs. Y cuenta también con una librería bazar.
Rosmery T. cuenta con su tienda D. barrio y se dedica a vender también verduras y frutas.
La señora Maria  O. es cocinera y su negocio es el D. venta D. comidas cerca al colegio Ignacio Calderón.
Beatriz Eliana Q. es otra integrante antigua del Banco y se dedica a la venta D. ropa.
Jacinta C. es integrante nueva del banco, ella junto a su esposo  se dedican a la producción y venta D. ladrillos.
Vicente M.  tiene su carnicería en su mismo domicilio en la avenida Max Fernandez.
Y el señor Javier Santos G. tiene su pequeña microempresa D. recojo D. basura.
La principal característica D. este grupo es su sencillez, humildad y transparencia, y todas se conocen D. hace varios años y lo principal es que también son amigas y compañeras D. puestos D. venta porque todas  tiene sus negocios y sus domicilios  concentrados en la parada del Micro 31, lugar donD. existe bastante movimiento económico, y es ahí donD. se lleva a cabo las reuniones D. repagos
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank Añoranza is in its 6th year of operation and is maD. up of 10 people from the Llojeta area. Most of the members work in commerce. Carmen M. has been the group leader since the very beginning and runs a small restaurant from which she also sells office supplies, drinks and fruit and keeps a photocopier. Carmen is forward-thinking and shows a strong sense of responsibility and commitment towards her colleagues. Arminda M. is another group member who displays leadership qualities and runs a store selling general and office supplies. She is a very cheerful and enterprising individual and also makes a living supplying and selling Herbalife products. Nelly Alarcón runs a grocery store and an ENTEL (a telecommunications company) phone booth at the 31 bus stop. Maria Eugenia Yujra sells CDs and DVDs and also runs a store selling general and office supplies. Rosmery T. runs a local store and also sells fruit and vegetables. Maria O. is a cook and sells food near the Ignacio Calderón school. Beatriz Eliana Q. is another longstanding member and sells clothing. Jacinta C. recently became a member, and she and her husband make a living producing and selling bricks. Vicente M. runs a butcher’s shop from his home in Avenida Max Fernández, and Javier Santos G. runs a small garbage collection company. The group is characterized mainly by its simplicity, modesty and openness. Everyone involved has known each other for years and their foremost priority is that they work together as both friends and colleagues, as all of their businesses and homes are based around the 31 bus stop, where quite a lot of economic activity takes place and where their loan repayment meetings are held.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery supplies (rice, oil, noodles, etc)

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Mhammad has owned a bakery and has been working as a taxi driver since 2001. Mhammad does “mankoucheh”. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza; most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery and do some maintenance work on his car. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve both of his businesses. His clients for his bakery are mainly students and for the taxi, his clients can be anybody. When he first started, he didn’t have the startup capitA.. Mhammad decided on doing his work because he wants to improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans on improving his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his bakery and do some maintenance work on his car.

Houda has been working as a seamstress for twenty two years. Her clients are her friends and neighbors as well as shops. Houda is 54 years old and lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with her husband and their child.

Houda decided on doing this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. Her business has done well right from the beginning. She has been a microcredit client for 8 years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loan helped her improve her work. She is requesting a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

loans.use: To  purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim is a 33 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Wassim has been working as a taxi driver for nine years. He requested a loan of 1,300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car that he uses as a taxi. Wassim has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

Wassim got into this work because he wants to increase his family’s income. When he first started, he didn’t have the start-up capital. His previous loan helped him improve his business, which caters to all kinds of clients. In the future, he plans to grow his taxi business.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his taxi.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
I. is a 53 year old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. I. has owned a furniture store since 1990. He is requesting a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that I. has requested a loan.

I. is special in his work because he offers nice furniture and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his family members, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding a good location to open his store. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for a store

loans.name: Ngai

texts.en:
Ngai P. T. is married with two children and lives in Belo, Cameroon. He has two businesses, which is common in Cameroon: he works as a shoe cobbler and raises pigs.

P. provides valuable services to his community. By offering a local shoe repair service, people don’t have to travel to have their shoes repaired, so he is saving them time and money. And he is confident that because of his piggery, pig meat will always be available on Christmas and New Year.

With this loan, P. plans to purchase materials to fix shoes, such as pins, shoe tacks, gum, plank nails, and carpenter nails. He will also purchase more food for his pigs. He is confident that his businesses will do well because he has been repairing shoes for some time now, and there is demand for piglets in his community.

This is P.'s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He chose GHAPE because of their preferable loan conditions and the small business training they provide. His first loan was smaller, and he used the profits from that to help purchase his piglet, which he continues to raise to this date. With the profits from his second loan, he will improve his businesses, help pay his children's school fees, and provide food for his family. With any remaining profits, he hopes to build a better house.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and loss, and family values. Clients are required to contribute a small amount to a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: shoe materials and animal feed

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 22 años, vive con su madre y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para jóvenes, la cual ofrece a personas conocidas y familiares lejanos, negocio que viene realizando desde hace un año. Su forma de venta es mediante visitas a sus clientes con algunas prendas como muestra y con sus habilidades de convencimiento asegura sus pedidos. La mercadería que adquiere lo hace al por mayor de una tienda de ropa donde ella labora. Para más adelante Ángela sueña con tener una boutique donde venda ropa exclusiva para jóvenes, por lo que está ahorrando para tener un capital estable para concretar su sueño. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, donde promete ser muy responsable de sus cuentas. El dinero requerido será invertido en la compra de más prendas de vestir, en especial polos de temporada, de esa manera, podrá abastecer a sus clientes con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Ángela is 22 years old and lives with her mother and her siblings in the house of their parents. She sells children’s clothing, which she offers to people she knows and far-away relatives. She has been conducting her business for one year. She sells her products by visiting with her customers with some sample garments and with her persuasive selling techniques she ensures her orders. She acquires most of her merchandise from a clothing store where she works.

For the future Ángela dreams of having a boutique where she would sell exclusive clothing for children, for this reason she is now saving in order to have stable capital to achieve her dream. This is the first time that she has solicited a loan from MFP, and she is very happy to be a part of her communal bank, where she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. The requested money will be invested in the purchase of more garments, specifically seasonal polo shirts so she will be able to supply her customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Rebeca Noemi

texts.es: La sra. Rebeca trabajaba anteriormente en un banco de emprendimiento, ahora se individualiza, vive con su esposo en la casa de sus suegros, tiene un pequeño hijito, se dedica a la venta de flores en el mercado Rodríguez, un mercado muy concurrido en la ciudad de La Paz, su esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado, apoyando a la esposa en lo gastos de la casa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mas flores para surtir su puesto.
texts.en:
Rebeca previously worked in the village bank. Now, she is on her own. She lives with her husband in her in laws house. She has a small son. She sells flowers in the Rodríguez market, a very busy market in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a hired driver, helping his wife with the household expenses. The loan will be used to buy more flowers to stock her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flowers

loans.name: Oluwole

texts.en: Oluwole Shogbesan is 41 years old and married with three children. He sells spare generator parts. He is requesting a  loan in the amount of N100,000 ($700 USD) to purchase additional parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase generator parts to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing a new motorbike

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina M. is 44 years old and married, with two children in senior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the fishing community of Aquase, near Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana.

Augustina has been a baker for the past ten years. She purchases ingredients, such as flour, margarine, and sugar, from local wholesalers in nearby towns. She then bakes her bread and supplies it to food vendors, beverage sellers, and other retailers in the community.

Augustina is requesting a loan so she can purchase ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful that she will be able to provide her children with the support they need to further their education.

loans.use: To procure supplies for baking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her little shop

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba T. is sixty-five years old. She is a married mother of two children. Both of them are currently out of school and working. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Aba is a food vendor. She sells a local dish called ‘banku’ in her community. She prepares the food in her house of residence and sells by the roadside in the evenings. Banku is prepared from corn dough and served hot with soup. She says she procures the raw materials such as maize, fish, and other vegetables from the local market. Aba has been in this business for five years. She wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk. Aba is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia H. is thirty-seven years old. She is a married mother of four children. One of them has completed the senior high school and has been working for a while. The rest are still in school: senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Cecilia is a food vendor. She sells kenkey in her community. She prepares the kenkey in the house she lives in and sells in the market square. Kenkey is served hot with pepper and fried fish. It is prepared from maize (corn dough). She says she procures the raw materials such as maize, fish, and other vegetables from the local market. She has been in the kenkey selling business for eight years. She wants a loan to procure raw materials in bulk. Cecilia is hopeful to give her children the needed support she can give them to further their education.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati M. is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all still in school. Some are in the senior high school while others are in the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Fati works hard to make some income to support her husband and to provide for the family. She is a trader. She deals in provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. She procures the goods from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast and sells in her community. Fati owns a shop by the road side in which she sells.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure more goods to stock her shop.

loans.use: To procure more goods to stock her shop

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús tiene 29 años, es soltero, vive con una señora, Carmen, quien lo apoya en todo, ya que él es huérfano de madre. Vive en una casa alquilada. Se dedica a comprar ganado vacuno, la carne de estos animales la vende en un puesto del mercado, que es atendido por su tío. Adicionalmente, Jesús tiene un motocarro con el que realiza transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad de Pucallpa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente bien con lo que hace, además le es rentable ya que tiene dos ingresos. Para el futuro, Jesús quiere tener una carnicería y establecerse laboral y económicamente. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, su banco comunal se llama “Nazareno”, donde le gusta trabajar porque todos sus integrantes trabajan coordinamente. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá 200 soles en la reparación de su motocarro; con lo restante comprará reses, en un monto de 1500 soles, cantidad que él mismo completará con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Jesus, a 29-year-old single man, lives with a woman named Carmen, who supports him with everything as he does not have a mother. He lives in a rented home. He buys cows for a living, then sells their meat in a market stand that is run by his uncle. Additionally, Jesus owns a motorcycle taxi with which he transports passengers in the city of Pucallpa. What he likes about his job is that he feels good doing what he does. Furthermore, his businesses are lucrative because he has two sources of income. In the future, Jesus would like to have his own butcher’s shop and establish himself both commercially and financially. This is the first time that he seeks a loan from MFP. His microfinance institute, in which he likes to work because all members collaborate with each other, is called “Nazareno.” He will invest 200.00 PEN of the loan money in repairing his motorcycle taxi. With the rest of the money, he will purchase cattle for the amount of 1,500.00 PEN, paying for the remaining balance with his own savings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi repair and purchase cattle

loans.name: San Juan Ollantaytambo Group

texts.en:
The San Juan Ollantaytambo Village Bank is made up of 17 members who live about 20 minutes outside the town of Ollantaytambo, in the Sacred Valley outside the city of Cusco. The group has been together for 18 months (3 loan cycles), and has just graduated from Phase I of Arariwa’s group loan program, meaning that all of the group’s 2,600 soles in savings (US$825) was returned.

The group is now entering its first cycle of Phase II, for which it has invited four new members to join the group. All of the group members are from the same area and know one another well. Almost all of them work in agriculture or raise livestock, with the exception of the group’s president, Sra. Silvia, who is a schoolteacher in Cusco, and Marina, who sells clothing. Most of the group members speak Quechua (the primary indigenous language of Peru) as a first language, which is common in the countryside in the mountains. The group’s loan officer, Alfredo, also speaks Quechua, and conducts group meetings in a mix of Quechua and Spanish.

The group meets in Paulina’s home, which is located right next to the train tracks; each day dozens of trains pass by, taking tourists to and from Machu Picchu. Paulina is 43 years old. She has a family farm, where she grows corn, potatoes, squash, and wheat and also has eleven cows. She buys the cows young, then feeds and fattens them, and finally sells them to buyers who sell the meat in Lima.

Paulina is requesting a loan of 500 soles, which she plans to use to buy guinea pigs and chickens to raise. Guinea pigs are a Peruvian delicacy and relatively lucrative to raise, though they require a lot of care and attention to keep healthy. She buys each one for 15 to 20 soles, and can eventually sell them for twice as much. Chicks cost 15 soles for a pair, and after three to four months Paulina expects to sell them for twice as much. The group has pledged to repay its Kiva loan in full and on time.

Note: Two of the people appearing in the group photo are not members: the girl on the far left is the daughter of one of the group members, while the man seated on the ground in front is the group’s loan officer, Alfredo Lopez.

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, small animals and animal feed

loans.name: Sigifredo

texts.es:
El señor Sigifredo R. ya ha tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual lo pago puntual mente, lo utilizo para poner las protecciones de su casa. En esté momento está solicitando un préstamo para poder construir la barda la rededor de su vivienda  y así su familia va estar mas segura cuando el no esté en casa. 
En el momento de la visita el domicilio del señor Sigifredo R. no se encontraba en su casa y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora María Antonio Martínez quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Señor Sigifredo R. currently has a loan with FVP and he makes his monthly payments on time. He used it to make his home more secure. At this time he is seeking another loan in order to be able to build a wall around his house so that his family can be more secure when he is not at home. When the Fundación staff visited Señor R.' house he was not at home and they were met by his spouse, Señora María Antonio Martínez, who is the person shown in this photo.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all currently in school at the junior high school and the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Akua works to make some income to support her husband. She trades in cereals such as maize and beans. She procures bags of maize and beans from the farmers in the nearby communities. Akua distributes the food items to the retailers in her community and also supplies food vendors.

She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure the cereals in bulk to increase her stock. She desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize and beans

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon tiene 30 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, también cuida de su madre. Todos viven en su casa propia. Por las mañanas, en su casa, se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales (naranjas, mandarinas, granadillas, entre otras variedades de frutas que produce su zona), y por las noches vende comida en una plaza cercana, para ello lo apoyan su esposa y su madre. En esta actividad ya lleva un periodo de 7 años y le va muy bien, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes, además le es rentable porque sus productos se venden diariamente y le generan buenos ingresos. Jhon está muy satisfecho con su trabajo, porque las ganancias le están permitiendo reparar algunos desperfectos de su vivienda. Para más adelante quiere implementar un restaurante amplio para la acogida de todos sus comensales. Con MFP tiene 3 préstamos, Jhon menciona que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe orden y puntualidad entre sus integrantes. Con el dinero que ahora viene solicitando implementará sus dos negocios, tanto el de venta de frutas, como el de comida. Con otra parte también arreglará algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Jhon is 30 years old and married with two children. He also takes care of his mother and they all live together in his house. Each morning he sells fruit from his house (such as oranges, mandarins, grapefruit and other types of fruit that are grown in his region) and at night he sells meals in a nearby plaza in order to provide for his wife and his mother. He has been engaged in this activity for the last seven years and it is going well for him. What he likes about his work is the selling and giving good service to his customers. It is also profitable for him because he can sell things every day and they bring him a good income. Jhon is very satisfied with his work because his earnings are allowing him to make some repairs on his house. In the future he would like to open a restaurant big enough to accomodate all of his guests. Jhon has three loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA and he mentioned that he likes working with his communal bank because of the order and punctuality that exists among the members. The funds that he is requesting will be invested in his two businesses, selling fruit and selling meals, and part of it will also be used to repair some parts of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell and to fix up his house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y sus 4 hermanos. Se dedica a la crianza de pollos en una parte del terreno de su casa, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año atrás, y cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es criar bien a sus animales y que éstos lleguen a un crecimiento y peso correcto para llevarlos a vender al mercado y poder obtener un precio justo. Su negocio le es rentable porque cada 35 días, ya están listos sus pollos para la venta. Para el futuro, Maria quiere comprar un terreno para mandar a construir galpones y criar mayor cantidad de pollos. Con MFP tiene 3 préstamos, su banco comunal se llama “Nazareno” y le gusta trabajar ahí porque se lleva bien con todos sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de pollos bebés y alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
María is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents and 4 brothers. She raises chickens in a section of her family's yard. She began this work one year ago, and counts on the support of her entire family to get it done. She takes pleasure in raising her animals well, making sure that they grow up to a proper size and weight so that they can be sold for a fair price when she takes them to market. Her business is profitable for her because every 35 days a new group of chickens becomes ready to be sold. For the future, María wants to buy a plot of land where she could have sheds built and raise a greater number of chickens. She has had 3 loans with MFB. Her communal bank is called "Nazareno", and she likes to work there because her friends have all had good experiences with the bank. The money that she asks for will be invested in the purchase of chicks and chicken feed to use in raising them.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de pollos bebés

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros tiene 35 años, es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo que está en edad escolar, y es quien motiva su esfuerzo diario. Estudió el arte de modistería y ahora es una de las costureras más solicitadas, por los bonitos detalles que realiza al confeccionar ropa en todas sus variedades. En este campo textil, ya lleva 21 años y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es ser bien detallista y es lo que le gusta a sus clientes, además le es rentable porque trabaja para varias entidades públicas que confían en su buen trabajo y le mandan a realizar grande pedidos. Posteriormente, Milagros quiere tener un bien implementado taller textil. Con MFP, tiene 3 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son unidos y solidarios. El dinero que solicita en esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura y otra parte para el arreglo de su casa.
texts.en:
Milagros is 35 years old, a single mother, and lives with her only son who is school-aged, and it is he who motivates her daily efforts. She studied the art of dressmaking and now is one of the most asked-for seamstresses due to the beautiful details she creates to make clothes of all varieties. In the field of textiles she has 21 years of experience and it is going well. What she likes about her work is to be very detailed and that is what her customers like. Furthermore, her work is profitable because she works for various public entities which have confidence in her good work and they send her large orders. Subsequently, Milagros wants to have a well outfitted seamstresses’ shop.

She has three loans with MFP and she enjoys working with her communal bank because its members are united and supportive. The money that she asks for in this occasion will be invested in the purchase of dressmaking materials, and partly in the repair of her house.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dressmaking materials and home repairs

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 26 años, vive junto a su esposo y su única hija de 2 añitos. Vive en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su domicilio. Asimismo, en las afueras de su casa y junto a su esposo, vende repuestos de licuadoras. Rebeca está muy contenta con sus negocios, porque le permiten obtener buenas ganancias, y debido a que su casa se encuentra en una zona muy transitada sus ventas son diarias y constantes. En el futuro, quiere tener una distribuidora de bebidas, tanto de cervezas, como de variedad de refrescos. Con MFP tiene 3 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque con sus compañeros están muy unidos y son solidarios unos con otros. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas para incrementar sus ventas, con otra parte mandará a arreglar algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 26 years old and lives with her husband and her little two year old daughter. She lives with her husband's parents. For the past seven years she has been selling beverages from her house. She and her husband also repair blenders in their yard. Rebeca is very satisfied with her endeavors because they provide her with a good income and, due to the fact that her house is located in a busy area, she does a brisk business. In the future she wants to become a wholesaler for beverages such as beer as well as other types of refreshments. She has had three loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she likes working with her communal bank because they are very united and supportive of one another. With the money from this loan she is going to buy larger quantities of beverages in order to increase her sales. Another part of the loan will be used to repair some parts of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages for sale and to fix up her house.

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna  inició el negocio por la falta de un trabajo seguro y porqué era una manera de obtener ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos y apoyarlos en sus estudios, ya que es madre soltera y por eso desea que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Comenzó el negocio  En Febrero de 2003 ya que a ella siempre le encomendaban hacer la comida en las reuniones familiares que tenían, sus sobrinas le decían que quedaban muy ricos los tamales que elaboraba y fueron ellas las que le animaron a que se dedicara a esta actividad prometiéndole que ellas la recomendarían con sus amistades y fue así como comenzo el negocio poco a poco fueron aumentando sus pedidos y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5,000 para comprar materia prima como masa, hojas, carne, verduras, aceite, desechables, etc. Que le permitan elaborar los tamales y surtir los pedidos de sus clientes aprovechando esta época de semana santa que se acerca y que a la gente le gusta hacer pedidos de tamales de verduras y mariscos.
texts.en:
Reyna began her business because of the lack of a secure job and because it was a way to earn income to sustain her children and support them in their studies. She is an only mother and this is why she wants for them to have better opportunities in life. She started her business in February of 2003 because her family always asked her to make the food for family gatherings. Her nieces always told her that the tamales she made were very good and it was they who encouraged her to work in this business. They promised her that they would recommend her to their friends. That was how she began the business. Little by little, her orders increased and since then things have gone very well for her. She needs a loan of MXN $5,000 to buy ingredients such as corn meal dough, leaves, meat, vegetables, oil, and disposable plates and utensils, etc. These will allow her to make the tamales and supply the requests from her customers that are enjoying the Holy Week holiday, when people like to order vegetable and seafood tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana tiene 33 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres, que la apoyan mucho en sus propósitos de negocio. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en la casa de sus padres, donde vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 2 años, y atiende durante todo el día.  El éxito de su tienda es porque se encuentra en una zona por donde transita gran cantidad de personas, y ella se encarga de atenderlos con gran amabilidad para que se conviertan en sus clientes. El sueño de Tatiana es hacer crecer su bodega hasta convertirla en un minimarket. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta la idea de trabajar en un banco comunal porque nota que se aprende el trabajo en equipo y responsabilidad. Como todos sus compañeros, Tatiana se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 33 years old, single, and lives with her parents, who very much support her business plans. Tatiana has a little store built into her parents' house, out of which she sells groceries and other basic necessities. She has run this shop for two years now, working in it every day. The success of her store rests on the fact that large numbers of people pass through her neighbourhood all the time and also, that she attends to her customers' needs in such a friendly way that they soon become regular clients. Tatiana's dream is to keep expanding her business until it becomes a mini-market. This is her first loan from MFP, and she likes the idea of working in a communal bank because it is about responsibility and teamwork. Like her fellow borrowers, Tatiana is committed to making her loan payments punctually. She will use the loan to buy groceries and other basic necessities to stock up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To offer a wider range of merchandise

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Rosenda  inició el negocio porqué siempre le gustaron las ventas y además podía tener un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar con los gastos de la casa y también ayudar a sus hijas. Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1989 inició el negocio primero con una especie de tiendita en la que vendía productos de primera necesidad, después puso una tortillería porqué se dio cuenta que por la colonia no había ninguna y tanto los vecinos como ella tenían que ir muy lejos a comprarlas. Por un tiempo funcionaron bien ambos negocios pero despues  batallo para encontrar empleados de confianza y decidio cerrarlos. Desde hace una año y medio inicio con la venta de productos para el hogar  y con esta actividad ella puede establecer sus horarios de trabajo y no tiene que depender de un horario fijo.
 
Cuando comenzo con esta actividad tenía muy pocos clientes, pero empezo a ofrecer sus productos con amistades,  vecinos y  antiguos clientes se enteraron que vendía dichos productos y comenzaron a comprar, actualmente pues ya cuento con un buen numero de clientes.



Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5000 para poder adquirir productos para surtir los pedidos pendientes que le han solicitado sus clientes para poder ofrecerles un buen servicio y de esta manera aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosenda started her business because she has always liked sales and, also, she could have an extra income that would allow her help with the household expenses and also help her daughters. She began the business in March of 1989. She had a type of small store where she sold basic necessities. Then she started a tortilla shop because she realized that there wasn’t one in the neighborhood, and she and her neighbors had to go a long way to buy them. For a while, both businesses worked well, but then she began to have problems finding trustworthy employees, so she decided close them. A year and a half ago, she began selling house wares and with this business she has been able to establish her work schedule and she doesn’t have to have a fixed schedule. When she began this business, she had very few customers, but she began to offer her products to friends, neighbors, and previous customers. They found out she was selling these products and they began to buy. She now has a good number of customers. She needs a loan of MXN $5000 to purchase products to supply the orders that she has from her clients, so that she will be able to offer them good service and thereby increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 32 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who currently go to school; junior high and the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Ama works to make some income to support her husband. She is a trader, a fish monger. She procures fresh fish from fishermen in her community and smokes it herself. She sells the smoked fish to retailers in her community and to food vendors.

Ama has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure fish in bulk to increase her stock. She desires to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure fresh fish.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Al señor José M. le acaban de entregar su vivienda por medio de un crédito Gubernamental a la casa le está haciendo falta algunos detalle, por el momento le interesa más la elaboración  de la  barda alrededor de su casa, no hay seguridad para su familia y teme que su pequeña hija le pueda pasar algo. Por tal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagar a la persona que se encargara de la mejora.
El día que se realizo la visita el señor José no se encontraba en su vivienda estaba en su trabajo, por eso que nos atendió su esposa la señora Sandra De La Paz quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Mr. José M. has just received a home as part of a Government grant. The house is still in need of a few improvements, and José would like to start by building a fence around it. At the moment his home is not a secure place for his family, and he fears for the safety of his young daughter. In order to build the fence he is asking for a loan to purchase the materials and labor. When we visited his home, Mr. José was at work and his wife, Mrs. Sandra de la Paz, welcomed us. She is in the person in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence around his home

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Ayishetu H. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are both currently in school. Ayishetu lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

She works to make some income to support her husband. She trades in cereals such as maize and beans. She procures bags of maize and beans from farmers in nearby communities. Ayishetu also trades in other food items such as eggs, palm oil, yam, etc. She distributes the food items to retailers in her community and to food vendors.

Ayishetu has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure the cereals in bulk to increase her stock. She desires to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Leonorilda

texts.es:
Leonorilda  inició el negocio  porqué no quizo seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria y  quería sentirse útil  y no depender de mis padres.
Comenzó el negocio En Marzo de 1995 como sus padres vieron que no deseaba seguir estudiando, su papá le dio dinero para poner su tiendita y de esta manera tener un medio para vivir. 

Desde que inicié le ha ido muy bien ya que fue la primera tiendita que se abrió en la calle y ha ido ganando sus propios clientes aunque ahora tiene más competencia pero de cualquier forma ha podido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,000 con este crédito va a comprar abarrotes para surtir mejor su tienda y de esta forma poder darle un mejor servicio a los clientes y no se vayan con la competencia.
texts.en:
Leonorilda started her business because she didn't want to continue studying for a university degree and wanted to feel useful and not depend on her parents. She starter her business in March 1995 as her parents saw she didn't want to keep studying. Her father gave her money to set up a little shop and in this way she had a means to make a living. Since she started, it has gone very well because it was the first store opened on her street and she has gone on to get her own clients. Now there is more competition, but whatever the case she has been able to make headway. She is requesting a loan of MXN $3,000, and with this credit she will purchase groceries to better stock her shop so she will be able to provide a better service to her customers and they don't go to the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her store

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso extra ya que era empleada en una empresa, pero su sueldo y el de su esposo no les alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos de la casa.
Comenzó el negocio en Abril de 2006 por iniciativa mía, ya que donde ella trabajaba aprendío mucho sobre las tortillerías y quizo independizarse y poner su propio negocio con unos ahorros que ella tenía y con el apoyo de una de sus hijas que trabaja en los EEUU. 
 
Poco a poco  fue haciendo de mis clientes y aunque tiene mucha competencia por estar cerca de un mercado su estrategia ha sido que ademas de vender tortillas y masa también vende refrescos, periódicos, etc. y además también hace entregas a domicilio de masa y de tortillas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,000, este crédito le va a ayudar para comprar materia prima  para tener un mayor inventario para esta época de semana santa.
texts.en:
Silvia started her business to earn extra income because she already worked for a company but her salary and that of her husband wasn't enough to cover all the household expenses. She started the business in April 2006 on her own initiative, since where she worked she learned a lot about tortilla making and wanted to go out on her own and start her own business with some of her savings and the support of her daughter working in the United States. Little by little she's taking on her clients and although there she has a lot of competition from being close to the market, her strategy has been to sell tortillas and pastries as well as beverages, periodicals, etc. She also makes home deliveries for tortillas and pastries. She is requesting a loan of MXN $3,000, and this credit will help her purchase ingredients to increase her inventory during the Easter period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Karin es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Karin tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donde vende golosinas, bebidas, su casa esta ubicado cerca de un terminal de buses, además Karin trabaja como secretaria en la empresa de transporte.
Karin necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas, gaseosas.
Los sueños de Karin son techar su casa y surtir con mas productos sus negocios.
texts.en:
Karin is a member of the Azucenas Community Bank. She is a 32-year-old mother of two and lives with her partner. Karin has a small store in her home where she sells snacks and beverages. Her home is located near a bus station. Karin also works as a secretary for a transportation company. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles, which she plans to use to invest in the purchase of snacks and soft drinks. Karin's dreams are to put a roof on her home and to stock her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Victoria es soltera, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Victoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
Victoria sueña con arreglar su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Banco Comunal Azucenas. Victoria is 39 years old, unmarried, and has two children. She has a store in her house where she sells groceries and food. She works every day with the help of her mother. Victoria needs a loan for 1,000 soles, which she will use to purchase sweets and soft drinks. Victoria dreams of being able to repair her house and give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sweets and soft drinks.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Dolores es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Dolores se dedica a la venta de flores sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Dolores necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de flores variados.
Dolores sueña con comprar un terreno y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the Banco Comunal Azucenas. Dolores is married, 42 years old, and has two children. She sells flowers with the help of her children by walking around the Abastos market in the city of Ayacucho. Dolores needs a loan for 3,000 soles so that she can purchase a variety of flowers. She dreams of purchasing land and giving her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of flowers.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Adela es soltera, tiene 38 años y vive en la comunidad de Satica que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Adela se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino, produce quesos que luego los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche para elaborar quesos.
Los sueños de Adela son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Azucenas community bank. She is 38, single, and lives in the Satica community which is 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho. Adela raises cattle and sheep. She produces cheese and then sells it in the city of Ayacucho. Adela needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy milk to make cheese. Adela’s dreams are to build her house and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk to make cheese.

loans.name: Mery Marina

texts.es:
Mery es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Mery es casada, tiene 25 años y 3 hijos, Mery vende comida y gelatinas sus ventas los realiza en un terminal de buses de transporte urbano, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo de su mama.
Mery necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Mery son construir su casa y tener un carro para que su esposo trabaje.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of Banco Comunal Azucenas. She 25 years old, is married and has 3 children. Mery sells food and jello snacks. She sells her food at an urban transportation bus terminal. She is able to do this with her mother's help. Mery needs a loan of 800 soles. She will use the money to purchase rice and sugar. Mery hopes to build a house and have a car so that her husband can work.

Translated from Spanish by SANDY JUAREZ, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. is 49 years old. She is a divorced mother of two daughters. According to her, both are married and live with their spouses. Martha lives with some grandchildren in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Martha is a trader. She deals in onions. Martha procures bags of onions from the Eastern part of the country and sells in the market square. She says she distributes to retailers and treks to nearby markets to sell.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure onions in bulk. Martha is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and give her grandchildren support to further their education.

loans.use: Procure onions.

loans.name: Iris Jisseye

texts.es:
La Sra. Iris Castellanos es perito mercantil y contador publico, cuenta con un negocio de utiles escolares y trabajos secretariales, encuadernados y laminados, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y gracias a Dios todo les esta saliendo bien. ella tiene mucha experiencia en las actividades que realiza en su negocio.
es importante mensionar que ella vive con su madre y es la responsable de los gastos de su mama en vista que su madre es de la tercera edad y no es conveniente que trabaje por su edad. ella se siente muy agradecida con su madre porque por un gran sacrificio logro que ella se graduara, siendo madre soltera la saco adelante. 
su mayor anhelo es instalar un ciber cafe grande y ella confia en Dios que lo va a lograr en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iris Castellanos is a commercial technician and a public accountant. For 2 years she has been in the business of school supplies, secretarial work, binding and laminating. Thanks to God, everything is going well. She has a lot of experience with the work. It is important to mention that she lives with her mother, and she is responsible for her mother’s expenses. In light of the fact that her mother is elderly, it is not advisable that she work at her age. Iris feels very grateful to her mother because she sacrificed a lot as a single mother so that Iris could graduate and get ahead. Her biggest goal is to open a cyber café. She puts her trust in God, and she believes she will achieve this goal in a short amount of time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of photo copier, buy pencils,cards, staples, paper, markers, folders, and more

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adán

texts.es:
El señor Adán O. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijo para los cuales quiere lo mejor para ellos. En esté momento viven en casa prestada pero tiene el problema que les acaban de pedir la vivienda y las rentas son muy altas para su ingreso, es por eso que decidió solicitar una casa por medio de Infonavit (crédito gubernamental) y así darle un patimonio seguro,a su familia. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la diferencia que tiene y le puedan entregar su vivienda. (Cuando realizamos la visita en la casa del señor Adán no se encontraba en ese momento estaba en horario de trabajo, es por eso que en la foto aparece su esposa e hijos)
texts.en:
Mr. Adán O. is the father of the family and has two children for whom he wants the best. At this point in time they live in a rented house but they have the problem that they are about to lose the housing because the rent is very high for their income. Therefore, Adán decided to ask for a house by means of Infonavit (government credit) and thereby give some secure equity to his family.

Adán is asking for a loan to be able to pay the difference between what he has and what is required for the loan so that they can deliver the house.

(When we visited the house of Mr. Adán we did not find him there because it was during his work hours, therefore his wife and children appear in the photograph.)

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Difference needed for a housing loan by means of Infonavit (government credit)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes T. is 65 years old. She is a divorced mother of one child who is currently in school. Agnes lives with her child in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

She works to make some income to support her husband. She trades in cereals such as maize, groundnuts and beans. Agnes procures bags of maize and beans from farmers in nearby communities. She distributes the food items to retailers in her community and to food vendors.

Agnes has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. She intends to trek to other markets to do business. She desires to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia F. R. tiene mas de 25 años de dedicarse a la produccion y venta de rosquillas, actividad que realiza desde su casa de habitacion, a ella le ayudan sus hijas a la produccion de las rosquillas, y las distribuyen en diferentes negocios de la ciudad.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio le ayuda a su esposo a cubrir con los gastos del hogar, en  el lugar donde ella vive es muy conocido por la produccion de rosquillas ya que son muy deliciosas y ricas, a esta actividad es la que se dedican la mayoria de los habitantes. tambien fabrican hojaldras y pan casero. ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas materia prima y asi tener una mayor produccion
texts.en:
Otilia F. R. has for 25 years dedicated herself to the production and sale of doughnuts which she does from her home. Her daughters help her in the production of the doughnuts and they distribute them to different businesses in the city.

With the income that the business generates she helps her husband to cover the household expenses. The place where she lives is well known for the production of doughnuts as they are very delicious and tasty and this business is what most of the residents of the area do. She also makes puff pastries and homemade bread.

Otilia needs a loan to be able to buy more premium materials and thereby have a larger production.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, corn, lard, flour, eggs, and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are in school. According to her, both of them are in junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Agnes works hard to make some income to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. She deals in provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. Agnes procures the goods from wholesale dealers in the regional capital and sells in her community. She does not own a shop in which she sells but hawks in her community. Apart from the provision business, Agnes also trades in footwear.

She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more goods to increase her stock.

loans.use: Procure provision

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna M. is 52 years old and an unmarried mother of one child. Her child is currently working. She lives in the central part of Ghana, where there are lots of tourist attractions such as Kakum, park, castles etc. And this has drawn many foreigners into the country to have a feel of them. Hannah became single a long time ago when her husband left her. She is now old but walks and does her things very actively just like a teenager. To support her child, she has been hawking and trading in cosmetics sales in her neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative. Therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income so she can open a store. It is her heart's desire that with the loan she can make a tremendous business transformation. Hannah belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort C. is a 55-year-old trader. She was married but is now a divorced woman with three children. One is in school and the rest are working. She resides at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. She has been struggling to provide for her children's education and that is her greatest desire. She could tell us the circumstance that led to her separation from her divorced husband. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard work brings a livelihood to the family. Comfort supports herself through the sale of used clothing and bed sheets. Selling of used clothing and bed sheets has a very big market share in Ghana, as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. She has been in this business for the past 30 years. She travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on kid’s wear, bed sheets and used towel sales. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's future and rent a store to trade as she sells through hawking. Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis D. is 26 years old. She is a married mother of three children who are all currently in the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. She works to make some income to support her husband financially. She trades in maize. She procures bags of maize from the farmers in the nearby communities. Mavis distributes the maize to the retailers in her community and supplies the food vendors. 
She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk to increase her stock. She intends to trek to other markets to do business. Mavis desires to improve her standard of living and support her children in school.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is twenty–three years old. She is single and lives independently. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Afia says it is important for her to work hard to make income to support herself and to be financially prepared before she enters into marriage. Afia is a trader. She deals in provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. She procures the goods from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and sells in her community. She owns a shop by the roadside from which she sells her goods.

Afia has been in this business for just one year and wants a loan to procure more goods to stock her shop.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah R. is 30 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children. Two of her children are currently in school while the youngest is still breastfeeding. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in the central region of Ghana. 

Hannah is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well as maize. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian people enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. 

Cape Coast region is one of the difficult regions in Ghana. The government is trying to alleviate the poverty rate there so that the economically active poor can also provide for their families. Hannah belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy supplies including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Marbely

texts.es: Marbely F. tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de pan, actividad que realiza desde su casa, ella tiene la ayuda de una empleada para la fabricacion de su producto, este lo distribuye en diferentes negocios, con los ingresos que genera le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene 3 hijos, esta actividad la aprendio de su madre y le ha servido para toda la vida, ya que este oficio le ha permitido satisfacer sus nesesidades a apoyar a su esposo, ella nos comento que sueña con tener una fabrica que le permita producir mas pan y emplear a muchas personas ya que aqui en esta zona el empleo es muy poco y asi ella puede abrir oportunidades para mucha gente, el sueño de ella es que su producto se pueda vender en todo honduras.
texts.en:
For more than ten years, Marbely F. has been making and selling bread from her home. She learned how to do this from her mother and she has done it all her life. She has one employee who helps her produce her products which are distributed to various businesses. She has three children. This trade has enabled her to satisfy her desire to help out her husband and with the income from this she is able to help him with the household expenses. She told us she dreams of having a bakery where she could produce a lot of bread and employ many people. In this area there is not much employment and this would allow her to create opportunities for many people. She dreams of being able to sell her products throughout Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, lard, flour, eggs, margarine, sugar and firewood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is fifty–one years old. She is widowed and has five children. She says two them have completed school and are currently working, and the rest are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Agnes works very hard to make some income to be able to support the family. She is a trader, and deals in clothes. She runs a boutique in her community. Agnes procures the textile goods from professional seamstresses in the regional capital, Cape Coast and sells in her community. She sells mostly ladies' apparel.
Agnes has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure more garments to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Married with a child, Theresa T. is a 22-year-old trader. She lives and does business at Eguase which is a suburb of Moore in the central region of Ghana.
