She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty, and because of this, she is very serious about her business. She trades in cereals like maize. She started this business three years ago. She has a strong customer base who she supplies with foodstuffs. She takes delivery from the farmers at Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and this has enabled her to cut out the middleman and increase her profits. Through this Theresa has been very resourceful to her family. Out of the maize she also prepares fante kenkey and sells it by the roadside. Fante kenkey is prepared from milled grains taken with fish and any gravy or soup. It is enjoyed by many Ghanaians. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season. It is her desire to go back to the classroom soon. Theresa belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Married with two children who are both in school, Adiza S. is a 35-year-old trader. She lives in her husband's family house in the central part of Ghana. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty, and for this reason she is very serious about her business. She trades in cereals like maize. She started this business ten years ago, and she has a strong customer base whom she supplies with the foodstuffs. She takes delivery from the farmers at Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and this has helped to cut out the middleman and increase profits. Through this Adiza has been very resourceful to her family. She uses some of the cereals to prepare fante kenkey. Fante kenkey is enjoyed by many people in Ghana. Fante kenkey is prepared from milled grains served hot with pepper and fish. She is constrained by funds but needs to buy more maize, so she is requesting a loan which will assist her to make business headway. Adiza belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’. She sells the fante kenkey by the roadside in her community where she lives.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy A. is sixty-five years old. She is a divorced mother of seven grown children. Nancy says all of them are out of school and living independently. She lives with some of her children and grandchildren in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Nancy is a baker. She bakes and supplies bread to food vendors (mostly beverage sellers) and retailers in her community. She procures the raw materials such as bags of flour, margarine, and sugar from wholesalers in nearby towns. Nancy also trades in palm oil and other items. She has been in this business since she was very young. She wants a loan to procure the raw materials in bulk, so she can make a bigger profit.

loans.use: Procure wholesale ingredients

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca F. R. tiene mas de 26 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion de venta de rosquillas y pan, actividades que realiza desde su casa de habitacion, ella tiene la ayuda de dos empleadas para sacar su producto, este lo distribuyen en diferentes lugares aledaños a la ciudad de Danli, tambien lo vende en muchos negocios en dicha ciudad, esto le ayuda con los gastos y compromisos que tiene de su hogar, tiene una hija a su cargo, la mayor parte de los habitantes donde ella vive son todos adultos ya que la mayoria de los jovenes han meigrado al exterior del pais en busca de nuevos horizontes. este trabajo viene de generacion en generacion. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas material para producir mucho pan.
texts.en:
For more than 26 years Francisca F. R. has been making and selling rosquillas (a regional cookie specialty) and bread. She does this from her home. She has the help of two employees to take the baked goods and distribute them in different places surrounding the city of Danli. She also sells to many businesses in Danli. This helps with the household expenses and commitments. She takes care of a daughter. Most of the people where she lives are adults. The majority of the young people have moved to the exterior of the country looking for new horizons. This work has been handed down from generation to generation. She needs a loan to buy more supplies in order to make a lot of bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese, corn, lard, flour, sweets, wood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina D. is thirty-five years old. She is a married mother of three children. All three of her children are currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Faustina is a food vendor. She sells a local dish called ‘banku’ in her community. She prepares the food in her house and sells it on the street in the evenings. Banku is prepared from corn dough and served hot with soup. Faustina says she procures the raw materials such as maize, fish, and vegetables from the local market. She has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to procure the raw materials in bulk. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and give her children the best education.

loans.use: Procure raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles B. is 35 years old, he is married, and has four children. Currently all his children are in school. He has been married for ten years now. Charles is the bread winner at home, as a result he is always working. Charles is very dedicated to his work, children, wife and his extended family when they need him.

He was born and lives in Moore in the central region of Ghana. The common languages in the central region are Fante and English. Cape coast has the best schools in Ghana, which range from tertiary to senior high schools. Charles did not have the opportunity to attend these schools due to financial problems. But this did not deter him from what he wanted to do, which was sell cement. Cement is an essential material that most builders use in Ghana. He saved money to successfully run his cement business, but then he ran out of funds.

Charles imports his stock from GHACEM in Tema Ghana. He doesn’t have enough funds to buy more, meanwhile the demand for his goods is high. Currently he sells between 200-400 bags within a 2-3 week period. Because he makes his deliveries promptly, lots of people buy from him. Charles is requesting a loan to purchase 1000 bags of cement, so he can meet the daily demand of his loyal customers. He would be grateful for your assistance. Charles belongs to a village bank called ‘Awake’.

loans.use: Buy more bags of cement

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora G. is 43 years old. She is married and a mother of four children who are all currently in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. Dora works to make some income to support her husband. She trades in food stuffs such as plantains, cocoyam, maize and vegetables. Dora procures food items from farmers in the nearby communities. Dora distributes the foods to retailers and to food vendors. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. Dora intends to trek to other markets to do business.

She desires to improve upon her standard of living and give her children the best education.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
S. Johnson has been trading in the local market of Moore, in the central region of Ghana, where she stays with her family.  She is 28 years old married with two children who attend school.  Her husband is a trader.  S. is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes and other food stuff like beans, onions, pepper, carrots, green pepper and cassava, plantains on top of table in the community market.  She strives very hard to make ends meet for her family.  She treks to the northern part of Ghana to buy her food stuffs and has been in business for four years now.  

S. does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which slows her business progress.  With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stock to revive the business.  She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory.  

She would be grateful for assistance.  S. belongs to a village bank called ‘Akukudrofo’ which means ‘Brave people.’.

loans.use: Increased stock of supplies to sell.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro V. tiene 6 años de dedicarse a al venta de medicinas populares, es notable el crecimiento y la administracion que le ha dado a su negocio, ya que nos comento que a traves de los ingresos de su negocio contruyo su casa y todo lo que hoy posee en dia, y apoya a sus padres y a una hermana que vive con el. este negogio ha sido de gran ayuda ya que anteriormente trabajaba para la empresa privada y al quedar sin trabajo lo instalo y ahora lo que quiere es invertir en su negocio que le genera muchos ingresos y lo que el desea es mejorar la calidad de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en:
Ramiro V. has sold popular medicines for 6 years. It is remarkable how much he has grown and managed his business. He told us that with the earnings from his business, he built his house and everything he owns today. He supports his parents and a sister who lives with him. This business has been a great help because he used to work for a private company and lost his job. Now he wants to invest in his business, which generates a lot of income for him, and he wants to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying popular medicines (painkillers for stomach pains and fevers, amoxicillin, uña de gato, fortachon, denguina, dayamineral) shoes, shirts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is 50 years old. She is married and mother with seven children. Currently six of her children are working while the other is in senior high school. She lives at Moore in the central region of Ghana.

Abena is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, like lunch boxes etc. She mostly sells through hawking house to house. Abena has been trading for 14 months now with her humorous behavior. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her stand. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods.

Recently Abena has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more supply like cooking utensils etc. which is frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan she believes she will make lots of profit to build a store to reduce the frequent of walking in the street to sell.

Abena would be grateful for your assistance. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘Akukudrofo’ which means ‘Brave People’.

loans.use: Increase stock of inventory.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. started her fish sales 16 years ago in Moore, in the central region of Ghana. Efua prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish. She has many customers.

She buys fish from fishermen at the seashore. Efua smoked some of the fish and sells the rest fresh. She has a large customer base that travels from other part of the region to buy her fish. She is now 42 years old, married and mother with three children. Currently two of her children are schooling.

Efua wants to use the loan to buy stock of assorted fishes and other food stuffs. It is her dream to provide a better education for her children and believes that when she is fully resourced her dream will be fulfilled. Efua belongs to a village bank called ‘Akukudrofo’ which means ‘Brave People’.

loans.use: Buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Juana Iris

texts.es: Juana Iris M. tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de medicinas, su negocio ha crecido ultimamente, ella nos comento que los ingresos de su negocio los reinvierte en la compra de algunos  medicamentos que son mas baratos y tambien con las ganancias contribuye a pagar los gastos del hogar, asi ellos mejoran la situacion familiar , para este año de ser posible continuara con los estudiso universitarios en la carrera de quimica y farmacia ya que ela solo es enfermera profesional y en un futuro piensa poner otra farmacia en otra zona.
texts.en:
Juana Iris M. has been selling medicines for 2 years, and her business has grown as of late. Juana comments that her business income is reinvested in the purchase of less expensive generic medications. She also uses her earnings to contribute toward household expenses. In this way, her family's living situation has improved. This year Juana hopes it might be possible for her to continue her university studies in the fields of chemistry and pharmacy, given that she is a healthcare professional. In the future, she is thinking of establishing another pharmacy in a new area.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of commonly used generic medications.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia S. is 45 years old single mother of seven children. Four are currently in school while the rest are working. She lives with her children in Moore, in the central region of Ghana.

She is a food vendor and sells Fante Kenkey and maize. Fante Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy Kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. Her major target group is travelers who ply that road to their destination. Those travelers purchased Fante Kenkey in bulk.

Emelia wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. The government is trying to alleviate the poverty rate so that the economically active poor can also provide for their families. Emelia belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence.’

loans.use: Buy maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha M. started her fish business ten years ago in Eguase, a suburb of Moore in the central region of Ghana. She purchases fish at the seashore and later retails them to her faithful and loyal customers. She has a large customer base, many of whom travel from other parts of the region to buy her fish.

Agatha smokes some of the fish and sells some fresh. She prepares and serves very tasty and good quality fish. She has respect for her customers. Agatha will use this loan to increase her stock of assorted fish.

Agatha is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Currently, two of her children are in school and the other two have completed senior high school. It is her dream to provide a better education for her children and she believes that if she is well supported her dream will come true.

Agatha belongs to a village bank called "Akukudrofo" which means "Brave People".

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish and a refrigerator

loans.name: Omar Alfonzo

texts.es:
Omar M. L. tiene un restaurant de comida oriental desde hace 8 años operando bajo el nombre de China Town, su negocio es unico de su especie en el municipio de trojes, lo que lo hace muy popular en la zona, ya que mucha gente va a comer a su restaurant, nos comento que su arte culinario lo aprendio hace mucho tiempo ya que el laboro para restaurantes chinos de mucho presigio en la ciudad de tegucigalpa y san Pedro Sula, su estado civil es casado y tiene 2 hijos a cargo, uno de ellos cursa la primaria en una de las escuelas publicas de la zona, uno de sus sueños es expandir su negocio y tener su propio local donde sus clientes puedan degustar sus suculentos platillos.
necesita el credito para comprar comida para hacer sus platillos especiales.
texts.en:
Omar M. L. has run an oriental restaurant, China Town, for the last 8 years. His is the only one of its kind in the Trojes municipality and is therefore very popular among the locals, many of whom go to eat there. He tells us that he learned to cook this type of food some time ago, as he worked for very prestigious Chinese restaurants back in Tegucigalpa and San Pedro Sula. He is married with 2 children, one of whom is a primary student at a local public school. One of his dreams is to expand his business and have his own premises where his customers can sample his delicious cuisine. He needs the loan to buy food for making his special dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish, shrimp, snails, lobster, octopus, chicken, oil, vegetables, rice and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. started selling fish nine years ago at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Hawa prepares and serves her customers with very tasty, good quality fish from her stand. She has a great spirit to convince her suppliers to get more fish when there is a high demand and supply is low. She used to sell fishe with her mother when she was a little girl.

Through she has gotten to know most of the fishermen at the seashore, she sometimes buys fish on a credit basis. Hawa buys stocks of fish and smoked them at a nearby stand. She has a large customer base that travels from other parts of the region to buy her fish. Hawa also trades in food stuffs like maize, peanuts etc. She takes stock of goods from northern Ghana.

Hawa is now 50 years old married and mother with six children. Currently four are in school and the other two are working. Hawa requests the loan to upgrade her stock of goods. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Otease’ which means ‘He Lives.’

loans.use: Buy more fish.

loans.name: Yanci Patricia

texts.es:
Yanci R. se dedica a la venta de frutas, desde hace 3 años que se dedica a este tipo de actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion y opera bajo el nombre de Frutas ROCIO, ella es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales dependen de ella, ella tambien recibe una ayuda de su exesposo ya que con el tuvieron dos de los tres hijos que ella tiene.
desde que ella se separo de su union marital, decidio independizarse y empezo con la venta de frutas y es notable que le ha ido muy bien, ella ha sabido ganarse a sus clientes por la calidad de frutas que vende y por los precios que les ofrece.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella cubre en un 100% sus gastos familiares,
en la actualidad ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente apra surtir mas su negocio, razon por la cual esta solicitando dicho credito
texts.en:
Yanci R. has sold fruit for a living for 3 years now. Her business is home-based and runs under the name of Frutas ROCIO. She has 3 dependent children and receives financial help from her ex-husband as 2 of the 3 children are his. Since the end of her marriage she decided to regain her independence and began selling fruit. She has done remarkably well as she knows how to draw in customers with the quality and reasonable prices of her produce. She covers 100% of her family expenses with this income and currently lacks the funds to buy more stock for her business, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of apples, grapes, melons, watermelons, bananas, oranges, plums, mangoes and plantains

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi T. is 26 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Currently, three of her children are in school. Her husband works with her. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their children's future by providing them with education.

Esi lives at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She sells food in the community market, including items such as cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, and bags of rice. She says that these items sell very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Ghana. Esi deals directly with the wholesalers, instead of retailers who would sell to her at higher prices.

With her eight years of experience in her business, she wants to add other foods, such as maize and eggs, that are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible the help of loan assistance.

Therefore, she wants a loan to buy more raw materials such as rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, flour and margarine, among others. She is convinced that the loan will help her to increase her stock in the event of a price hike. She also believes this will help her save more for her children's education.

She says she would be grateful for your assistance. Esi belongs to a village bank called "Otease," which means "He lives."

loans.use: To buy food, such as cooking oil, rice, spices and tinned tomatoes

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza M. is 40 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. Currently all are in school in the community where they live. She lives in a community called Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Her husband is a cleaner at the University of Cape Coast.

Adiza sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and eaten with sugar, milk and bread or what we called "kose" (ground beans fried into small doughnuts). Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so, in just about 20 minutes, it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With her large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her food business. She hopes to make a good income to support her children in school. She treks to Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her supply of goods. With the loan, she believes she can buy more from the farmers and this will prevent her from frequent traveling. Adiza belongs to a village bank called "Otease," which means "He lives."

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama T. is a 39-year-old trader. She is married and has two children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in Cape Coast. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to poverty.

She is very serious about her business. She trades in cereals like maize, beans, and rice. She started this business five years ago. Ama makes a living from the profits of her sales. Ama has been a great resource for her family.

She wants to use the loan to buy larger supplies of maize, beans, groundnuts and rice to serve her customers throughout the season. This is especially important in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes that, with the loan, she can buy more bags of maize grains. She treks to the farming communities to by her stock of goods.

Ama belongs to a village bank called "Otease," which means "He lives." She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy larger supplies of maize, beans, and rice

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba S. is fifty years old. She is a widowed woman with four children who are all independent. Her husband died from a prolonged sickness. Araba had to struggle to provide for the basic needs of her children.

Araba is a very active and hard-working woman in her business. She went into business right after completing elementary school. She did not have the opportunity to attend high school. Araba sells cereals such as maize, groundnuts, and beans, and other food items. She buys these crops directly from the farmers at a relatively low price. She sells them at the local market in the town where she lives with her family. She also treks with some of her goods to nearby markets to sell.

Araba says she wants to use the loan to buy the goods in bulk so that she can distribute them to more customers. Araba belongs to a village bank called "Otease" which means "He lives." She would grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more cereals

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es: La señora Rosa Elia V. tiene ya más de ocho años en la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía  de temporada de verano ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo, también desea comprar un vehiculo para trasportar la mercancía a diferentes partes de la ciudad y así tener más ingreso y su negocio crecerá mas.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia V. has been selling new and used clothes for over eight years now as her family's main source of income. She is looking to obtain a loan to buy seasonal merchandise for summer as per customer demand. She also wants to buy a car to take her merchandise to different parts of the city, raising her income and helping to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and a car.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El Sr. jose Angel R. se dedica a la venta de articulos de plastico como ser baldes, pailas, ganchos, rayadores, canastas y otros, dicha actividad la realiza hace varios años y tiene su puesto de ventas en el mercado nacional de la ciudad capital, el tiene bastante demanda con los articulos que vende y tiene mucha variedad lo que le ayuda a tener muy buenas ventas. el tiene que viajar para comprar su producto y por eso es que necesita el credito para comprar mucha mercaderia y asi no tener que invertir dinero en gastos de viaje, ademas que comprando el producto por grandes cantidades es mas barato y se tienen mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Angel R. sells plastic items like buckets, hangers, graters, baskets, and so on. He has been doing this for several years and has a stand in a large market in the capital city. There is substantial demand for the merchandise he sells; moreover, he has a lot of variety, which helps his merchandise sell well. He has to travel to buy his products; consequently, he is asking for a loan so that he can buy a lot of merchandise at once and thus save on travel expenses and pay less by buying in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various plastic items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Alma Leticia R. tiene ya más de dos años con su negocio de salón de belleza el cual es el ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta algo de maquinaria y artículos de belleza, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar la maquinaria y los artículos que necesita.
texts.en:
Señora Alma Leticia R. is a single mother with two children for whom she is responsible. For more than two years now she has had her beauty parlor which provides her family's income. Her business needs some equipment and beauty products but at the moment she doesn't have the money to obtain them. For this reason she is seeking a loan so that she can buy the equipment and other things that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and equipment

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia
texts.en: María Antonia

loans.use: To purchase more firewood.

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
“Luz y Esperanza”, or Light and Hope, is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their second loan from Esperanza International. The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a second loan for further business expansion. Yanira is one of the coordinators of the group in Santiago.

Yanira, mother of three (ages: 17, 14 and 9), operates from her home and sells men’s, women’s, and children’s clothing, shoes and accessories. Yanira’s past loan was used to increase product capacity and allowed for a greater return on sales due to increased product offerings to her customers. Yanira plans to use her second loan in a similar manner, to increase her current inventory levels.

Yanira is dedicated to the completion of her loan as she dreams of one day owning her own store to sell her products from.

Other members of Yanira’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including Dominican-style fast food sales, fried food, clothing and jewelry sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Biter Oscar

texts.es: el Sr. Biter se dedica a dos tipos de negocios uno que es el principal de el que es la venta de papas y cebollas en el mercado de la capital, su otro negocio es una pulperia pero la maneja su esposa y esta queda su casa de habitacion, con la venta de papas y cebollas le va muy y el quiere comprar varios sacos para poder tener para dos meses ya que este producto esta variando el precio de compra y se esta poniendo caro , y lo que el quiere es comprarlo a precio justo para tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Biter Oscar V. C. has two businesses. The main one consists of the sale of potatoes and onions, which he does in a market in the capital city. His other business is a convenience store; his wife runs this from their home. He wants to buy many sacks of potatoes and onions, as the prices are currently going up and he wants to make sure he buys them before they rise even further, so that he can make a profit.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing potatoes and onions

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Unidos para Triunfar (United to Triumph) is a group of ten entrepreneurs seeking their second microfinance loan from Esperanza International. The group’s past loan has been successfully completed and the group hopes to use additional funds to continuously increase the prosperity of their existing businesses in the city of Santiago.

Wendy, mother of three children, ages 18, 14 and 11, has been selling Dominican-style cooked meals from her home for the past two or three years. Wendy plans to use her loan to purchase additional ingredients including rice, beans, oil and plantains, to continue to serving lunchtime food to her customer base: around 25 customers daily. Wendy is committed to the repayment of her loan as she desires to provide for the physical needs of her children and dreams of one day opening her own restaurant.

Other members of Wendy’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including clothing, perfume, desert and juice sales as well as a beauty salon.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make catered meals

loans.name: Mayra Yamileth

texts.es: la Sra. Mayra L. se dedica a la venta de calzado para dama, caballero y niños, ella tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado nacional de la ciudad capital, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, ella tiene gran variedad de zapatos pero quiere invertir mas  por la temporada de verano que se venden mucho las sandalias y chancletas, cabe mensionar que con su negocio ha podido salir adelante y dar el sustento que necesita su familia, los gastos de alimentacion, estudio, medicamentos etc. ella quiere invertir mas para tener mejores ventas y mayores ganancias. su meta es poder tener varias tiendas por toda la ciudad capital.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra L. F. sells shoes for women, men and children. Her business is located in a large market in the capital city. She has done this for several years. She sells a great variety of shoes, but she wants to buy sandals and flip-flops for the summer, as those sell very well. It's worth mentioning that she has been successful in her business; it has allowed her to support her family by paying for their food, school related expenses, medical expenses, and so on. She wants to invest so that she can have more sales and greater profits. Her goal is to have many stores throughout the capital city.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Alejandro L. se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera esté es su negocio y tiene ya mas de ocho años con este oficio. Pero le está haciendo falta una maquina especial para la madero y no cuenta con el dinero necesario, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para realizar la comprar de la maquina que está necesitando, y así poder elaborar los muebles que tiene pendientes de entregar.
texts.en:
Alejando L. has been in the business of making wooden furniture for over eight years. He is missing a special woodworking machine but doesn't have enough money to buy it himself. He is therefore looking to obtain a loan that will let him buy the machine he needs to fulfill outstanding furniture orders.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a woodworking machine

loans.name: Olga Amparo

texts.es: olga Amparo H. se dedica al comercio, ella vende pan casero y rosquillas las cuales son muy buscadas por los clientes ya que el sabor de las mismas son muy buenos y lo mas importante higienicas,  ella tiene 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y tiene 2 hijas que dependen de ella al 100% las cuales dos cursan la secundaria en un colegio publico de esta localidad, gracias a su negocio logra salir con todos los gastos del hogar, pero ella necesita vender mas para tener mejores ganancias y asi poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas, su esposo se dedica a la caficultura ya que este lugar es apto para la siembra de cafe por las montañas y el clima fresco, eso hace que el grano que se produce sea sabroso y aromatico.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Amparo H. sells homemade bread. The sweet bread she makes is very popular with her clients both because it is very tasty and because it is made under sanitary conditions. She has done this for 16 years. She has two daughters, both of whom depend entirely upon her. They are in middle school at a public school in the area. Thanks to her business she can pay all of her household expenses; in order to provide her children with a higher quality of life, however, she must make more profit. Her husband sells coffee beans because the area is well-suited to their growth.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Unidos Para Vencer Group

texts.en:
“Unidos para Vencer”, or United to Overcome, is a group of ten entrepreneurs seeking their third microfinance loan from Esperanza International.  The group’s past loans have been successfully repaid and they hope to use this third loan to further increase the prosperity of their existing businesses in the city of Santiago.

Marisol, mother of three (ages 9, 7, and 6), sells clothing from her home and on the streets of Santiago.  Marisol’s past two loans have been used to increase the volume of her business through additional purchases of men’s, women’s and children’s clothing, which has allowed for additional earnings.  Marisol plans to utilize her third loan in a similar manner, to purchase needed and popular clothing items.  Marisol is committed to the completion of her third loan.  She speaks with passion as she describes the clothing store she dreams of owning someday.

Other members of Marisol’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities.  All but one member sell clothing or undergarments, and the other member, the only male of the group, owns a small café.  

On behalf of Esperanza International and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Aida Esperanza

texts.es:
la Sra. Aida L. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular ella tiene una pulperia operando bajo el nombre de pulperia AIDA, actividad que tiene desde hace 16 años, ella es madre de familia y todos sus hijos ya son adultos, con los ingresos que genera cubre con todos sus gastos personales y le ayuda con lo que puede a sus hijos como toda madre amorosa que siempre les da algo a sus hijos.
ella nos comento que la necesidad del credito es para surtir mas su negocio y asi poder mejorar las ventas. ya que esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que ella tiene.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aida L. R. runs a convenience store named AIDA. She has been doing so for 16 years. She is a mother; all of her children are adults now. With the money she makes, she can afford to pay for her own needs and help her children as well. She came to ask for a loan because she wants to restock her store in order to increase sales. It is the only source of income she has.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various items for sale in a convenience store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el Sr. Francisco G. se dedica al comercio el vende leña y tambien se dedica a la caficultura pero su fuerte es la venta de leña, el tiene 5 años de vender leña, es casado y tiene 2 hijos que depende de el, con los ingresos que tiene el logra sacar adelante a su familia dandoles estudio, alimentacion y medicamentos.
en la zona en donde vive el Sr. G. es una zona boscosa de un clima fresco, la venta de leña en estos lugares es muy comun ya que se necesita para el uso domestico para la cocion de alimentos y de uso industrial para hornos de panaderias y secadoras de cafe, el necesita comprar mas leña para tener mejores ganancias y asi poder darles todos a sus hijos que es lo mas hermoso que el tiene en la vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco G. sells firewood. He also grows coffee beans, but his main business is the sale of firewood. He has been doing that for 5 years. He is married with 2 children who depend on him. With his income, he has been able to help his family by paying for their food, school expenses and medical expenses. The area in which Mr. G. lives is a place with a cool climate and many forests. The sale of firewood in this place is very common because it is needed for both domestic and industrial use. He needs to buy more wood so he can increase his profits and thus provide better for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena R. V. reside en el municipio de Zacatecoluca, vive en la casa de su madre junto a ella y a su hijo de 23 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. A sus 48 años de edad María Magdalena trabaja arduamente día con día en el mercado municipal de Zacatecoluca, ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, las cuales logra vender con mucho éxito debido a que posee una clientela fiel y estable. María solicita un préstamo a través de cual pueda comprar más verduras y frutas de estación, en especial desea poder comprar frutas típicas de la semana Santa, ya que son las más demandadas en el mes de abril. Es así como María Magdalena desea aumentar sus ventas, todo con el fin de mejorar su economía familiar, ya que ella es la única personas que aporta a su hogar debido a que su madre es muy anciana y su hijo se dedica a estudiar, y como toda buena madre desea ver a su hijo culminando sus estudios, es por ello que día con día trabaja muy duro para  brindarles todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
María Magdalena R. V. lives in the city of Zacatecoluca with her mother and her 23 year old son, who is a student. At 48 years old, María Magdalena works very hard day after day in the Zacatecoluca municipal market. She sells fruits and vegetables, which she manages to do successfully due to her stable and loyal clientele. María is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, particularly the typical fruits of Semana Santa (Holy Week) since those are in high demand in April. María Magdalena hopes to increase her sales and ultimately her family's finances since she is the only person who supports the household. Her mother is very old and her son is focused on studying. Like all good mothers, she wants to see her son complete his studies, so day after day she works very hard to provide everything that her family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
el Sr. Lorenzo L. tiene 57 años de edad y vive en la aldea del Guayabo desde hace 12 años , esta casado con la sra. Olga Nunez y tiene bajo su responsabilidad 2 hijos de los cuales uno esta en la escuela.
el sr L. se dedica a la venta de leña y maiz desde hace 2 años para el es un negocio muy bueno ya que le deja muy buenas utilidades, el sale a comprar la leña y la transporta en su carro pickup asi el se ahorra mucho en gastos de transporte, y el lo cobra cuando la va a dejar lejos la leña,  el maiz lo va comprando por varias comunidades , el sale en su carro a comprar y luego al final de dia viene cargado de maiz y lo vende en una bodega. 
el necesita dinero para comprar mas mercaderia ya que la que esta comprando es muy poca y se queda sin vender producto muy rapido
texts.en:
Lorenzo L. is 57 years old and has lived in Guayabo village for 12 years. He is married to Olga Nunez and has 2 children in his care, one of whom goes to school. Mr. L. has been selling firewood and corn for the last 2 years, a business that has proved very lucrative. He goes out to buy firewood and carries it around in his pickup truck, saving a lot of money on freight charges and collecting for it when dropping the wood off in remote locations. He visits several different communities in his pickup to buy corn and, after loading up on stock, sells it at a store at the end of the day. He needs funds to buy more goods as he is only able to buy small amounts and runs out very quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of firewood and corn

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.
Andrea es soltera, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, estudiante de industrias alimentarías, Andrea se dedica a la preparación de chocolates de manera artesanal, sus ventas son a pedido que le realizan sus amigos, familiares, clientes que ya tiene.
Andrea necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que era invertido en la compra de chocolate cobertura y moldes.
Andrea sueña con terminar sus estudios, construir su casa y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Banco Comunal Confianza (Confidence Communal Bank). She is single, 24 years old, has one son, and is a student of the food industry. She prepares handmade chocolates and her friends, family, and existing customers make up her sales. Andrea needs a $200 loan to purchase melting chocolate and molds. She dreams of both her and her son completing their studies and building a house.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase melting chocolate and molds.

loans.name: Elizabeth Roxana

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.
Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Elizabeth tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad de Huanta en donde vende abarrotes en general al por mayor y menor, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de un personal.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son construir su casa, ampliar su negocio y tener un carro.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Confidence Communal Bank (Banco Comunal Confianza). She is a 27-year-old common-law wife and has two children. She has a stand at the market in the city of Huanta where she sells groceries wholesale and retail and is assisted by a staff. Elizabeth needs a $975 loan to invest in milk, rice, and sugar. Her dream is to build a house, expand her business, and to have a car.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael A. B., de 57 años de edad reside en la colonia Los Conacastes ubicada en el municipio de Soyapango. Vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, una de 22 años, la segunda de 19 y el tercero de 15 años, los tres son estudiantes. Misael posee una panadería en su propia casa, en la cual colabora toda su familia para poder elaborar el pan y luego Misael se encarga de repartirlo a sus consumidores. El desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar un pick up para repartir el pan, así también desea aumentar su producción y para ello necesita tener las posibilidades para comprar más materia prima para su trabajo, es por ellos que solicita este préstamo ya que de esta manera tiene la posibilidad de mejorar su negocio y de mejorar la vida de su familia, ya que una de las mayores razones por las que Misael trabaja arduamente es para poder brindarles los estudios a sus hijos y de esta manera poder brindarles un mejor futuro y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Misael A. B. is 57 years old and lives in the Los Conacastes district located in the city of Soyapango. He lives with his wife and three children, ages 22, 19, and 15. Misael runs a bakery from his home and his whole family works together to make the bread. Later, Misael sells the bread to customers. He wants a loan to buy a pickup truck to use for deliveries, buy more ingredients for his bakery and increase his production. With this loan, he will then have an opportunity to improve his business as well as the life of his family. One of the reasons Misael works so hard is to provide for his children's education and ultimately provide them with a better future and better financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a pickup truck

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza
Vilma es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Vilma se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas, actividad que realiza en el horno de su tía, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria por diferentes calles. Además Vilma vende cebiche en la casa de su mama.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una carpa.
Vilma sueña con comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Confianza Communal Bank. She is 26 years old, single, and has a son. She makes empanadas using her aunt’s oven and walks the streets selling them by way of a living. She also sells ceviche (raw fish marinated in lemon juice) at her mother’s house. Vilma needs a loan of 600 sols to buy a sales tent. She dreams of purchasing a piece of land on which to build a house and having her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sales tent

loans.name: Lidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lidia del Carmen B. D. B. D. 63 años D. edad, resiD. en la colonia luz junto a su esposo D. 62 años D. edad, juntos trabajan en su propio negocio en el cual se venD. comida típica como atoles, queso, pan y chorizos, dicho negocio esta ubicado frente a una D. las iglesias más grandes del país, por esto Lidia logra tener muy buenas ventas debido a que gran cantidad D. las personas D. la iglesia consumen sus productos. Lidia del Carmen solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda aumentar sus productos, ya que ella desea poder vender más variedad D. platillos típicos, D. manera que pueda obtener mayor clientela y obtener mayores ganancias. Debido a que Lidia vive únicamente con su esposo, es que se dedica a su negocio y a pesar que son dos personas D. edad avanzadas trabajan muy duro por lograr obtener una mejor estabilidad económica D. manera que puedan ver suplidas todas sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Lidia del Carmen B. D. B. is 63 years old and lives in the Luz district with her 62-year-old husband. They work together selling traditional foods like atoles (a traditional hot cornmeal beverage), cheese, bread, and chorizo. The business is located in front of one of the largest churches in the country, so Lidia has very good sales due to the large number of people from the church who eat her food. Lidia del Carmen is requesting a loan to increase her product. She wants to sell more varieties of traditional dishes, get more customers, and increase her earnings. Since Lidia only lives with her husband, she is dedicated to her business. Despite her and her husband's advanced ages, they work very hard to achieve better financial stability and supply all of their basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products to make traditional dishes.

loans.name: Mas Que Vencedores Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario mas que vencedores esta integrado por tres personas de las cuales dos son caballero y una dama. este grupo se integra de la siguiente forma:
La Sra. Santos G. tiene 68 años de edad, esta casada y tuvo 3 hijos de los cuales uno le ayuda economicamente ya que trabaja en un taller de mecanica, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años, para vender su producto ella se traslada a las dintintas casas de la aldea.
las personas de su comunidad la conocen bien y dicen que es una persona responsable y muy luchadora, su mayor deseo es tener una tienda de ropa.
El Sr. Angel Fabricio C. tiene 22 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la Sra. Mirna Gonzales con la cual no han procreado ningun hijo.
el se dedica a la venta de camarones y pescado, desde hace 16 meses, para vender su producto el se traslada a los dintintos comedores de la cominidad donde tiene bastantes clientes ya que financia ssu producto, el vende producto de muy buena calidad.
su mayor sueño es tener una bodega en la cual el pueda vender su producto al por mayor.
Yunior R. tiene 27 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la Sra. Francis ordonez, tienen 1 hijo, el se dedica a la venta de tomates, papas, yuca, repollo, chiles, zanahorias, pastes, pepinos, bananos, naranjas, el tiene 2 años de hacer esta actividad, para vender su producto lo pone en su carro y lo lleva  a los distintos municipios del departamento de Valle.
su mayor sueño es tener un camion para vender mucho producto.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Más Que Vencedores (More Than Conquerors) Solidarity Group is made up of three people, two of whom are male and one female, as follows: Santos García is 68 years old and married with 3 children, one of whom works in a vehicle repair shop and helps her financially. She has been selling second-hand clothes door-to-door in the village for 2 years now. Those in her community know her well and consider her a responsible and very strong-willed individual. Her greatest wish is to own a clothing store. Angel Fabricio C. is 22 years old and lives with his partner, Mirna Gonzáles, with whom he has no children. He has been selling fish and shrimp for 16 months now, visiting the different eateries in the community, among which he has quite a number of customers on account of the excellent quality of his produce. His greatest wish is to sell his produce wholesale in his own store. Yunior R. is 27 years old and lives with his partner Francis Ordonez and their son. He has been selling tomatoes, potatoes, cassava, cabbages, chili peppers, carrots, pastes (small pastries stuffed with potatoes, meat and fruit etc.), cucumbers, bananas and oranges for 2 years now. He drives around the different municipalities in the Valle department selling his produce. His greatest wish is to own a truck with which to sell a larger amount of goods. All of them need the loan to maintain their families.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pants, shirts, shorts, socks, shrimp, fish, tomatoes, potatoes, cassava, cabbages, carrots, bananas, chili peppers, cucumbers and avocadoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aprocap Group

texts.es:
Aprocap pertenece a un proyecto especial exclusivamente para productores, los socios son D. la comunidad D. Vacahuasi, distrito D. Ocros, Provincia D. Huamanga, La comunidad se ubica al borD. del río Pampas, este río viene a ser el limite con el departamento D. Apurimac.

La principales actividades D. la comunidad son el cultivo D. frutas como naranja, papaya, paltas y mango.

Mariano es socio del Banco Comunal, Mariano es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos D. 8, 6, 3 años, Mariano se dedica al cultivo D. paltos hace 9 años, recibió capacitaciones para el manejo D. paltos, actualmente tiene 80 a 90 paltos, su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. abono y insecticidas. Mariano sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Por otro lado Fortunato es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos D. 18, 14, 9 años, Fortunato tiene 60 plantas D. palta y tiene proyectado instalar mas paltos, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. abono para el cultivo D. paltos, Fortunato sueña con mejorar su producción y sus hijos sean profesionales.

A los productores D. la comunidad D. Vacahuasi, se les ofrece un préstamo a 12 meses, debido a que este es el periodo D. cosecha, el dinero recibido sera invertido en el cultivo. Los productores podrán cancelar su préstamo al finalizar este periodo que es D. 1 año.
texts.en:
Aprocap is part of a special project exclusive to growers and is maD. up of members of the Vacahuasi community in the Ocros district, Huamanga province. The community is located next to the Pampas River, which forms the boundary between this and the Apurimac district. The community focuses its efforts mainly on cultivating fruits such as oranges, papayas, avocados and mangoes. Mariano is a member of the Communal Bank and lives with his partner and three children, aged 3, 6 and 8. He has worked for 9 years growing avocado trees, having been trained in their care. He currently has 80 to 90 trees and will use his loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides. Mariano dreams of his children becoming professionals. Fortunato lives with his partner and has three children, aged 9, 14 and 18. He has 60 avocado trees and intends to plant more, to which end he intends to buy fertilizer with his loan. Fortunato dreams of increasing his production capacity and of his children becoming professionals. The growers of the Vacahuasi community need a 12-month loan, due to the year-long harvest, which will be invested in cultivating produce. It will be repaid following this year period.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Reina Escobar

texts.es: Reina Escobar V. D. V., resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango junto a sus dos hijos mayores D. edad. A sus 44 años D. edad Reina trabaja en su propio negocio, en el cual se encarga D. vender frutas y verduras D. manera ambulante en la zona oriental del país, la cual esta ubicada a unas 2 horas y media D. su hogar. A pesar que el hijo mayor D. Reina trabaja, esto no es suficiente para poder pagar todos los gastos del hogar, es por ello que Reina se esfuerza día con día, ya que su mayor deseo es poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos, los cuales puedan estudiar y D. esta manera triunfar en la vida. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero para aumentar sus productos y tener mucha más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes, D. manera que sus ventas aumente y ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales contribuyan a una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Reina Escobar is the widow of V.. She lives in the municipality of Ilopango together with her two adult sons. Reina is 44, and she has her own business. She sells fruits and vegetables on the streets in the eastern zone of the country which is 2 and a half hours from her home. Even though her older son works, it is not enough to be able to pay the household expenses. That’s why Reina works day by day. Her biggest desire is to be able to give her sons a better life. They can then study and become successful in their lives. This is why she is asking for a loan. She will use the loan to buy more produce and have a much greater variety to offer her customers. In doing so her sales will increase, and she will receive greater income to contribute to better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Teodosia es casada, tiene 40 años y 7 hijos, Teodosia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales variados, productos que comercializa en el mercado Nery García.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, maíz, cebada.
Los sueños de Teodosia son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. She is 40 years old and married with 7 children. She travels to various regional fairs to buy grains, which she sells at the Nery García market. Teodosia needs a loan of 1000 sols to buy wheat, maize and barley. She dreams of owning a cart for transporting produce and purchasing a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat, maize and barley

loans.name: Carmentina Lili

texts.es: Carmentina es comerciante individual, ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa, lociones y enchapes para damas, este producto lo distribuye de manera ambulante en la ciudad, ella tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estan cursando los estudios en la universidad y otra esta cursando el 4 grado de primaria, ella toma la iniciativa de dedicarse a este negocio desde hace 15 años, el que le permite generar ingresos para el sustento de su familia, actualmente ella necesita capital para surtir su negocio ya que la demanda de clientes ha crecido y no  cuenta con el capital suficiente. su mayor deseo es poner su propio local donde los clientes puedan llegar a comprar.
texts.en:
Carmentina is a business woman who sells clothing, lotion and costume jewelry for ladies. She is an itinerant saleswoman and has three children, two of whom are in college and the third is in the fourth grade. Carmentina took the initiative 15 years ago to start this business, which permits her to generate income to support her family. At present she needs capital because her business has undergone a growth spurt, the customer demand has increased, and she does not have sufficient capital. Her greatest desire is to have her own premises where customers can come to shop.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, lotion and costume jewelry

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Maximiliana es casada, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Maximiliana vende comida en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de garbanzo, arroz y arveja.
Los sueños de Maximiliana son mejorar su casa y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. She is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She walks around selling food every day at the fresh food market in Ayacucho. Maximiliana needs a loan of 1500 sols to buy chickpeas, rice and peas. She dreams of making improvements to her house and running a store from home.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickpeas, rice and peas

loans.name: Victoria Maria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Victoria es casada, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Victoria vende ropa variada de acuerdo a pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, además Victoria hace tejidos como chompas y otros también a pedido.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y ropa de niños.
Los sueños de Victoria es cambiar de negocio y tener un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. She is 50 years old and married with 2 children. She sells custom-made clothing and knits sweaters and other items also made to order. Victoria needs a loan of 750 sols to purchase pants and children’s clothing. She dreams of switching trades and opening a home restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pants and children's clothing

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Nelva es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Nelva es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Nelva vende mercerías como artículos de limpieza, escobillas, candados, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoria en un mercado de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Nelva junto a su esposo tiene una mototaxi con el cual trabaja su esposo.
Nelva necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de candado, cremas dentales y para la reparación de la mototaxi.
Los sueños de Nelva son tener casa propia y una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Nelva is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She walks the streets every day selling household goods such as cleaning supplies, toilet brushes and padlocks. She and her husband also own a mototaxi, with which her husband makes a living. Nelva needs a loan of 3000 sols to buy padlocks and toothpaste and to perform repairs on the mototaxi. She dreams of having her own house and running a grocery store from home.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of padlocks and toothpaste and mototaxi maintenance

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
La señora Tatiana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias”, vive en el Jr. Trujillo cdra. 06 – Barrió la Merced, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 24 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Se inicio con  S/. 20.00 motivada por su mamá, empezó vendiendo comidas en su misma casa, y poco a poco fue comprando mas enseres, para implementar su negocio. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siendo sus principales clientes  los moradores de la comunidad, vecinos y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, desea invertir en la compra de insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, para una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Ella toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Tatiana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a member of the "Victories" Communal Bank. She lives in the La Merced neighborhood, District of Juanjui, Department of San Martín. She is 24, the mother of two children who are dependents, and lives with her partner. Tatiana started her business with a small contribution from her mother. She began selling meals from her own home, and little by little began buying equipment for her business. She is still working in the same business, with residents of the community, neighbors and friends as her main customers. She has been working with the Bank for two years. With a loan of $500 to be repaid in 6 months, she would like to invest in the purchase of items to use in the daily preparation of foods and to better serve her clients, including sacks of rice, sugar, packaged oils, and chickens, as well as tables, chairs, glasses and pots. Tatiana makes decisions with respect to the earnings of her company. Today she feels like an independent woman, responsible for making her own loan payments. Tatiana gives thanks to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to grow as a person and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale rice, sugar, oils, chickens. Purchase of chairs, glasses, pots.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
la Sra. Blanca se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser pastelitos, tacos, tajaditas de platano fritas, pollo, refrescos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, ella comienza a vender desde las 4 de la tarde todos los dias, ella tiene muchos clientes ya que a la mayoria de ellos les gusta mucho el sabor de sus comidas, por la mañana ella quiere dedicarse a vender ropa en la cual ya compro un fardo pero necesita comprar mas para tener mayor variedad y asi poder tener dos negocios de los cuales ella pueda sacar muchas ganancias para tener una vida descente.
ella ha logrado salir sola con sus hijos ya que su esposo fallecio.
ella solicita el apoyo economico para poder invertir y poder comprar los fardos de ropa usada, tambien necesita comprar ingredientes para la fabricacion de sus golosinas
texts.en:
Blanca sells sweets like cakes, tacos, plantain chips, chicken, and beverages, and has been in this business for 15 years. She begins selling each day at 4:00 in the afternoon. She has many customers because the majority of them like the taste of her meals. In the morning she would like to sell clothing, and she has already purchased one bundle of clothes, but needs to purchase more in order to have a wider selection. It is thus possible to have two businesses from which she can earn a good profit in order to have a decent life. Blanca has managed as a single parent due to the death of her husband. She is requesting economic assistance in order to invest in the purchase of used clothing. She also needs to buy ingredients for making her treats.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages, cups, plates, napkins, meat, potatoes, cabbage, salsa, salt, oil, butter, flour, and tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.  
Karina es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Karina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Karina trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, maíz, trigo.
Los sueños de Karina son tener casa propia y comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Milenia Community Bank. She is 21 years old, lives with her husband, and has a one year old son. Karina travels to the different trade fairs of the region to buy cereals which she later sells at the wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, she works as an assistant in the kitchen of a restaurant. She needs a loan of $500 with which she will buy barley, corn and wheat. Karina's dream is to own her own house and buy a car so her husband can go to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of barley, wheat and corn.

loans.name: Juana Concepción

texts.es: Juana Concepción H. D. M. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en Los Planes D. Rendero junto a su esposo José Roberto M. D. 53 años D. edad, el cuál trabaja como agente aduanero. Juana Concepción posee una cafeteria, en la cual venD. alimentos, bebidas y golosinas, dicho negocio esta ubicado en la aduana D. Ilopango, en el mismo lugar D. trabajo D. su esposo. La señora Juana trabaja día con día para contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda comprar más alimentos para su cafeteria; debido a que Juana goza D. una excelente reputación por ser una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene muchos clientes, pero el deseo D. Juana es el D. aumentar su clientela con el fin D. percibir mayores ganancias, es por ello que solicita el préstamo para poder obtener capital D. trabajo el cual contribuya a la compra D. más productos para su negocio, D. manera que pueda suplir los gustos D. muchas más personas y así obtener mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Juana Concepción H. D. M. is 53 years old and resides in Los Planes D. Rendero with her husband Jose Roberto Mendez who is 53 years of age and who works as a customs agent. Juana Concepción has a cafeteria where she sells food, drinks and candy. Her business is located at the customs' office of Ilopango, in the same place where her husband works. Juana works every day to contribute, along with her husband, to the household expenses. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more food for her cafeteria. Because Juana has an excellent reputation for being a very responsible and hardworking person, she has many customers. However, Juana hopes to increase her customer base in order to increase her profits. She is therefore requesting a loan for working capital so that she can purchase more products for her business and cater to the tastes' of many more people and therefore have more demand.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food supplies for cafeteria.

location.town: Los Planes de Renderos, departamento de San Salvad

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Benigno es socio del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Benigno es casado, tiene 64 años y 7 hijos, Benigno vende ropa variada, mochilas, gorros, de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, sus productos los adquiere de la ciudad de Lima, además Benigno vende ropa en dos ferias de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Benigno necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mochilas, maletines, gorros.
Los sueños de Benigno son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Benigno is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. Benigno is married, 64 years old and has 7 children. Benigno sells various types of clothing, backpacks, and caps with a vending cart in the Santa Clara market. He gets his products from the city of Lima. In addition, Benigno sells clothes at two fairs in the city of Ayacucho. Benigno needs a loan of 1750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of backpacks, satchels and caps. Benigno's dream is to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy backpacks, satchels and caps.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
la Sra. Rosa S. se dedica a la confeccion de ropa para dama, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos estan casados, ella solo se ha quedado con su esposo. gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo logro que sus hijos obtuvieran el titulo de educacion media.
ahora ella se dedica a la confeccion y es la unica fuente de ingresos.
en vista que ella tiene muy buena clientela necesita comprar materia prima para la fabricacion de lo que le encargan y ella no tiene capital suficiente para comprar todos los materiales.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa S. is engaged in sewing women's clothing which she has been doing for several years. She is married and has three children, all of whom are married, so it's just her and the husband now. Thanks to her hard work, her children were able to complete their secondary education. Now she devotes herself to sewing which is her sole source of income. Since she has a very good clientele, she needs to buy the materials to produce the orders they have given her. However, she doesn't have sufficient capital to buy these materials.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, fabrics, thread, felt, buttons, clasp, and shoulder pads.

loans.name: Nora Jeaneth

texts.es:
La Sra. Nora Zaleya se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia  desde hace 8 años , su ubicacion es estrategica ya que no tiene competencia en esa zona, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta cursando educacion primaria en la escuela publica, ella inicio este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y con los ingresos que percibe logra sacar adelante su hogar y lo mas importante es que su negocio queda en su casa de habitacion y asi no descuida a sus hijos.
su mayor deseo es tener un negocio bien surtido para poder ofrecer los mejores productos y asi mejorar sus ingresos logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida,
texts.en:
Nora Zaleya has sold groceries at her own local, home-based store for 8 years now. She strategically selected its location as there is no competition in this area. She is married with 2 children, one of whom is a primary student at a public school. She worked hard to set up this business and maintains her home with her earnings. Her greatest priority is to keep her business running from home so that she doesn't neglect the needs of her children. Her greatest wish is to have a well-stocked store with which to offer the best products, increasing her income and providing a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, butter, soap, eggs, sardines, chicken and coffee

loans.name: Reimera

texts.es:
La señora Reimera, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias”, vive en el Jr. Leticia Nº 691, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 60 años y es madre 04 hijos, todos independientes.

Se inicio con  S/. 20.00 de capital, empezó vendiendo anticuchos de pollo en las  afueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue comprando sus implementos para sus ventas. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta de comidas elaboradas por ella misma, siendo sus principales clientes  los moradores de la comunidad, vecinos y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/2.000.00 que cancelara en un plazo de 06 meses, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Ella toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Reimera, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Reimera belongs to the "Las Victorias" Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Leticia Nº 691, in the District of Juanjui, in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner, is 60 years old and is the mother of 4 children, all of whom are independent. She began with S/ 20.00 in capital and started selling chicken skewers in the area near her house, where, little by little, she started buying supplies for sale. She has been working with the bank for 2 years. Currently, she sells food she makes herself, and her main customers are the residents of the community, her neighbors and friends. With this loan of S/2.000.00 that she will repay within 6 months, she wants to invest in the purchase of materials for for daily food preparatio, such as sacks of rice, sugar, oil packets, chicken and also tables, chairs, glasses and pots in order to set up her business and give better service to her customers. She makes the decisions regarding her business earnings. Today, she feels like an independent woman, more responsible by making her payments. Reimera expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and as a business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale foods (rice, sugar, oils, chicken) and tables, chairs, glasses and pots.

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es: la sra. Maria S. de 65 años de edad, viuda, ella se dedica al lavado de ropa en diferentes casas desde hace 3 años, de esta actividad se sostiene, lo hace 3 veces por semana y cobra $8.00 por dia, asi mismo recibe una pension del Instituto Hodureño de Seguridad Social por la muerte de su esposo de $16.00 mensuales, la cliente necesita un credito para hacerle una mejora a su casa, cambiar tres puertas, repellar una pared y cambiar dos cajas de aguas negras que estan derramando agua, ella es una persona responsable y sociable, es muy querida por sus vecinas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria S. is a 65 year old widow. She has been washing clothes in houses for the past 3 years. She does this 3 times a week, charging $8.00 per day, to support herself. She receives a $16.00 monthly Social Security pension from the Instituto Hodureño for the death of her husband. She needs a loan to make home improvements, change three doors, repair the walls, and change two sewer connections that are leaking water. She is a responsible and friendly person who is much loved by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cement, sand, lime, water, stones, bricks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Maria del Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Laureles II” vive en el Jr. Ahuasiyacu Nº 595, del distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente y tiene 41 años; es madre de 02 hijos, 01 que todavía dependen de ella. 

Por iniciativa propia,  inició su negocio de venta de frutas como maracuyas, papayas, zapotes (fruta de la zona), con un primer crédito de S/ 300.00 soles.  Instaló un pequeño puesto en el mercado de su localidad.

En la actualidad se dedica a la Venta de Manualidades, que los ofrece a sus amigos y vecinos, trabaja también con pedidos de su clientela.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200.00 que será cancelado en 04 meses, invertirá en la compra de hilos para tejer en diferentes colores y por docenas, así como insumos para darle la calidad y el acabado a sus productos  de tal manera que pueda tener variedad de modelos para ofrecer a su clientela.

Maria del Pilar, refiere que el Banco Comunal es una excelente propuesta para las mujeres que desean trabajar y progresar.
texts.en:
Maria del Pilar belongs to "Los Laureles II" Communal Bank and lives at Jr. Ahuasiyacu Nº 595, in the district of la Banda de Shilcayo, in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner and is 41 years old; she is the mother of 2 children, 1 of whom still depends on her.
