By her own initiative, she started a business selling fruits like passion fruit, papayas, zapotes (a regional fruit) with her first loan of S/ 300.00 soles. She set up a small stall at the local market. Currently, she sells crafts, which she offers to her friends and neighbors. She also takes requests from her customers. With this loan of S/ 1,200.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of string for knitting in different colors and by the dozen, as well as supplies to assure quality and a finishing touch to her products in such a way that she can produce a variety of models to offer her customers. Maria del Pilar believes that the Communal Bank is an excellent opportunity for women who want to work and advance.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale string.

loans.name: Jose De Los Santos

texts.es:
el sr. Jose de los Santos D. C. cosecha y vende cafe de dos tipos, desde hace mas de 10 años, durante todo este tiempo el ha adquirido mucha experiencia y buena clientela,  de esta manera va saliendo adelante con su negocio y lograr darle bienestar a su familia.
el esta casado y tiene una hija de 4 años la cual esta en la preparatoria de un kinder de esta localidad, con los ingresos de su negocio comple con todos los gastos familiares y las obligaciones financieras que tiene.
el solicita un credito ya que necesita capital para trabajo y diversificar su negocio, comprar mas producto y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y por lo tanto mejorar su ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. José de los Santos D. C. has been harvesting and selling two types of coffee for more than 10 years, and during this time he has acquired much experience and good clients. This way he is moving ahead with his business and is successful in offering well-being to his family.

He is married with a 4 year-old daughter who attends a local kindergarten. With the income from his business he covers the family expenses and his financial obligations. He requests a loan as he needs work capital, to diversify his business, buy more products, and meet his clients' demands and thus increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pergamino coffee and mantequilla coffee.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Libertad  inicia su cuarto ciclo con 18 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, panes, frutas, comidas, lencería, jugos D. frutas, tubérculos, abarrotes en general y ropa.

Como es el caso D. Edith que es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Edith tiene un puesto en el mercado Carmen Alto en donD. venD. papa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Por otro lado Herminia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Herminia venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas.

Mientras que Eugenia es casada, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo, Eugenia se dedica a la venta D. mercerías, D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles,  600soles haciendo un total D. 10,250 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, fideo, golosinas, muebles, galoneras, trigo, maíz, frutas, ropa y papa. 

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, tener un loca propio, construir su casa y surtir con mas productos sus negocios.
texts.en:
The "Libertad" Communal Bank begins its fourth cycle with 18 members. The members have different business, such as the sale of cereals, breads, fruit, food, linen goods, fruit juice, tubers, general groceries and clothing. Edith has a live-in partner, is 33 years old and has 3 children. She has a stall at the Carmen Alto market where she sells various types of potatoes, an activity that she does every day. Herminia, who has a live-in partner, is 35 years old and has 2 children. She sells food from a vending cart in the Magdalena market, an activity that she does every day in the mornings. Eugenia is married, is 35 years old and has 1 son. She sells merchandise from a vending cart in the Magdalena market. The members need different loan amounts, such as 300, 450 and 600 soles, making a total of 10,250 soles in loans from the Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, candies, furniture, gallon jugs, wheat, corn, fruit, clothing and potatoes. The dream of the members is to improve their businesses, to have their own sites, to build their own houses and to offer a greater assortment of products in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, candies, furniture, gallon jugs, wheat, corn, fruit, clothing and potatoes.

loans.name: María Celia García

texts.es: María Celia G. de 48 años de edad, reside en Ahuachapán junto a sus tres hijos una nuera y una nieta. A pesar de esto María Celia trabaja únicamente para sostener a dos de sus hijos los cuales son menores de edad y se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee un negocio en el cual vende tortas, panes, sodas, golosinas y frutas, en todos los alrededores de Ahuachapán, ya que posee varios carretones en los cuales distribuye sus productos. María Celia tiene más de 13 años de trabajar de esta manera, logrando expandirse por todos los alrededores del lugar. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio, ya que como madre soltera se esfuerza día con día para llevar el sustento para sus hijos y poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar, es por esto que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo en su negocio y poder brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Celia G. is 48 years old and resides in Ahuachapán with her three children, a daughter-in-law and a granddaughter. Despite this, Maria Celia works only to support two of her children who are minors and are in school. She owns a business where she sells cakes, breads, sodas, candy and fruit, all around Ahuachapán. She has several carts from which she distributes her products. María Celia has been working this way for more than 13 years and has been able to expand her business to the surrounding areas. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest more in her business. As a single mother, she strives every day to support her children and be able pay the household expenses. This is why her greatest desire is to continue to expand her business and be able to provide a better life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products to sell from her carts.

loans.name: Melva

texts.es:
La señora Melva, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Laureles II”, vive en el Jr. José Carlos Mariategui Nº 152, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 47 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.

Inicio su negocio con  un primer préstamo de S/. 200.00, por iniciativa propia  y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en pequeñas cantidades.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, situada en su misma casa.

Con este préstamo de S/1,000.00 que pagara a un  plazo de 04  meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Melva, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Melva belongs to "Los Laureles II” Communal Bank and she lives at Jr. José Carlos Mariategui Nº 152, in the District of la Banda de Shilcayo, in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner, is 47 years old and is the mother of 3 children, 1 of whom still depends on her. She began her business with her first loan of S/ 200.00, by her own initiative, and with the support of her husband, she launched her own business selling groceries in small quanitites. Currently, she continues with the same business, which is run out of her own home. With this loan of S/ 1,000.00 that she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of more products to diversify her business, such as rice and sugar in sacks, toilet paper packs, milk, boxes of canned fish, personal hygiene and home cleaning supplies, soda packs and various products to keep her customers happy. She is the one who makes decisions regarding the earnings of her business. Personally, she feels more independent, self-assured and responsible by making her payments. Melva expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items: rice, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc. All wholesale.

loans.name: Yanapampa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Yanapampa  inicia su tercer ciclo con 13 socias, todas las socias son D. L. comunidad del mismo nombre.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. cereales, cochinilL., animales menores, tara, tubérculos, verduras y abarrotes en general.

Como es el caso D. Bertha es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Bertha viaja a diferentes pueblos D. su zona en donD. compra animales, que luego los transporta a L. feria D. L. ciudad D. Huanta y en algunas oportunidades beneficia los animales y lo venD. en su comunidad.

Por otro lado Rayda es casada, tiene 41 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con elL., Rayda viaja a L. selva ayacuchana en donD. venD. animales como gallinas, cuy. Además Rayda se dedica a L. crianza D. gallinas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles haciendo un total D. 11,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, fideo, gallina, oveja, animales menores, cochinilL..

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener capital propio y ahorrar mas.
texts.en:
The Yanapampa Communal Bank begins its third cycle with 13 members, and all of its members are from the community with the same name. The members have different businesses, such as selling cereal, cochinilL. (a red dye), small animals, tara (a powder used in tanning), tubers, vegetables and general groceries. Bertha lives with her partner, is 24 years old and has 3 children. Bertha travels to different towns in her area where she buys animals that she later transports to the fair in the city of Huanta and sometimes she prepares them for sale in her community. Rayda is married, is 41 years old and has 8 children, 4 of whom live with her. Rayda travels to the Ayachucan forest where she sells animals such as hens and guinea pigs. In addition, Rayda raises hens. The members need loans of different amounts, such as 300, 600 and 900 soles, making a total of 11,200 soles in loans from the Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, hens, sheep, small animals and cochinilL.. The members' dream is to improve their businesses, to see their children become professionals, to have their own capital and to save more.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, noodles, chicken, sheep, small animals, cochinilla (to make red dye).

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias”, vive en el Jr. Las Caobas – Santa Rosa, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos, todos independientes.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de plásticos.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, ubicada en su misma casa; donde vende a sus clientes y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00 que pagara a un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como bandejas, baldes, vasos de vidrio, platos y tazas  de loza y descartables,  bacines y  productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Maribel, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel belongs to "Banco Comunal "Las Victorias". She lives in Jr. Las Caobas - Santa Rosa, District of Juanjui, Department of San Martin. She is single, 42 years old and a mother of 2 children, both independent. With the first loan of S/.300.00 she was able to start her business selling plastic items. At the present she continues with the same business located at her house where she sells to clients and friends.

With this loan of S/.1,800.00, to be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in buying more products for her business such as trays, buckets, glasses, china plates and cups as well as disposables, pots, and a variety of products to keep her clients happy. In her business she makes the decisions about the earnings. Personally she tells us she is more sociable, more secure and responsible with the repayments. Maribel is thankful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic, glass, and disposable items.

loans.name: Yamileth Argentina

texts.es:
la Sra. Yamileth R. se dedica al comercio , ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de juguetes y ropa denominado ALFA Y OMEGA desde hace mas de 6 años tiene su negocio, lo que le ha permitido adquirir una buena experiencia y buena clientela permitiendole de esta manera permanencia y exito en su negocio, ella es casada y tiene un hijo el cual esta en la preparatorio de un kinder de la ciudad de danli.
con los ingresos que tiene suple todos los gastos de su hijo, tambien le ayuda a su esposo para salir adelante con su hogar, a la vez ella es pasante de la carrera de pedagogia en el sistema de educacion a distancia,una de sus metas es poder graduarse de la universidad y asi tener una buena preparacion academica para poder aplicar a un trabajo fijo, y siempre tener su negocio, ella solicita el credito para poder comprar mercaderia y asi poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yamileth R. is a businesswoman. She has a small shop called ALFA Y OMEGA, whers she has been selling toys and clothing for more than 6 years. She has acquired experience and good clients which has allowed her to continue and be successful in her business. She is married and has a son who attends a kindergarten in the town of Danli.

With the income she makes up for the expenses of her son, and she also helps her husband with the family expenses. She studied pedagogy of distance learning and is a candidate for graduation and one of her goals is to get the university degree and with a solid academic prepartion be able to apply for a stable job as well as to keep her business. She requests the loan in order to buy merchandise and thus be able to stock up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys, summer garments, sandals, and cuddle toys.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
La señora Marivel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias”, vive en el Jr. La Merced Nº 931 – La Merced, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los dos que aun dependen de ella.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 decidió emprender su negocio propio y empezó confeccionando vestidos, en su propia casa.

En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos de electrodomésticos, su negocio se ubica en un ambiente acondicionado en su propia casa, siendo sus principales clientes sus amigos y vecinos; también trabaja con algunas instituciones. 

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelara a un plazo de 06  meses, comprara más repuestos de televisores, radios, dvs, computadoras, insumos que le van a permitir atender con calidad y eficiencia a sus clientes. 

Ella y su esposo, toman las decisiones en las compras y  ganancias de su negocio, se siente más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Marivel, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Marivel belongs to the “Las Victorias” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. La Merced Nº 931 – La Merced, Juanjui district, San Martín department. She is married, 36 years old, and mother of 2 children who are still dependent upon her. With her first loan for S/.1,300.00 she decided to start her own business and she began to make clothing in her own home. Today she buys and sells parts for small electrical domestic appliances. Her business is located in an air conditioned room in her home. Her main clients are her friends and neighbors. She also works with some institutions. With the loan for S/2,000.00, which will be repaid for 6 months, she will buy more television parts, radios, dvs, computers, and supplies that will allow her to service her customers with quality and efficiency. She and her husband make the purchasing and earnings decisions together. She feels more assured in offering her products; she considers herself a hardworking woman, steady and responsible with her loan payments. Marival expresses her thanks to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a business entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for televisions, radios and computers.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: el sr. Miguel Z. tiene 24 a@os de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de bloques de concreto para la construccion de casas, este producto tiene mucha demanda en la zona ya que la mayoria de las contrucciones emplean este material por ser mas economico y resistente. el sr. Z. nos manifesto que este negocio es de mucha bendicion ya que le ha generado ingresos apra suplir gastos personales y las obligaciones financieras que ha contraido. nos esta solicitando el apoyo crediticio ya que necesita producir mas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Z. is 24 years old and he makes and sells concrete blocks used in the construction of houses. This product is in great demand in his area as the majority of the construction uses this material because it is economical and sturdy. Mr. Z. tells us that this business is a blessing as it has generated income to cover his personal expenses and financial obligations that he has. He is asking for our support for a loan as he needs to produce more in order to satisfy the demands of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement and sand

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto G. G., reside en la colonia Las Viñas junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de 11 años. Mario de 33 años de edad posee un negocio de venta de madera el cual esta ubicado en su casa de residencia. Debido a que Mario es el unico que trabaja en su hogar, el solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más madera, de manera que pueda tener más materia prima que vender y así obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales contribuyan a que el pueda ser capaz de brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, como alimentación, vestimenta y estudios, es por ello que Mario desea mejorar las ventas de su negocio y poder brindarles una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto G. G. resides in the Las Viñas neighborhood with his wife and his three children who are under the age of 11. Mario is 33 years old and has a business selling wood which he sells from his house. Since Mario is the only one in his home who works, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy more wood so that he can have more raw material to sell and obtain higher profits. His profits will allow him to provide the necessities to his children, such as food, clothing and an education. This is why Mario wants to improve the sales of his business so that he can provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood.

loans.name: Ivan Arnulfo

texts.es: el joven Ivan M. se dedica al negocio de transporte de personas en su taxi usando la ruta de barrio abajo - la sagastume, desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, tambien se dedica a dar clases de musica por las tardes en una escuela de la capital, es una persona bien comprometida con Dios. el necesita el credito para poder arreglar su unidad de trabajo y asi poder darles un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ivan M. works in transportation; he has driven his taxi along a route in the lower neighborhood of La Sagastume for approximately three years. He also teaches music classes in the afternoons in a school in the capital, and is very committed to God. Ivan needs a loan to fix his work vehicle, so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare motor parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Jessica

texts.es:
La señora M. Jessica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias” vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru – Psje. Nº 27 de Octubre, del Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente y tiene 31 años; es madre de 01 hijo.

Se inicio con S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, vendiendo prendas de vestir. Tiene 06 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, los mismos que ofrece a sus clientes y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,100.00 que será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará ropas interiores de todas las tallas, modelos y colores en docenas, de tal manera que pueda tener variedad para ofertar a su clientela, también invirtió comprando cosméticos de diferentes líneas.

M. Jessica, refiere que el Banco Comunal es una excelente propuesta para las mujeres que desean trabajar y progresar.
texts.en:
M. Jessica is a member of the "Victories" Communal Bank. She lives in the Jr. Tupac Amaru, Juanjui District, Department of San Martín. She is 31, the mother of one son, and lives with her partner. She began her business with a small sum of her own money, selling items of clothing. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 6 years. She is currently in the same line of business, offering her services to clients and friends. With this loan of $375 to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy underwear in all sizes, styles and colors by the dozen so that she will be able to offer a variety to her clients. She will also invest in the purchase of different lines of cosmetics. M. Jessica notes that the Communal Bank, a partner of Kiva, is an excellent vehicle for allowing women to work and to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of underwear at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es: la joven Emelina P. tiene 30 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra casada, fruto de ese matrimonio tiene una hermosa hija de 1 año de edad, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este rubro el cual es muy bueno y rentable para ella porque en la colonia donde ella vive no hay muchas pulperias y esto hace que mucha poblacion le compre a ella, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia ya que no se da abasto con todas las exigencias que tiene de todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emelina P. is 30 years old and married, with a beautiful one-year-old daughter resulting from this marriage. She has been in the same line of business for three years. It has been good and profitable for her because there are very few local stores in the area where she lives, which results in the community shopping frequently at her store. Emelina needs a loan to buy merchandise, given that she does not currently have enough inventory to satisfy the needs of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, soft drinks, juices, snacks, cookies, lard, oil, coffee, bread, soap, and toilet paper.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Villa Hermosa De Cusi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Villa Hermosa D. Cusi pertenece a un proyecto especial exclusivamente para productores, los socias son D. la comunidad D. Cusi, distrito D. Ocros, Provincia D. Huamanga, La comunidad se ubica al borD. del río Pampas, este río viene a ser el limite con el departamento D. Apurimac.

Las actividades principales D. la comunidad son el cultivo D. frutas como naranja, papaya, palta, mangos, tomate, maíz, además se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores y ganadería. Los productores D. la comunidad D. Cusi veran resultados el resultado se su cocecha en 12 meses, es por ello que pagarán su préstamo en 1 año.

Prudencio es socio del Banco Comunal, es casado, tiene 8 hijos, se inicio con el cultivo D. paltas hace 3 años que es mas rentable, además su esposa tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, su préstamo será invertido en el abonamiento D. los paltos y para la tienda D. su esposa.

Por otro lado Lucila es viuda, tiene 3 hijos que son mayores D. edad, Lucila también tiene 60 paltos en producción, y 50 paltos que recién tienen 2 años, su préstamo invertirá para sus plantaciones.

Los sueños D. los socios es mejorar la producción D. sus paltos y exportar sus productos.
texts.en:
The Hermosa D. Cusi Communal Bank is part of a special project exclusively for producers. The members are from the community of Cusi in the Ocros district of the Huamanga province. The community is located at the edge of the Pampas river which also serves as the border of the state of Apurimac. The main activities of the community are cultivating fruits such as oranges, papayas, avocado, mangos, tomatoes and corn. In addition, they raise small animals and cattle. The producers of Cusi will see the results of their harvest in 12 months and because of this they will repay their loan in one year. Prudencio is a member of the Communal Bank and is married with eight children. He started growing avocados three years ago because it was more profitable and his wife has a grocery shop. He will put his loan towards fertilizing the avocado trees and her husband's shop. Lucila, on the other hand, is a widow with three grown children. She also has 60 producing avocado trees and 50 more that are two years old. Her loan will go towards her plantations. The member's dreams are to improve the yield of their avocado trees and export their products.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Somos Catrachos Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario somos catrachos esta integrado por tres clientes, todos tienen negocios en barrios muy cerca del mercado, se conocen muy bien, la sra. Etelvina M. tiene un puesto de abarroteria en el mercado de nacaome , de ella dependen 5 hijos, ella tiene 57 años de edad y radica en la aldea el chorro, goscoran, valle. ella necesita el credito apra comprar mas productos que vende, ella necesita surtir su negocio ya que las exigencias de los clientes son muchas y rapido se queda sin unos productos que tienen mucha demanda.
la sra. Bernarda R. tiene 48 año de edad ella radica en el barrio brisas del sur, tiene 3 dependientes, su esposo don concepcion villalobos es zapatero y el repara zapatos en el mercado, los dos juntos se ayudan para salir adelante con su hogar, ella realiza la venta de refrescos y leña, esta la vende en la colonia donde vive, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos, el sueño de los dos es tener una zapateria en su casa de habitacion.
la sra. Maria Villalobos tiene 20 años de edad y vive en el barrio suyapa desde hace 10 años, es soltera y se dedica a la satreria y venta de ropa, ella necesita el credito para comprar telas, hilos, broches, zipers,, su deso es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The supportive group "We are Hondureños" consists of three clients who have businesses in neighborhoods very close to the market and are well known there. Etelvina M. has a job in a grocery store in the Nacaome market. She is 57 with five dependent children. She is settled in the small village of El Chorro in the Goascoran Valley. She needs this loan in order to buy more products to sell. She needs to stock her business well, given that her clients' demands are many and she quickly runs out of in-demand products. Bernarda R. is 48 and is settled in the Brisas del Sur neighborhood with three dependents. Her husband, Don Concepcion Villalobos, is a cobbler who repairs shoes in the market. The two together help each other with household responsibilities. Bernarda sells soft drinks and firewood in the colony where she lives. She needs this loan to buy more soft drink inventory. The couple's shared dream is to have a shoe repair shop in the house where they live. Maria Villalobos is 20 years old and has lived in the Suyapa neighborhood for 10 years. She is single and works as a tailor and also sells clothes. She needs this loan to buy materials, thread, snap fasteners, zippers, etc. She hopes to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and soft drinks, firewood, sewing supplies and clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Rubi inicia su ciclo 39 con 22 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, combustibles, carne, abarrotes en general, ropa, verduras, quesos, mercería y frutas.

Como es el caso D. Yovana que es soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Yovana se dedica a la venta D. muebles en la feria dominical D. San Juan, los muebles los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima.

Por otro lado Yaneth es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Yaneth tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa ubicada en la Selva Ayacuchana, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Mientras que Luisa es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Luisa tiene su establo en la comunidad D. Chiara, produce leche y queso que venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1050 soles haciendo un total D. 13,650 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, fideo, golosinas, muebles, galoneras, verduras, trigo, maiz, quinua, frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener un local propio, mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su establo.
texts.en:
The Rubi Communal Bank is starting its 39th cycle with 22 members. The members do different types of business such as the sale of cereals, fuels, meats, groceries, clothing, vegetables, cheeses, notions and fruits. Yovana is a thirty year old single mother with one son. She works selling furniture that she buys in Lima at the Sunday market in San Juan. Yaneth, also single, is 27 years old with one son. She has a grocery shop in her house, located in Selva Ayacuchana, where she works full time. Meanwhile, Luisa is 38 years old, has three children and lives with her partner. Luisa has a stable in the community of Chiara where she produces milk and cheese. She sells her products at the city food market. The members need different loan quantities such as; 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles and 1050 soles totaling 13,650 soles or $4,375 in loans from the Communal Bank. The money will be used to buy rice, pasta, candy, furniture, vegetables, wheat, corn, quinoa, water containers and fruits. The member's dreams are to have their own location, to improve their business, see their children become professionals and expand their stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, pasta, candy, furniture, vegetables, wheat, corn, quinoa, water containers and fruits.

loans.name: Luz Elminda

texts.es:
La señora  Luz Elminda pertenece al Banco Comunal  “PEQUEÑAS EMPRESARIAS II”, vive en el Pasaje San Jorge Nº 28  Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es  separada de su esposo  tiene dos hijas a su cargo.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, empezó vendiendo plastiquerìa ( artículos de plásticos como baldes, jarras, platos, tazones) en los pueblos cercanos  de Tarapoto. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la Venta de ollas artesanales elaboradas a base de arcilla, como también ropa interior y polos  para damas y caballeros. Sus principales clientes son los  moradores de la comunidad  de Lamas, Cacatachi lugares cercanos a la capital de la provincia.

Con este préstamo de S/  1,000.00 que cancelara en un plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá, comprando al por mayor 24 cocinas artesanales, ropas de niños y caballeros  que son pedidos de sus clientes. 

Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, desea ampliar más su negocio y construir cuartos para alquiler  y se  siente más segura con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Luz Elminda manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Luz Elminda is a member of the Communal Bank "Little Businesswomen II" and lives on San Jorge Street in the District of Tarapoto, Department of San Martín. She is separated from her spouse and has two children in her care. With her first loan of $100, she began selling plastics (including buckets, jars, plates, and bowls) in the towns near Tarapoto. She has been working with the Communal Bank for two years. She currently works selling artisanal pots created with clay, as well as underwear and polo shirts for men and women. Her principal clients are residents within communities near the capital of Lamas and Cacatachi. With a loan of $325 to be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of 24 artisanal cookers as well as children's and men's clothing per her clients' requests. She makes the majority of the decisions regarding her business and its earnings. Luz Elminda's personal goals are to: build her business, construct rooms to rent, and feel more confident in her ability to make her loan payments. Luz Elminda expresses her thanks to Kiva partner Manuel Ramos for allowing her the opportunity to grow as a businesswoman and as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of artisanal cookers and children's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Judith es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Judith se dedica a la agricultura de verduras, que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, además Judith tiene una tienda en su casa.
Judith necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.
Los sueños de Judith son aumentar su negocio y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Manantial Communal Bank. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. Judith works growing vegetables which she later sells at market in the city and she also has a shop in her house. Judith needs a loan of $500 to buy rice, sugar, and milk. Judith's dreams are to grow her business and for her children to get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Carlota es conviviente, 27 años y estudia contabilidad, Carlota tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, carnes, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su pareja.
Carlota necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar.
Los sueños de carlota son ampliar su negocio, ser mayorista y culminar sus estudios de contabilidad.
texts.en:
Carlota is a member of the Manantial Communal Bank. She is 27 years old and studies accounting. Carlota runs a store out of her house selling groceries, meats and vegetables. With the help of her partner she keeps the store open seven days a week. Carlota needs a loan of $300 to buy rice, pasta, and sugar. Her dreams are to see her business grow, become a wholesaler and complete her accounting studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Alicia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Vida II”, vive en el Jr. 1ero. de Abril  s/n D.  Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos que dependen de ella.

Se inicio con S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendió su negocio. En la actualidad se dedica a la confección de vestidos, que los ofrece a sus clientes y amigos conocidos, también trabaja con pedidos de su clientela.

Con el préstamo de S/1,200.00 que cancelara en 04 meses, desea invertir comprando telas de algodón y de licra en metros; también hilos en diferentes colores, blondas, elásticos insumos necesarios  para confeccionar ropas interiores en tallas y modelos para damas,  caballeros y niños.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, en lo personal, nos cuenta que también desea implementar su negocio con un taller más grande y establecido.

Maria Alicia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Maria Alicia belongs to the community bank "Sowing life II" and lives in Jr. 1 de Abril s/n of the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martin state. She is married, 38 years old, and a mother of 3 children, all of whom she supports. She started her business with S/ 300 of her own money and the support of her husband. Currently, she makes dresses that she offers to her customers and friends. She also accomodates the custom orders of her clientele. With a loan of S/ 1,200, to be paid in 4 monthly payments, she would like to invest in the purchase of cotton and spandex material, as well as threads of different colors, silk, and elastics to make undergarments in different sizes and styles for women, men, and children. Maria makes her own business decisions and her personal goal is to expand her business to be much larger and established. Maria Alicia expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and threads at wholesale

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: la sra Rosa Gutierrz es una persona que se dedica al alquiler de apartamentos desde hace mucho tiempo, con este trabajo pudo salir adelante ella y su hija ya que es viuda, ella se levanta muy temprano para asear los apartamentos y el solar a la sra. tambien le gusta criar gallinas y plantas, tiene muchas plantas en sus apartamentos, ella es una persona muy humilde y le tienen mucho aprecio, ya que ella atiende bien a sus inquilinos, ella tiene pensado construir y arreglar unos apartamentos que estan deteriorados, y por esto es que esta solicitando un credito
texts.en:
Rosa G. has made a living renting out apartments to help maintain herself and her widowed daughter for a long time now. She gets up very early to tidy the apartments and the backyard. She also likes to raise hens and grow plants; there is a good deal of greenery in her apartments. She is a very humble individual and her tenants hold her in high esteem, as she is attentive to their needs. She has it in mind to build and refurbish some run-down apartments, for which she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, brick sand and gravel

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tools and other hardware to expand her business

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 46 años y 3 hijos, Carmen tiene una peluquería llamada Gaby, su local esta ubicado en una avenida céntrica además cuenta con un personal. También Carmen se dedica a L. venta D. cosméticos por catálogos.
Carmen necesita un préstamo D. 750 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. champú, colonias y joyas.
Los sueños D. carmen son que sus hijos sean profesionales y equipar su salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Manantial Communal Bank. Carmen lives with her partner, is 46 years old, and has three children. She owns a hairdressing salon called Gaby which is located on a centrally situated avenue and has one employee. Carmen also works selling cosmetics by catalog. She needs a $250 dollar loan to buy shampoo, cologne and jewelry. Her dreams are to fully equip her beauty salon and have her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shampoo, cologne and jewelry.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda Gómez G. es una señora que tiene dos hijos ya había tenido un préstamo el cual pago muy bien. Anteriormente su proyecto era para construcción del cuarto de enfrente pero le dio prioridad al baño ya que el otro era de poso y también cambio el techo de un cuarto por que cuando llovía se goteaba y se le mojaba todos sus muebles. 
Ahora que ya arreglo esos detalles desea terminar su cuarto para ampliarse ya que cuando crezcan sus hijos van a necesitar privacidad.
Ella trabaja para el gobierno del municipio cuidando personas adultas (acilo de ancianos) y su esposo como intendente de una escuela primaria.
texts.en:
Griselda G. G., who has two children, previously received a loan that she promptly paid back. With that loan (originally meant to be used to build a front room), she gave priority to fixing the bathroom and also to replacing the roof over the room because water leaks would get her furniture wet. Now that those improvements are complete, she would like to complete the room to expand the space in her home, and therefore allow her children some privacy when they get older. She works for the municipal government taking care of the elderly and her husband runs a primary school.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase housing material and labor.

loans.name: Jose Ibraham

texts.es: el sr. Jose C. tiene 60 años de edad es casado con la sra. Santos Cabrera con la cual procreo dos hijos los cuales estan en los Estados Unidos, el tiene 4 nietos, el se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en la cual le va muy bien, tiene 5 años de tenerla y necesita el credito para poderla surtir, quiere comprar pollo, arroz, azucar, jabon, manteca, su deseo es tener una bodega grande en su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose C., 60, is married to Mrs. Santos Cabrera. They have two children who live in the United States. He has 4 grandchildren. He sells popular consumable items. He has had a mini market for 5 years, and he does very well. He needs a loan to be able to increase his stock. He wants to buy chicken, rice, sugar, ham, and lard. He would like to have a large grocery store in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy hams, soft drinks, churros, candies, rice, sugar, coffe, cinnamon, bread, cookies, salsas, spaghetti, soups, sardines, lard, oil, butter, eggs, tortillas.

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Leonilda es casada, tiene 65 años y 9 hijos, Leonilda se dedica a realizar bellos tejidos, como colchas, chompas, ropa de bebe, dependiendo de los pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Lima  y Selva.
Leonilda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos y lanas.
Los sueños de Leonilda son mejorar su negocio y su salud.
texts.en:
Leonilda is a member of Banco Comunal El Roble. Leonilda is 65 years-old, married, and has 9 children. She dedicates herself to knitting and sewing beautiful pieces of work such as bedspreads, sweaters, baby clothes (depending on her clients' orders). She sells these items in both Lima and Selva. Leonilda needs a loan of 1000 soles that she will invest to buy thread and wool. Leonilda would like to improve both her business and her health.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread and wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell baby clothes

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith R. Pérez y  Juan Gilberto Martínez es un matrimonio muy joven que obtuvo una vivienda  por medio del gobierno esta es de  interés social. Al obtener esta casa fue pensando en el patrimonio de su único hijo el cual tiene 1 año de edad. La joven ya ha tenido crédito aquí en esta institución por lo que pago muy bien este préstamo por lo que utilizo para poder adquirir la casa que ya tiene. Ahora su mayor prioridad es poner protecciones  en las ventanas para dar más seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Edith R. P. and Juan Gilberto Martinez, who have been recently married, purchased their home through a government social program. They have continued to focus their attention on the well-being of their one-year old child. They have established credit with this institution because they promptly paid back the loan they received to purchase the house. Now their primary objective is to place protective barriers on the windows to provide greater security for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase protective barriers

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Cirila es casada, tiene 54 años y 1 hijo, Cirila viaja a diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. golosinas y hoja D. coca para lo cual cuenta con autorización, las golosinas los venD. por mayor.
Cirila necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. caramelo y hoja D. coca.
Los sueños D. Cirila son tener una tienda estable y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of Banco Comunal El Roble. Cirila is 54 years-old, married, and has one child. She travels to various regional fairs where she sells candy (in wholesale) and coca leaves (for which she has authorization). Cirila needs a loan of 3000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of candies and coca leaves. Cirila wants to have a stable business and increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candies and coca leaves

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa de José Guadalupe lña señora Juanita Rodriguez Pecina. La razón por la que el no aparece es por que no se encontraba ya que trabaja todo el día.
José Guadalupe Martínez C. con un anterior préstamo que le otorgaron, empezó la construcción de un cuarto el cual con los costos de material y pago de mano de obra no le alcanzo para poner el techo de su casa. Ahora el vuelve a recurrir con nosotros pidiendo el apoyo para poder terminar su proyecto y extenderse a la parte de enfrente de su vivienda.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the picture is Juanita Rodriguez Pecina, the wife of Jose Guadalupe Ina. The reason for which he is not in the picture is because he works all day. With a previous loan, Jose Guadalupe began the construction of a room. Due to the costs of labor and material, he did not have enough money to put a roof over his house. He requests further support to be able to finish his project and extend the front portion of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase housing materials

loans.name: Elva Nelly

texts.es:
Elva es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble..
Elva es soltera, tiene 31 años , Elva viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende golosinas al por mayor y menor, además Elva embolsas bocaditos de maíz con juguetes, productos que vende por mayor.
Elva necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de caramelos y galletas.
Elva sueña con tener una tienda mayorista de golosinas.
texts.en:
Elva is a member of the El Roble Communal Bank. She is 31 years old and single. Elva travels to various regional markets where she sells candy both retail and wholesale. She also packages savory corn snacks with toys, which she sells wholesale. Elva needs a loan of 1250 soles which will be invested to buy candy and cookies. Elva dreams of having a wholesale candy store.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy and cookies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo tienen un taller mecánico para carros, además Carmen vende repuestos variados, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alternadores y arrancadores.
Los sueños de Carmen son tener una tienda de repuestos y ampliar el taller mecánico.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the El Roble Communal Bank. Carmen is 35, married, and has three children. Carmen owns an auto service garage with her husband, and also sells various spare parts that she acquires throughout Lima. Carmen needs a loan of 1250 soles, which will be invested to buy alternators and starters. Carmen's dream is to have a spare parts store and to expand the garage.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alternators and starters

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan Manuel C. le está haciendo falta la elaboración de la losa en el patio trasero. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que le realizara la construcción. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para llevar acabo la elaboración de la losa ya que el trabaja todo el día y su casa está sola y quiere que esté mas segura.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel C. has a house but the wall in the rear patio hasn't been finished. He doesn't have the necessary funds to buy the materials or to pay someone to install them. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so he can have it finished. Now that he is working all the time, the house is unattended and he wants to make it more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building his wall

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende golosinas al por mayor, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad, además Maria viaja a ferias de la región en donde vende ropa y loceria, productos que compra de la ciudad de Tacna.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos.
Los sueños de Maria son comprar un carro para distribuir sus productos y comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the El Roble Communal Bank. She is 40, lives with her partner and has two children. Maria sells candy wholesale at city markets, and also travels to regional markets where she sells clothes and tableware, products she buys in the city of Tacna. Maria needs a loan of 1750 soles, which will be invested to buy cookies and candy. Maria's dream is to buy a car that she can use to distribute her products and to buy land.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies and candy

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier C. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente. El préstamo fue para pagar el enganche de su casa que actual mente está viviendo.
 Ahora nueva mente está solicitando otro crédito para construir un cuarto más al frente de la vivienda. Ya que el y su esposa la señora Mercedes Torres están iniciando un pequeño negocio de abarrotes, el cual ocupando una parte de su casa. 
Es por eso que están solicitando el préstamo para comprar el material y empezar la construcción del cuarto y así tener el negocio se parado de la casa.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier C. has previously obtained a loan from FVP, which he paid back promptly. The loan was to pay off the downpayment on his current home. Now he is requesting a loan to add another room to the front of the house, as he and his wife, Mercedes Torres, are setting up a small grocery business that will take up part of their home. He needs the loan to buy building materials and begin construction to keep business and home separate.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an extra room

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
El señor Artemio P. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente y construyo unos cuartos. Actualmente desea un préstamo para la losa de concreto ya que el techo que tiene actualmente es de madera y esta en muy malas condiciones y desea poner la losa porque es más segura.
 Don Artemio tiene cinco años dedicándose a la fumigación de jardines, este oficio es el ingreso de su familia y con el cual planea pagar esté nuevo crédito. 
Cuando se realizo la visita a la vivienda del señor Artemio el se encontraba trabajando, portal motivo la que nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Mariana Hernández y una de sus hijas quien son las que aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
Artemio P. has previously obtained a loan from FVP with which he built some rooms and which he repaid punctually. Now he is seeking a loan to buy concrete slabs, as his current ceiling is wooden and in very bad condition; he wants to use concrete as it is more secure. Artemio has fumigated gardens for the last five years as his family's main source of income and plans to use his earnings to repay the new loan. When the visit to Artemio's house was carried out he was busy working and so his wife, Mariana Hernández, and one of his daughters attended to us, both of whom appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab construction

loans.name: Umbelina

texts.es:
Umbelina es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Umbelina es casada, tiene 63 años y 6 hijos, Umbelina tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Cáceres en donD. venD. mercerías, que adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Umbelina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. lanas, loceria.
Los sueños D. Umbelina son aumentar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Umbelina is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) Communal Bank. She is 63 years of age, married and has six children. She has a stand in the Mariscal Cáceres market where she sells sewing supplies which she obtains in the city of Lima. She does this every day. Umbelina needs a loan of 1,000 Sols that will be invested in the purchase of woolens and crockery. Umbelina dreams of being able to build up her business and fix up her house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy woolens and crockery

loans.name: Luci Yeni

texts.es:
269, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 49 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Se inicio con S/. 200.00 por iniciativa propia y con el apoyo de su hija mayor comenzó vendiendo frutas y quesos en el mercado.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/2,000.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela, también comprara un andamio, para exhibir e incrementar sus productos.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más Independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Luci Yeni, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Luci Yeni lives in the Juanjui district in the San Martin state. She is married, 49 years old, and a mother of 3 children, 2 of whom she still supports. With start up capital of S/ 200 and the support of her oldest daughter, she started selling fruits and cheeses in the market. Currently, she sells groceries out of her home where her primary clients are friends and neighbors. With this loan of S/ 2,000, to be paid in 6 monthly payments, she will invest in the purchase of more products to grow her business such as rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, fish preservatives, personal hygeine and cleaning products, and other products to maintain customer satisfaction. She will also buy shelving to display and increase her products. Luci makes all of her own business decisions Personally, she would like to be more independent, secure, and responsible with her loan payments. Luci Yeni would like to express her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products such as rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, and more

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Zenovia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Zenovia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, útiles de escritorio, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su esposo.
Zenovia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Zenovia son comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo, aumentar su negocio y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zenovia is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is 30 years old, has 2 children and lives with her partner. Zenovia runs a store from her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, meat and school supplies. She works in her store with the help of her husband. Zenovia is requesting a loan of 2000 soles ($650) to invest in the purchase of milk, rice and sugar. Zenovia dreams of buying a car so her husband can work, expanding her business and providing an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, rice and sugar

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan José G. le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas de su casa, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder poner las protecciones. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder tener su casa más segura ya que el trabaja como oficial de seguridad en turno de la noche, le preocupa la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Jose Garces' home is lacking locks on his windows and doors, but at this time, he does not have the money to install these protections. He is applying for a loan in order to make his home more secure because he works as a security guard during the night and worries about the safety of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of locks

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.es:
Basilisa es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Basilisa es casada y tiene 6 hijos, Basilisa viaja a las ferias y pueblos de la región en donde compra cereales, además Basilisa se dedica a la agricultura de cereales, todos estos productos los comercializa en los mercados de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Basilisa tiene un bar Recreo Chaleco Huanca en donde vende bebidas y comidas típicas de la región.
Basilisa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada.
Los sueños de Basilisa son que sus hijos sean profesionales, implementar un taller de mecánica.
texts.en:
Basilisa is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is married and has 6 children. Basilisa travels to the regional farmers' markets and towns to purchase cereals. She also is a farmer and grows cereal herself. She sells these products in the larger markets in the city of Ayacucho. Basilisa also owns a Bar, Recreo Chaleco Huanca, where she sells drinks and traditional regional food.

Basilisa is requesting a loan of 1500 soles ($500) to invest in the purchase of barley. Basilisa's dreams are that her children obtain good jobs and to start a repair shop.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Katia es soltera, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Katia se dedica a la venta de pescado en la ciudad de Andahuaylas a donde viaja todos los días sábados. Además Katia se dedica a la preparación de jugos de frutas.
Katia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Katia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is 42 years old and is single with 2 children. Every Saturday, Katia travels to the city of Andahuaylas to sell fish. She also makes and sells fruit juices.

Katia is requesting a loan of 1000 soles ($325) to purchase fish. She dreams that her children will obtain good jobs and that her family will become successful.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Raúl S. tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a la reparación de vehículos particulares. Este es el ingreso de su familia y con el cual les está pagando los estudias a sus tres hijos.
Pero a su taller le está haciendo falta un equipo nuevo de mecánico mas moderno y de mejor calidad, en esté momento no tiene el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de equipo, portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para comprar el equipo y así darles el mejor servicio a los vehículos de su clientes.
texts.en:
Raul S. has been repairing vehicles for more than 10 years, which provides the income for his family and the means for which he pays the school bills for his children. However, his workshop is lacking a new piece of equipment that is more modren and of better quality than what he currently has. At this time, he does not have enough money to invest in this equipment, which is the motive for applying for this loan so that he can acquire this equipment and provide a better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Olinda Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Marisol es soltera, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Marisol tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, útiles de escritorio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama y una empleada. Además Marisol viaja a la ciudad de Andahuaylas en donde vende ropa por mayor y menor.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de licores, cuadernos y lapiceros. 
Los sueños de Marisol son ahorrar lo suficiente para el futuro, tener una casa propia y comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is 35 years old and is single with three children. Marisol runs a store from her home where she sells groceries and school supplies with help from her mother and an employee. She also travels to the city of Andahuaylas where she sells clothing both wholesale and for individual purchase.

Marisol is requesting a loan of 900 soles ($300) to purchase liquor, notebooks and pens. Her dreams are to save enough money to secure her future, own her own home and provide a comfortable life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase liquor, notebooks and pens.

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es:
El señor Saúl D. T. desea un préstamo para comprar herramientas de trabajo de mecánica automotriz, ya que las que tiene actualmente se las presto un familiar para que reparara los vehículos de sus clientes. 
Portal motivo solicita el crédito para poder tener su propia herramienta y así darles un mejor servicio a los automóviles de a su clientes. Ya que esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Saul D. T. would like a loan to purchase tools for his auto repair shop because the tools that he currently has are borrowed from a relative so that he could repair his customers' cars. His motive for requesting this loan is to be able to have his own tools so that he can provide a better service to his customers. Moreover, this business is the primary source of income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Alicia es soltera, tiene 69 años y 2 hijos, Alicia vende comida en su casa en donde da pensión, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hija, además Alicia brinda servicio de preparación de comida para diferentes compromisos y eventos.
Alicia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Alicia sueña con prosperar, tener un local estable y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is 69 years old and is single with 2 children. Alicia prepares and sells food from her home with the help of her daughter. She also offers catering services for different engagements and events.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 1500 soles ($400) to purchase rice and sugar. She dreams of being successful, owning a stable establishment and continuing her work.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 64 años y 8 hijos, Alejandrina junto a su esposo tienen un Foto estudio llamado Foto Estudio Q., brindan servicios D. fotografía, filmaciones, revelados D. fotos y además venta D. maquinas fotográficas, DVD.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo D. 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. rollos, papeles.
Los sueños D. alejandrina son mejorar sus negocios, adquirir una mini procesadora digital para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is 64 years old and is married with 8 children. Alejandrina and her husband own a photo studio called Foto Estudio Q.. Their business offers services in photography, filming and photo development. They also sell cameras and DVDs.

Alejandrina is requesting a loan of 3500 soles ($1125) to purchase film and photographic paper. Alejandrina's dreams are to improve her businesses and obtain a small digital processer to use in the photo studio.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase film and photographic paper

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana es ama de casa la cual esta al cuidado de su familia, del hogar y de su esposo el señor Javier; que es empleado de una agencia aduanal en donde cuenta con una antigüedad de 12 años, demostrando una gran responsabilidad y un amor a su trabajo pero sobre todo la lealtad a su empresa. 
Ellos tienen un solo hijo; son una familia muy estable y unida que están tramitando este crédito para la remodelación de su recamara y la colocación del vitropiso en ella, para así tener una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Adriana is a housewife who takes care of her family, the home, and her husband Javier, who has been an employee of the customs agency for 12 years. He has shown great responsibility and love for his job, but above all, a loyalty to his company. They have one son. They are a stable and close knit family who are requesting this loan to remodel their bedroom and install stone flooring so that they can have a more comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel bedroom and install stone flooring

loans.name: Ma. De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Ma. De los Ángeles es viuda y vive solamente con un hijo el cual tiene capacidades diferentes. 
Lo cual hace que la señora María luche día con día y que jamás se de por vencida. 
Ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada junto con accesorios entre otras cosas, negocio al cual se ha dedicado desde hace 20 años. Y ya que quiere comprar mas mercancía y obtener mayores ingresos es por lo que esta solicitando este préstamo.
texts.en:
Ma. De los Ángeles is a widow, and lives alone with her son, who is handicaped. María struggles every day, but does not give in. She has a business selling new and used clothes, as well as accessories. Among other things, Maria has been running this business for 20 years. Now she is requesting a loan with which to purchase more merchandise, and in this way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inversion en mercancia para su venta

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos vive con su esposa la señora Anastacia y son una familia muy unida.
El trabaja para una empresa muy reconocida con una antigüedad de 5 años, su esposa es vendedora independiente de una línea de productos por catalogo, ingresos que contribuyen al patrimonio familiar.
Ellos tiene un proyecto que es el realizar los acabados exteriores de su casita (resanar las paredes) motivo por el que están tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife Anastacia. They are a very close family. He works for a well-known business that has been around for five years. His wife is an independent vendor of a line of products she sells by catalogue, and the income from this is contributed to the family. They have a project, which is to finish the exterior of their house (plaster the walls), which is why they have applied for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve exteriors (plaster exterior walls)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
El señor José Armando labora para un empresa desde hace 8 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, son una familia responsable que le están enseñando a sus hijos a ser personas de gran valor moral. 
Están solicitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en su casita para mayor seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
José Armando has been working for a business for 8 years, and lives with his wife and sons. They are a responsible family that is teaching their children to be very ethical, principled people. They are requesting a loan to build a fence by their house to improve their family's safety.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a fence to make the family safer.

loans.name: David Manuel

texts.es: El señor David Manuel es un microempresario que cuenta con varios años de experiencia en la elaboración y  venta de pan de dulce, el anteriormente tenia una panadería en Barroteran, Coahuila, pero decidió regresar a su lugar de origen y establecerse aquí en Piedras Negras; por el momento esta trabajando en un centro comercial en el área que el se sabe desempeñar, (panadería) pero el motivo por el cual esta tramitando este crédito es  la compra de materia prima (harina, fécula de maíz, etc. ) y así reiniciar su negocio,  ya que cuenta con la maquinaria para la elaboración  del pan y su esposa la señora Patricia se hará cargo de la venta del producto.
texts.en:
David Manuel is a small-businessman who has years of experience making and selling pastries. Before, he had a bakery in Barroteran, Coahuila, but he decided to return to his place of origin and settle there, in Piedras Negras; at the moment, he is working in a mall, which he knows how to do, (bakery) but the reason that he is applying for this loan is so that he can buy raw materials (flour, corn starch, etc. ) and be able to re-start his business. He already has baking equipment, and his wife Patricia will be in charge of selling the products.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise for making pastries

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier y la señora Narda son un matrimonio joven, pero bien establecido que les gusta progresar, sobretodo trabajadores y responsables.
El es mecánico para una empresa desde hace 2 años, ella supervisora de cajas en una tienda de venta de productos para la oficina, juntos tienen un bebe y desean brindarle un mejor hogar, con mejor comodidad y mayor seguridad para la familia, por lo tanto están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su casa.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier and Narda are a young couple, but well established and wanting to progress. They are especially hard-working responsible. Francisco has been a mechanic for two years, and Narda is a business supervisor at an office-supplies store. They have a baby, and they want to raise him in a better home, with better comfort and conveniences, and greater family safety; they are applying for a loan so that they can build a fence out front of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a fence in front of their house

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El señor Héctor López vive con su esposa la señora Isabel  y su hija de mediana edad; el trabaja como mecánico de una Institución Medica desde hace 20 años.
Tienen una hija a la cual le están solicitando el pago de una colegiatura, pago que se realiza cada seis meses; motivo por el cual el señor Héctor al igual que su esposa  están solicitando este crédito ya que desean cubrir este pago y así seguirle proporcionando a su hija un mejor futuro mediante la educación.
texts.en:
Héctor López lives with his wife, Isabel, and their middle-aged daughter; he has been working as a mechanic at an Institución Medica for 20 years. They have a daughter for whom they are requesting school fees, which are payed every six months; this is why Héctor and his wife are requesting this loan, since they wish to cover this cost and continue providing their daughter with a better future by means of education.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying school fees for their daughter

loans.name: Safohucha

texts.ru: Сотрудничество Сафохуча с МикроИнвест продолжается уже несколько лет. Сафохуча и его старшие сыновья занимаются куплей продажей запасных частей для автомобилей и имеют несколько торговых точек. Кроме новых запасных частей они скупают поддержанные и негодные к дальнейшей эксплуатации автомобили и разобрав по частям выносят на продажу. Предпринимательство является основной деятельностью Сафохучи и его сыновей. Самому Сафохуче в этом году исполнилось 60 лет, он женат, имеет 4 детей. На займы полученные в МикроИнвест Сафохуча заметно расширил свой бизнес, и дополнительная торговая точка которую он открыл 2 года назад является заслугой займов МикроИнвест. Недавно он подготовил заявку на новый займ и собирается приобрести новый ассортимент запчастей к автомобилям Опель.
texts.en:
Safohucha has been a Microinvest customer for several years. Safohucha and his older sons buy and sell new and used auto parts at several locations. This is the main business activity for Safohucha and his sons. Safohucha is 60, he is married, and has 4 children. With the help of Microinvest loans, Safohucha noticeably expanded his business and, two years ago, opened an additional sales location. This loan, Safohucha plans to use to purchase Opel auto parts.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare auto parts

loans.name: Sharofboy

texts.ru: Шарофбою 53 года, он женат и имеет 3 детей. Занимается он производством и продажей курута. Курут – это скатанные руками шарики из кислого молока. Шарофбой имеет очень большой опыт в этой деятельности и имеет постоянных клиентов не только в городе, но и далеко за его пределами. В его деятельности ему помогает его жена. Шарофбой планирует немного расширить свой бизнес, так как недавно ему стал помогать его племянник. Полученный займ погасит в течении 2 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharofboy is 53, married, and has 3 children. Sharofboy sells kurut--hand-rolled balls of sour milk. Sharofboy has a lot of experience in his business and has many loyal customers in his town and beyond. Sharofboy's wife helps him in business. Sharofboy plans to expand his business with the help of his nephew. This loan Sharofboy plans to repay within 2 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mustakim

texts.ru: Мустакиму 30 лет, женат и недавно у него родился второй ребенок. Основной его деятельностью является купля продажа скота на скотных рынках Исфаринского района. Вместе с отцом он выезжает на разные рынки искупает мелкий скот. Перепродав на другом рынке извлекает из этого прибыль и расходует на семью. Недавно пришел в МикроИнвест и подал заявку на займ и планирует закупить овец.
texts.en:
Mustakim is 30 years old, he is married and his second child was born just recently. His main business is buying and selling cattle on the markets of the Isfara region. Together with his father they travel to other markets and buy small cattle. Then by reselling on another market he makes a profit and spends on his family. He has recently come to MicroInvest and applied for a loan and plans to buy sheep.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Inomiddin

texts.ru: Иномиддин вместе со своим старшим сыном занимается куплей продажей скота. У него есть профессия – он мясник, поэтому кроме перепродажи имеет торговую точку и продает там мясо. Чтобы извлечь большую прибыль Иномиддин выезжает на оптовые рынки далеко за пределы местожительства и там оптом покупает несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. Если получиться продает скот вживую, а если скот остается то он забивает его и продает в своей лавке. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже 2 года, условиями кредитования доволен, и решил подать новую заявку на займ, чтобы закупить несколько голов бычков.
texts.en:
Inomiddin together with his oldest son is in the business of buying and selling cattle. He is a butcher by profession and besides the resale he also had a vendor space where he sells meat. To get high profits Inomiddin goes out to wholesale markets very far outside of where he lives and buys several heads of cattle in wholesale. If it's possible then he resells the live cattle, but if not then he butchers it and sells in his butcher shop. He has been working with MicroInvest for two years, and is very happy with the loan terms so he decided to apply for a new loan to buy a few heads of calves.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Fotima
