Paula S. G. has her own small grocery store in the Telica district of the city of León. She started her shop nine years ago with the purpose of providing better living conditions to her young children, who really depend on her support.

Today she is looking for the support of a loan from CEPRODEL to purchase merchandise to sell. She is very confident that her request will be granted and she will benefit greatly from it.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Al señor Alejandro S. tiene poco que le entregaron su casa por medio de un crédito gubernamental. Pero le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas, portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar las protecciones y así su familia va estar mas segura cundo el se encuentre trabajando.
texts.en:
Mr. Alejandro S. has a little that was given to him to put into his house through a government loan. But he is lacking gates for his windows and doors. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to be able to pay for the gates and as such his family will be more secure when he finds work.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put gates on the windows and doors of the house

loans.name: Redelinda

texts.es:
La señora Redelinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, vive en el Caserío de San Isidro., Distrito de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos independientes.
Se inicio con S/. 50.00 por iniciativa propia, y emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de Dulces.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de venta de dulces, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, ella trabaja con pedidos de dulces de los distritos como Tocache, Bellavista y Tarapoto.
También recorre los Pueblos más cercanos, donde coloca sus dulces y son cancelados en ese momento.
Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que cancelara a un  plazo de 04  meses, lo invertirá comprando más ingredientes como almidón y azúcar en sacas, manteca en cajas, huevos en javas, harina de maíz suave por kilos, vainillas y colorantes, para la preparación de sus dulces como rosquitas, kekes, biscochuelos, turcas, suspiros, ñutos. .

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, tranquila, capaz y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Redelinda, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ms. Redelinda is a member of the Communal Bank "Corazón de Jesús" ("Heart of Jesus"). She lives in the San Isidro Caserío, San José de Sisa District, San Martín Department. She is 56 years old and is mother of 3 children, who are all independent.

She started with a loan of 50 soles, which she obtained on her own initiative, and started her own business selling sweet things.

Today she continues to sell sweet things. Her business is located in her house, where her most important clients are neighbors and friends. She also takes orders for candy from other districts like Tocache, Bellavista and Tarapoto.

She also travels in nearby towns, where she sells on credit. All the loans are paid back right now.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will invest in buying more ingredients like starch and sugar (sold in sacks), oil, eggs, cornflour sold by the kilo, vanilla and colorings. These ingredients will be used in preparing sweet things like rosquitas, kekes, biscochuelos, turacas, suspiros, ñutos (all typical Peruvian pastries).

She makes the financial decisions of her business. As a borrower, she personally feels more independent, relaxed, capable and responsible than before.

Redelinda is grateful to Manual Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businessperson and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of starch and sugar, oil, eggs, cornflour, vanilla, and food coloring.

loans.name: Héctor Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Héctor Eduardo P. ya ha tenido dos créditos en FVP los cuales pago puntual mente, con los que empezó la construcción de dos cuartos en la planta alta de su casa. 
Ahora está solicitando un préstamo para poder terminar las habitaciones que serán para sus hijas ya que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio.
Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos de su trabajo como chofer de camión.
texts.en:
Mr Héctor Eduardo Perez has already had two loans with FVP which he repaid punctually and with which he began construction of two rooms on the top floor of his house. He is now requesting a loan to finish the rooms which will be for his daughters since they are growing and need their own space. He plans to repay the loan with earnings from his work as a truck driver.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of two rooms in his house

loans.name: J. Humberto

texts.es:
El señor J. Humberto S. esta solicitando un préstamo para poder construir un techo de madera al frente de la casa. No cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicionales a su trabaja. Su esposa la señora Blanca Leticia Tamez, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada al frente de la vivienda, para el es importante que este en buenas condiciones el lugar donde su esposa trabaja ya que es un ingreso mas a la familia.
En la foto aparece la señora Blanca Leticia ya que el señor J. Humberto se encontraba en su trabajo portal motivo ella fue quien nos atendió.
texts.en:
Mr. J. Humberto S. is requesting a loan to be able to build a wooden roof at the front of his house. He does not have the money needed to buy the materials since he is planning to make the improvements himself on a schedule in addition to his regular work. His wife, Mrs. Blanca Leticia Tamez, has a small business selling used clothing in the front of the house. For him it is important that the area where his wife works be in good condition since this is an additional income for the family. The photo shows Mrs. Blanca Leticia as Mr. J. Humberto was at his job so that she met with us.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wood roof at the front of his house

loans.name: Alicia Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Alicia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, vive en el Jr. Jiménez Pimentel Nº 245, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 35 años y es madre de 02 hijos y 01 que aun depende de ella.

Se inicio con de S/. 300.00, que fue motivada por una amiga y comenzó vendiendo refrigerios. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y venta de comida preparada, donde atiende a sus principales clientes, amigos y vecinos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 400.00 que cancelara a plazo de 04 meses, lo invertirá comprando paquetes de galletas dulces y saladas, chifles en docenas y con parte del dinero compro insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como carnes en sus diferentes variedades, kilos de  arroz y azúcar, verduras.

Ella toma las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, siente que sus ventas se incrementaron. Se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Alicia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the San Marcelo II community bank, and lives at 245 Jiménez Pimentel Avenue, in the Tarapoto district of San Martín department. She is single, 35 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom still lives at home. Encouraged by a friend, with 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, she began selling snacks. She has worked with the community bank for three years, and has continued in the same business up to the present, selling cooked food to her main clients, her friends and neighbors. Alicia will invest this loan of 400 Peruvian nuevos soles, which is to be repaid within four months, in the purchase of cookies, crackers, and plantain chips by the dozen. With part of the money she will buy ingredients for meal preparation, such as various varieties of meat, vegetables, and rice and sugar in bulk. Alicia makes the decisions on business expenditures and earnings, and personally feels that her sales are increasing. She feels like an independent woman, more responsible about making her payments. Alicia is grateful to Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, rice, sugar, vegetables and cookies

loans.name: Baba's Association Group

texts.en:
Three dynamic women form this association: Akouvi B., Adjo Fidelia A., and Sika Sohouenou. Together they sell charcoal and oil as well as groceries, and they use their revenues to help one another as well as other women and the community. Using their combined experience as businesswomen, they advise other sellers and put aside money each week to help someone in need from the community. 
They received their first loan from Wages in 2005 which they duly repaid. Now, they are seeking a second loan so that each woman can increase her sales. They would like to expand their business to increase its profitability and consequently, to be able to enhance their social activities.

loans.use: To purchase of coal, oil, and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Installation of metal grilles on the doors and windows

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, vive en Jr, Fuaja Marginal S/Nº Distrito de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 03 que todavía dependen de ella.

Se inicio con unprimer préstamo de  S/. 500.00, motivada por su pareja; Emprendió su negocio de compra y venta de Electrodomésticos.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y vende sus productos recorriendo diferentes pueblos, principalmente en el Caserío de San Martín de Alao y en épocas festivas.

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelara a un plazo de 06  meses, invertirá comprando artefactos eléctricos como televisores, radios, cámaras, parlantes, discos de segunda mano y próximamente ser vendidos a un precio diferente.

Se siente mejor ahora, que en sus inicios, más segura al ofrecer sus servicios y al mismo tiempo mas constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Teresa, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the Mujeres en Acción community bank. She lives on South Fuaja Marginal Avenue in the San José de Sisa district of San Martín department. She is married, 39 years old, and the mother of four children, three of whom still live at home. Encouraged by her husband, with her first loan of 500 Peruvian nuevos soles she opened a business buying and selling home electronics. She has continued in this business up to the present and sells her products in several towns, but primarily in Caserío de San Martín de Alao and during holidays. She will invest this loan of 2000 nuevos soles, which is to be repaid in six months, in the purchase of home electronics, such as television sets, radios, cameras, speakers, second-hand CDs, marking them up for resale. She feels better now than when she began, more secure in offering her services and at the same time more consistent and responsible about making her payments. Teresa is grateful to Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of television sets, cameras, speakers, and second-hand CDs

loans.name: Telvina

texts.es:
La señora Telvina C. D. A. tiene 60 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito D. Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3ro D. primaria, abandono sus estudios debido a que su madre no tenía los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Tiene 04 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella. 
Telvina se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en el mercado D. la zona, cuando inició su actividad económica, se dedicaba a la venta D. ropa, negocio que abandonó debido a que tenia que cuidar a sus hijos y se dedico a la venta D. condimentos y plásticos casi 5 años; hasta que  adquirió un puesto en el mercado en donD. venD. abarrotes.  Con sus ganancias ha logrado construir su puesto en el mercado El cortijo donD. desarrolla su negocio actualmente. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en la compra D. abarrotes para ampliar su capital. 
Con el crédito D. 1200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.) para surtir su puesto. 
Telvina tiene el sueño D. terminar D. construir su casa y lograr que sus nietos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Telvina C. D. A. is 60 years of age and lives in the Cortijo Development, in the District and Province of Trujillo, Libertad Department, Peru. She left school after the third graD. because her mother did not have the means for her to continue her education. She has four children, none of whom rely on her economically. Telvina is engaged in selling groceries in her neighborhood's market. The first business she started was selling clothing but she had to put this asiD. to care for her children. She was selling condiments and plasticware for almost five years until she acquired her stand in the market where she now sells groceries. With her earnings she has been able to build her stand in the El Cortijo market where she is currently developing her business. With her first loan of 300 Sols which she received from her bank, Nuevo Peru Communal Bank, she bought groceries in order to build up her inventory. With this loan of 1,200 Sols, which will be repaid in six months, she will be investing in the purchase of groceries (sugar, rice, noodles, etc.) in order to stock up her stand. Telvina dreams of being able finish building her house and that her grandchildren will grow up to be professional people.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Gladys Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Soledad Horna L. tiene 41 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do de secundaria, abandonó los estudios debido a que no le gustaba ir al colegio y se dedico a trabajar, tiene 03 hijos de los cuales 02 aun dependen de ella económicamente. 
Gladys se dedica a la venta de menú y jugos, inició su negocio vendiendo raspadillas, luego se dedico a la venta de frutas en el mercado el cual abandono para dedicarse a la venta de menú y jugos, ya que es más rentable y que le ha permitido construir su puesto en el mercado El Cortijo en donde desarrolla su negocio hace mas de 25 años. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para la preparación de menú. 
Con el crédito de 1200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de insumos para la elaboraciónd e sus alimentos(arroz, azúcar, aceite).
Gladys sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y comprarse una mototaxi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys Soledad Horna L. is 41 years old and lives in the El Cortillo development, district and city of Trujillo, region of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until the second year of high school, giving up her studies owing to the fact that she did not want to go to college and she dedicated herself to working. She has three children of which two depend on her financially.

Gladys’ work is offering a set menu and juices. She started her business by selling flavored shaved ices, and later the sale of fruits in the market, which she gave up to dedicate herself to offering a set menu and juices as it is more profitable and has enabled her to build her kiosk in the El Cortijo market where she has developed her business for more than 25 years.

Her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her communal bank “Nuevo Peru” she invested in the purchase of groceries for her menu. This loan of 1200 PEN, which she commits to pay in six months, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for expanding her offerings (rice, sugar, oil). Gladys’ dream is to own a grocery store in her home and to buy a motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of ingredients (rice, sugar, oil).

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
La señora Justa C. E. tiene 51 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, abandonó los estudios debido a que no le gustaba ir al colegio y se quedo en casa ayudando a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar, tiene 03 hijos de los cuales solo 01 depende económicamente de ella.
Justa se dedica a la venta de tejidos, inició su negocio hace 25 años tejiendo chompas con lanas que le daban sus clientas en Huamachuco, luego se trasladó a Trujillo donde empezó tejiendo con lanas que ella misma compraba en el mercado, con el tiempo se hizo conocida y tiene muchos clientes. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en la compra de lanas y herramientas para tejido. 

Con el crédito de 1700 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de lanas para la elaboración de las prendas de vestir.
Justa tiene el gran sueño de comprarse una máquina tejedora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justa C. E. is 51 and lives in Urb, in the El Cortijo sector in the district of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She completed elementary school, but she she left her studies when she decided that she did not like going to school. She stayed at home helping her mother with the household chores. She has 3 children, but only one is economically dependent upon her. Justa sells needlework. She started her business 25 years ago by knitting sweaters with wool that her customers in Huamachuco gave her. Then, she moved to Trujillo where she started knitting with wool that she bought in the market. In time she became known and had many customers. She runs her business in her own home. With the first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank, “Nuevo Perú” (New Peru), she bought wool and tools for knitting. With a loan for 1700 PEN, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy wool for making clothes. Justa has the big dream of buying a knitting machine.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods (Wool)

loans.name: Noemia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Noemia Carolina C. D. H. tiene 46 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito D. Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta II ciclo D. Educación, carrera que abandono debido a que se caso y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar, tiene 02 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Noemia se dedica a la venta D. productos lácteos y productos D. belleza, empezó vendiendo productos D. belleza hace 10 años, con el tiempo se inicio en la venta D. productos lácteos negocio que era D. su madre y que al enfermarse se lo cedió y en el cual lleva 5 años. Asimismo hace 1 año se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollo negocio que desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en la compra D. productos lácteos.  
Con el crédito D. 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. productos D. belleza para su stock y productos lácteos.
Noemia sueña con tener una ferretería y viajar a conocer el cuzco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noemia Carolina C. D. H. is 46 and lives in Urb, in the El Cortijo sector in the district of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She completed secondary school, but she left that course because she got married and had to take care of her home. She has 2 children, but they are not economically dependent upon her. Noemia sells dairy products and beauty products. She started selling beauty products 10 years ago. She started selling dairy products 5 years ago when her mother became ill and gave her the business. One year ago she also started raising and selling chickens in her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she got from her community bank “Nuevo Perú” (New Peru), she bought dairy products. With a loan of 800 PEN, which she will repay in 6 months, she will increase her stock of beauty products and buy dairy products. Noemia dreams of having a hardware store and traveling to see “El Cuzco” (the historical capital of the Inca Empire).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Mrs. Beverly J. is of legal age, married, and a resident of Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She engages in selling vegetables, spices, and root crops. Her stall can be found in the market. She is blessed with six children, three of whom are still studying. Beverly is an active member of Paglaum MPC and already accessed loans four times to support her business. Through this business, she hopes to have enough income for their family and for the education of their children.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and root crops to sell

loans.name: San Cristobal Group

texts.es: Hilda Esperanza, (Presidenta D. L. Alcacia) tiene 46 años, está casada, pero actualmente vive separada, como miles D. mujeres en Lima es L. jefa D. su hogar y trabaja arduamente para darle una vida digna a sus cuatro menores hijos,. A pesar D. las dificultades que le ha tocado enfrentar en su vida elL. mantiene su espíritu risueño y optimista. Hilda se dedica al comercio desD. hace 20 años; actualmente venD. locería y artículos D. bazar en su puesto D. venta del mercado Señor D. los Milagros D. San Juan D. Lurigancho; se inició en el negocio exponiendo sus productos en el suelo, en L. calle, al principio sus ingresos servían para complementar el ingreso familiar, con el tiempo, al ganar experiencia y al quedarse soL. este ingreso se constituyó en el único ingreso disponible para cubrir los gastos del presupuesto familiar. Con los ingresos D. su actividad comercial ha podido comprar el puesto del mercado en el que actualmente trabaja y está educando a sus hijos; D. manera progresiva viene ahorrando para financiar los gastos D. L. educación superior D. sus hijos. Si elL. pudiese disponer D. un fondo importante lo dedicaría a ampliar su puesto D. venta y a surtirlo D. una mayor y más variada mercadería.
texts.en:
Hilda Esperanza, President of the Alcancía (Communal Piggy Bank) is 46 years of age and is married, although currently separated. Like thousands of women in Lima she is the head of her household and works assiduously in order to proviD. a dignified life for her four young children. In spite of the difficulties that have confronted her all of her life, she maintains a cheerful and optimistic disposition. Hilda has been in business for twenty years. Currently she sells pottery and market goods in her sales stand in the Señor D. los Milagros D. San Juan D. Lurigancho market. When she started out in business, she was setting out her products on the ground, in the street. Initially, her earnings were to supplement her family's income but over time, as she gained experience and was left with only this source of income, it became her sole means of meeting the expenses of her family's budget. With the earnings from her business activity she has been able to buy her stand in the market where she currently works and she is educating her children. Little by little, she is saving up to pay the expenses for a higher education for her children. If she were able to obtain sufficient funds, she would use them to expand her sales stand and stock it with a greater variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Osana

texts.en: Osana T., 38, is married with five children. She has one year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the public six days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Osana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase plastic papers, sacks of sugar and other items for her business.

loans.name: Matainofo

texts.en: Matainofo P., 27, is married with one child. She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public two days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Matainofo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The entire loan will be used for business needs.

loans.use: Purchase tool for planting taro, bananas and yams; other business needs

loans.name: Efaraima

texts.en: Efaraima M., 24, is single and has no children. She has one year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the village people and the public six days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about $125). SPBD loans are Efaraima’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy plastic plates, cups, sugar, and other items for ice cake sales.

loans.use: To purchase items for ice cake sales.

loans.name: Tooa

texts.en: Tooa F., 32, is married and has two children. She has one year of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to the village people and the public six days a week. This is her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145 USD). SPBD loans are Tooa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All funds will be used to maintain her business needs: she will use her loan to buy seeds for her planting as well as for home improvement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting.

loans.name: Librado

texts.es:
El señor Librado H. es padre D. familia y tiene dos hijos ya adolecientes que necesitan ya su propio espacio en L. casa. 
Portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para empezar L. construcción D. un cuarto en L. parte trasera D. L. casa y así sus hijos tengan su propia recamara y privacidad. Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos se su trabajo como custodio.
texts.en:
Mr. Librado H. has two children. They are now adolescents, and they need their own space in their home. It is for this reason that he is asking for a loan to start construction on a room in the back of their house. This way his children will have their own bedroom and privacy. He plans to pay back the loan with his income from his work as a police officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room in the back of the house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El señor Marcos P. y su esposa tienen un hijo, quieren darle lo mejor. En esté momento ellos están en el procesa de construcción de una cuarto ya que su vivienda solo tiene una habitación y su niño ya está creciendo y necesita su espacio. 
Portal motivo están solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material y así empezar la construcción de una cuarto en la parte trasera de la casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos P. and his wife have a son they want the best for. Right now they are in the process of building another room because they live in a one-room-house and their son is growing and needs his own space. They are applying for a loan so they can buy materials and begin building the room at the back of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construcción de un cuarto en la parte trasera de la casa

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Fedelina G. of Gango, Ozamiz City, is an active member of the PDP-LP Microfinance Program of Paglaum MPC– Ozamiz Branch. She has three children: a grade schooler, a college student, and one who's married. Her husband is a motor cab driver, the sole winner of the family. Fedelina decided to join PMPC to avail our programs and services. In order to help her husband, she decided to care her neighbor's sow so that in the future she will receive her share of piglets.

The 3,000 PHP loan will be applied to the purpose of purchasing additional maintenance feeds and corn bran. The remaining amount will be for tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and rice bran for the pigs she's helping to raise

loans.name: Viridiana

texts.es: La señora Viridiana O. y su esposo el señor Rene Edagardo Peralta tienen dos pequeños hijos a los cuales les quieren darlo mejor. Están solicitando un préstamo para terminar los acabados del cuarto de sus niños pero no cuentan con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que les va a realizar la mejora. Solicitan el préstamo para poder terminar el recamara y así sus hijas tengas su espacio mejor.
texts.en:
Ms. Viridiana O. and her husband Mr. Rene Edagardo Peralta have two small children they would like the best for. They are applying for a loan so they can finish a bedroom for their children. They do not have the money necessary to buy the materials or to pay the person who will do the labor. They are applying for this loan to be able to finish the bedroom so their children have a better space.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acabados del interior de la vivienda

loans.name: Amioga

texts.en: Amioga M., 22, is single with no children.  She has 1 year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the village people/public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about US $104).  SPBD loans are Amioga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Supplies for making ice cakes

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Mrs. Marilyn B. is 50 years of age, married, and has five children. An active member of the Paglaum Co-op, she has already availed several loans financed to her business selling longanisa. She also engages in dealing RTWs. Her sources of household income are from the business and the salary of her husband. Marilyn availed another loan from the Co-op for the purchase of additional stocks of longanisa to generate more income to support the education of her children since the salary of his husband is insufficient to provide for all their needs.

loans.use: To purchase of longanisa to sell

loans.name: Asa

texts.en:
Asa Taafuli, 51, is married with 8 children. She has 2 years of experience in the Vegetable business. She sells to the village 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $122).

SPBD loans are Asa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy more seeds and tools for use in her vegetable garden and also for home improvement.

loans.use: Vegetable gardening supplies and home improvement

loans.name: Faafiu

texts.en:
Faafiu A. P., 39, is married with 3 children. She has 4 years of experience in the retail business. She sells to the village 6 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about US $174).

SPBD loans are Faafiu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy goods to restock all the items in her shop, and for home improvement.

loans.use: Store inventory and home improvement

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina I., 41, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the clothing sales business. She sells to the General Public 6 days per week.

Lesina is asking for a loan to purchase design boards, rollers of ie lavalava materials, poplins, paints, and brushes. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~312 USD). SPBD loans are Lesina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase materials for decorating clothing

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili P., 33, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the public 6 days per week. Lili is asking for a loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil to support her business. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Lili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy pancake ingredients

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугаффору 58 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Находится на пенсии, старшие сыновья присылают денежные переводы из России и на это живут. Так как Абдугаффор живет в доме с земельным участком он  держит дома домашний скот. Излишки молока которые остаются, продают соседям, а тот приплод который растет приносит прибыль когда они его продают. Абдугаффор видя что цены на скот на рынке немного упали, решил получить займ и прикупить еше одну корову.
texts.en:
Abdugafor is 58 years old, married, and has four children. He is retired, and lives on the remittances his oldest sons send from Russia. Since Abdugafor lives in a house with a plot of land, he maintains a few domestic livestock. Extra milk is sold to neighbors, and the offspring that he raises are later sold for a profit. Noticing that prices for livestock have fallen a little, Abdugafor decided to obtain a loan and buy one more cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима кроме своей основной работы занимается дома откормом скота. Она замужем, ей 47 лет, воспитывает 4 детей. Муж работает на разных местах разнорабочим. Сейчас у нее 2 коровы и недавно обе родили телят. Излишки молока которые остаются продают соседям и на вырученные деньги покупают комбикорм для коров. Весной запасов сена остается мало и поэтому узнав о КИВА решила подать  заявку на займ и собирается прикупить сена для коров.
texts.en:
Fotima raises domestic livestock in addition to her regular work. She is married, 47 years old, and is raising 4 children. Her husband works various jobs as a general laborer. She currently has two cows, both of which recently calved. Surplus milk is sold to neighbors, and the profit pays for the cows feed. In spring stored hay runs low, so having found out about Kiva, Fotima decided to apply for a loan which she will use to buy hay for the cows.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hay

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира для улучшения условий своей семьи кроме основной работы содержит дома домашний скот. Это хоть и небольшой доход, но за счет этой деятельности Мунира может без проблем изготовить что нибудь из молока, а за счет продажи излишков молока можно купить комбикорм для скота. Мунира замужем, ей 45 лет, имеет 3 детей. На займ планирует приобрести маленького бычка для откорма.
texts.en:
Munira improves her family's standard of living by raising domestic livestock in addition to her regular work. The actual profit is small, but thanks to her activity she can easily make various things from milk, and can buy feed for the cows using the income from selling surplus milk. Munira is married, 45 years old, and has three children. She plans to use this loan to buy a young bull calf to raise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull calf

loans.name: Bahtigul

texts.ru: Бахтигул одна из активнейших клиентов МикроИнвест. Она была одной из тех кто первыми получил займ МикроИнвест и сейчас она продолжает кредитоваться. Займы сыграли в ее бизнесе решающую роль. Кроме расширения бизнеса она смогла устроить быт своей семьи: купила телевизор, двд-проигрыватель, провела мелкий ремонт квартиры. Бахтигул 37 лет, у нее 3 детей. Продает детскую одежду и разные мелкие товары. Сейчас она собирается немного обновить свой ассортимент и поэтому решила получить новый займ.
texts.en:
Bahtigul is one Microinvest's most active clients. She was one of the first people to receive a loan from Microinvest, and she continues to use credit. Loans played a decisive role in development of her business. And in addition to expanding the business, she has been able to provide for her household; buying a television, DVD player, and making some repairs to the apartment. Bahtigul is 37 years old and has three children. She sells children's clothing and various other small products. She is planning to refresh her inventory a bit, and so decided to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To upgrade inventory

loans.name: Marychel

texts.en:
'Young entrepreneur' best describes Mrs. Marychel M., a 23-year-old who is married and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City. Her husband is an auto mechanic. At her age, she was able to find various ways of making a living. She opened a sari-sari store to be able to cope with the daily expenses of her family. She also joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to avail loans to start up her sari-sari store. Because of the Paglaum MPC loan program, Mrs. M. hopes that this could be a chance for her to enhance and expand her business so that she can meet the basic needs of her children who are now schooling.
Today, she is applying for a 7,000 PHP loan to buy additional goods and electronic loads to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To buy various goods and electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Mrs. Marilou C.’s livelihood activity is buying and selling piglets. Her husband's activity is farming.  She has been an active member of Paglaum Coop for 2 years and has had 4 previous loans with the Coop to  finance her business.  She is married and has four children. Three of them are still studying. She works hard in order to have financial capability - especially to support the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for sale

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Anelyn K. is 36 years old and married to Mynard K.. She raises pigs. She is requesting a loan of  10,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Anelyn dreams of having more pigs and a pig pen extension one day. She also hopes to have a concrete house for her family and a good life ahead. She is a member in good standing in the PDP-LP program of Paglaum Coop.

loans.use: feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Mrs. Lanie E. is 39 years old and married to Mr. Pedro E.. They are blessed with five children, and reside in the province of Misamis Occidental.

Mrs. Lanie E. raises pigs. As a new member of the Paglaum Coop micro finance program, she is requesting her first loan of 10,000 PHP to buy pig feed. In addition to raising pigs, she earns income from growing tangkong (a type of vegetable) at her mother's place. She dreams that her children will finish their studies, that there are more harvests to come, and that she can expand her pig pen one day.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Sinfronia

texts.en: Mrs. Sinfronia S. is 46 years old and married to Mario S.. The couple has three children and lives in Polo Pitogo, in the province of Misamis Occidental. They are both in the fishing business: she is a fish vendor and he is a fisherman. Mrs. Sinfronia S. is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a new fishing net and “bunsod” (fish cage). She hopes that one day they can upgrade their house to a concrete structure.

loans.use: To buy new fishing net and accessories

location.town: Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria A. is a 53 year old widow who lives with her two children. She makes bamboo furniture, and is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more materials. She dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies with the help of her business and the loan assistance from Paglaum. Her hopes and aspirations are to have a successful bamboo furniture business and to upgrade her house to a concrete structure one day. She is a member of Paglaum MPC's PDP-LP program.

loans.use: To purchase of materials needed for making bamboo furniture

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is of legal age, has seven children, and resides in Magsaysay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to Bobby, a farmer. She has a business called Sari-Sari Store located at their barangay market. Vincenta was encouraged to be part of the Paglaum MPC for the programs and services it offers, especially the one on lending money that gave her access to additional capital for her business.

Now, she is on her second cycle of her loan amounting to 5,000 PHP. Her previous loan was paid religiously on time.  She is hoping that her business will be successful and that all her children will finish their chosen courses and have stable jobs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase of additional stocks such as goodies, laundry materials, and other household products

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene N. is 37 years old, married to Julio N.; and together they have three children. She has been a PDP-LP member since 2000 and is a good and loyal member of the Paglaum Coop. Arlene pays her obligations on time. In fact, she already made more than ten loan availments and has never missed a single payment. She keeps her little "carenderia" (restaurant) to support her husband's income as well as the day-to-day needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase stocks for her food vending

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Erlinda O. ventured into the “sari-sari” (convenience store) business in order to help her husband. Her husband is a farmer and a fisherman. She lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental and has 4 children. Today, she is applying for 14,900 PHP to buy additional goods for her sari-sari.

Erlinda is a MIGS member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has already received several loans. She got additional working capital from the Coop in August, 2004. The proceeds of the loan were used for tuition fees for her children and fertilizers for the farm. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC because she was able to continue her business and send her children to school. In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for sale

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: 'Hardworking woman' describes Mrs. Sylvia P. who is married and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has three children. Her husband is a mere carpenter who sometimes has work, and sometimes does not. For this, she must very work hard. If not, they will not have anything to eat if her husband has no work. Rain or shine, Mrs. P., buys junk items from different areas and then sells them to the junk buyers with mark-ups of at least 20 percent. This is commonly known as “junk buying.” In need of additional working capital, she availed loan at the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last August 2004. In the past, Mrs. P. had availed several other loans. Today, she is applying for a 14,900 PHP loan for additional working capital to buy junk items such as cans, metals, aluminums, and plastics. She will be happy enough, after a long journey, when all her children will finish their studies and obtain successful careers someday.

loans.use: To buy junk items such as cans, metals, and plastics to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Mrs. Delia C. is 51 years old, married, and a resident of Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. She has been an active member of the Paglaum Co-op for over three years. She engages in selling longanisa (processed meat), various other foods, and dealing dry goods. Delia has already availed several loans financed to her business. She started her business through a consignment basis. Her existing business really helps her to support her family, especially with the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase longanisa to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Mrs. Conchita P. is 58 years old, married, and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City. She has three children. Her husband is a driver. She owns a “sari-sari” (general) store and has been obtaining additional working capital from the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since November 2006. Conchita has availed several other loans already. Today, she is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional goods to sell. Someday, she plans to expand her business into a mini grocery store, selling a variety of goods.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Antonino Jury

texts.en:
Antonio Jury A. of Maikay, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, is single and engaged in the meat selling business. 
Fifteen years ago, he worked in his sister-in-law's meat shop as an assistant. He was the one assigned to canvass hogs for cheaper prices.
Years later, he decided to make his own business, bearing all the experiences he had gathered. In God's time, he was able to rent a stall and to start up his own meat shop. Along his way, he encountered a financial dilemma. A friend shared Paglaum MPC's programs and services and the benefits for the members. He decided to become a member and avail the loan credit to have additional capital for the meat shop.

loans.use: To gain additional capital for the meat shop

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Mrs. Angelie A. is presently living at Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, and married with two children.
One day, the Local Government Unit in their municipality facilitated a seminar in raising poultry. Mrs A. and her husband grabbed the opportunity, attending the seminar and applying the thing they learned, which was a big help for them. At the start, she raised 25 hens and 3 roosters with the help of her husband and kids, although she encountered some difficulties in terms of the maintenance and in raising the poultry. As time passed they learned the secrets in raising poultry and they now reap the fruits of their hard work and labor. At present they are able to save money for the education of their children and able to meet daily necessities because they already have avid customers such as restaurants, carenderias and local residents.
Her membership with Paglaum MPC helps her in terms of the finances for the maintenance of the poultry farm.

loans.use: to purchase additional native hens

loans.name: Rosamelina

texts.en: Rosamelina B. is a resident of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years of age and blessed with 3 children. She's been a member at PMPC PDP-LP program for almost 3 years. She works hard as a farmer while at the same time managing their own sari-sari store and selling NFA rice (rice that has been sold by one of the gov't agencies, National Food Authority at a very low price), as she is an operator in their barangay. Mrs. B. started this business last year and it is still existing and growing now. Mrs. B. is very thankful for PMPC because of its programs and services and for the trust that they have given her. All her children were living separately and she prayed that they will have happy life and will receive many graces and blessings.

loans.use: Capital for rice retailing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine M. is from Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, and married with 2 children. She is a teacher and her husband is an OFW at Qatar. She has been a member of Paglaum since July 2007, when she received loan credit for her project. She believes that having a piggery is her hobby and one way to increase the household's income for daily necessities.

loans.use: To construct additional cage for the swine

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Mrs. Rosalia V. is 57 years of age and a resident of Miputak, Dipolog City. She is a widow and a hardworking mother of her only child. She became interested in applying for membership at Paglaum MPC because she wants to save not only for herself, but also for her child. She’s been a good member for almost three years and has already received six loans. Now, she has applied for 6,000PHP because she wants additional capital for her fruits that she is currently selling. She also wants to buy spices and vegetables to increase her income. She doesn’t mind the sweat and being tired, as long as she lives with her child.

loans.use: purchase of additional bananas, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Mr. and Mrs. A. are successful and happy; however they haven't been blessed with a child. They are both residing at Poblacion Sapang dalaga misamis occidental. Mr A.'s main focus is on their sari-sari store which is still stable at the present. Mrs A. is a regular member in the cooperative under an individual program. She would now like to borrow PHP12,000 for buying additional stocks for the business managed by herself and her husband, which they started with some small capital on their own. Their future business plan is to become promising entrepreneurs by God's blessing so that they can help their family and relatives.

loans.use: additional capital for business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Mrs. Lourdes E. started buying and selling pigs and discovered that this business is a good way of earning income. Her husband is a farmer and she wanted to help him by bringing in additional income.  She buys pigs from her neighbors and sells them every Saturday at Dipolog City. Lourdes is 59 years old, married with 2 children, and presently resides in Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for 2 years. She is applying for 6,000 PHP to support her business and hopes to make it a great success.

loans.use: To buy hogs to sell

loans.name: Dinna

texts.en: Mrs. Dinna R. raises pigs in order to help her husband and provide educational support for her school-age child.  She needs this loan to purchase feed and medicine for her piglets. Dinna is 28 years of age, married with two children and a resident of Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte.  Her husband is a merchandiser with a company.  She is an active member of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicine for piglets

loans.name: Febe

texts.en: Mrs. Febe B. is currently engaging in a sari-sari (convenience store) business. She lacks capital and has turned to Paglaum MPC for a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional goods for her store, as well as for buying firewood and vegetables. She is 49 years old, married with 5 children and lives at Dipolog City. She aspires to send her children to school with the help of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for a store.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Mrs. Alfreda A. of Miputak, Dipolog City is a very responsible mother and as member of the coop. She is 55 years old, but is still struggling with the challenges of life. During her three years of membership in Paglaum, she has already borrowed and actively repaid three loans.

Because her dream is to make her hog-raising business a successful one, she has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy piglets. Today she is helping her husband a lot to earn an income.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: 03-Nam Ngan Group

texts.vi:
Group 3 – Nam Ngan consists of 7 women living in South City II, Ngan Nam, in Thanh Hoa city. 


* The group leader, Ms. Lê Thị Thu, was born in 1958 and lives with her family in Thanh Hoa. Her husband, Mr. Hàn viết Thắm is 52 years old. Ms. Thu has 2 children, both of whom are now living and working in Quang Ninh. 
Ms. Thu wishes to take out a loan to invest in her shop selling delicious local breakfast foods.  Her specialty is beef and chicken phở (a popular Vietnamese noodle soup).   She has applied for a 6.000.000 VND loan (~ $350 USD).


Other members of the group:

* Ms. Ngô Thị N. was born in 1947. Her husband, Mr. Vũ Tuấn Minh, is 59 years old. Ms. N. is borrowing 6.000.000VND (~ $350USD) to invest in cultivating her rice field and farming fish

* Ms. N. Thị T.nh was born in 1954. Her husband is Mr. N. văn Vực, aged 60. Ms. T.nh wishes to take out a loan to invest in raising pigs and chickens and has applied for a 6.000.000 VND loan (~ $350USD). 

* Ms. Lê Thị Thu was born in 1961. Her husband is Anh Trần Minh.  Ms. Thu wishes to use her loan to invest in her family’s metal workshop, making small iron farming tools, window frames and other small metal items that they then sell to rural households.  She will also be borrowing 6.000.000VND (~$350USD). 

* Ms. Pham Thi Lan was born in 1980 and her husband, Mr. Nguyen Van Hien, is 32 years old.  She would like to invest in breeding pigs and chickens and has applied for a 6.000.000VND loan (~$350USD). 

* Ms. Ngô Thị Cài is 60 years old. Her husband is N. Văn Bảo. She is borrowing 6.000.000 VND to invest in her family’s local grocery store. 

* Ms. Lai Thị Hương was born in 1980. Her husband is Mr. Vũ Tuấn Tiến and they have a 4-year old child. She wishes to take out a 6.000.000 VND loan (~$350 USD) to invest in farming fish.


Note: Many FPW borrowers have expressed a desire to borrow larger amounts to make more significant investments in their businesses.   In response to this, FPW has recently added a new loan product of 6.000.000 VND with a 20 month term to its Thanh Hoa City branch portfolio.  


---------------------------------------

* Nhóm 3 gồm 7 thành viên. Tất cả các thành viên đều sống tại phố nam Ngạn II, phường Nam Ngạn, thành phố Thanh Hóa. * Nhóm trưởng Là chị Lê Thị Thu,chị sinh năm 1958. Gia đình chị sinh sống tại thôn Nam Ngạn II,Phường Nam Ngạn Thành Phố Thanh Hóa. Chồng chị là anh Hàn viết Thắm, 52 tuổi. Anh chị vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng bán hàng ăn sáng ( phở bò ,phở gà)Gia đình chị sinh được 2 người con các con của chị nay đã lớn Và đang làm ở Quảng Ninh. chị đăng ký vay với mức 6.000.000 vnd ~350 USD. * Chị N. Thị T.nh sinh năm 1954 ,chồng chị là anh N. văn Vực 60 tuổi. Gia đình chị vay vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn gà. chị đăng ký vay 6.000.000vnđ(~350USD). Các thành viên khác trong nhóm đều có cùng mức vay * Chị P. Thị Lan, sinh năm 1980, chồng là N. Văn Hiên 32 tuổi . Gia đình vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn gà chị vay mức 6.000.000VND (~350USD). * Chị Lê Thị Thu sinh năm 1961. Chồng chị là Anh Trần Minh. chị vay vốn đầu tư vào sản xuất cơ khí, chị vay mức 6.000.000VNĐ(~350USD). * Ngô Thị N. sinh năm 1947. Chồng chị là Vũ Tuấn Minh, 59 tuổi. Chị vay mức 6.000.000VNĐ(~350USD)để đầu tư vào làm ruộng và làm trang trại nuôi cá . * Ngô Thị Cài 60 tuổi. Chồng là N. Văn Bảo . Gia đình chị vay vốn để buôn bán hàng tạp hóa . *Lai Thị Hương sinh năm 1980. Chồng chị là anh Vũ Tuấn Tiến> Anh chị mới có 1 cháu, năm nay cháu 4 tuổi. Anh chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi cá và chị đăng ký vay mức 6.000.000 VNĐ(~350 USD).
texts.en: Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in Pho breakfast noodle restaurant

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn B. lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is happily married and has three children. Her husband is a painter and tricycle driver. She started her backyard hog-fattening business with three piglets. Now Roselyn is raising a sow with the help of her mother who attended a hog-raising seminar.

Four years ago, Roselyn became a member of PMPC and the co-op became a partner in her livelihood project. She is very involved and a hardworking mother.

Roselyn is applying for a loan of Php 25,000 to purchase feed for her piglets and hogs. Her future plan is to be able to expand her backyard hog-raising business, to build her own house (since she is living with her parents), and to be able to send her three children to college and allow them finish their studies.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed for her piglets and hogs.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg C. lives with her mother and younger sister in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.  During the last few years, the importation of cheap clothes from Ereen, China has become a lucrative business for locals in Arhanghay.  Ereen is a Chinese border town where many small business owners travel to import cheap products for resale at their local markets.  

Erdenetsetseg started traveling to Ereen in 2006 to buy cheap, quality apparel for women and men.  While she is away her sister, Chuluuntsetseg, runs the stall.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and diversify her products. She requests a loan to purchase more apparel from Ereen, China.

loans.use: Purchase more apparel.

loans.name: Khlan's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for three women who live in Battambang Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. Khlan S., age 35, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. S. has been a domestic tailor for three years. She also provides her services to her neighbors. She can sew one or two garments each day, for which she charge $3.00 per item of clothing.

To help feed the family a little more, her husband drives a motor taxi. The family now cares for three teenage children who are students at the local school.

S. hopes to expand her business and to satisfy her customer's demands by seeking for a loan from HKL to purchase a sewing machine for her business operation.

There are two other borrowers in her loan group. Touch Y. is requesting a loan to expand her vegetable business. Sok S. is a widowed mother who sells vegetables. She needs a loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn C., 25, is a resident of Bacolod Ozamiz City. She runs a barbecue business. Together with her husband, who is a hard working farmer, they started their business with a small amount of capital. They have set up of a table at Bacolod Ozamiz City, at the road side. Now they have more customers to serve with the help of her husband.

Recently, Ailyn requested a loan of Php 1,500 as additional capital to purchase meat and ingredients for her barbecue business. Ailyn's future plan for her family is to expand her business and build her own house, since she living with her parents.

loans.use: Purchase additional meat for her B-B-Q business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Mrs.Consorcia A.,  63, was widowed at an early age and raised eight children on her own.  A resident of Guba Clarin, Misamis Occidenta, she grows coconuts, bananas and root crops and buys and sells banana fruit for a living
.
Consorcia joined Paglaum MPC because of their programs and services and is now applying for a loan of Php 4000 as additional capital to purchase fertilizer for banana and root crop production.  Her future plans include enabling her son to complete his college studies and renovating her house for comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilzers for banana and root crop production.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila C., a 53-year-old married mother of three, one still studying, resides in Dipolog City and has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for two years.  A very diligent worker, she is a part-time teacher who used to teach an evening class at the college, and she earns income as a dressmaker. 
	
To be able to purchase cloth and other materials for dressmaking, she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP. Lucila is looking forward to continuing her relationship with the Coop to help her achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and cloth.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucresia B., 49 years old, is married and lives at Dapitan City. During her two years of membership in Paglaum MPC, she has had a good record of being a good payer. Her three previous loans justify this assessment. And because she likes the benefits that are being offered to the members, she continues to patronize PMPC.

She has now applied for a loan of 9,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy additional stocks of food for her food vending business, as well as snacks that ship passengers demand.

All she is wishing is to send her children to school, despite any crises they might encounter.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of snacks and food.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Mrs. Gemma A., 44 years old, is married and lives in Dapitan City. She is much inspired by being a member of Paglaum MPC because she has all the benefits she wants. Since she already has an existing business near the port and her customers have increased, especially the ship passengers, she needs additional capital to increase her stocks of snack foods. She applied for a 7,000 PHP loan at Paglaum MPC to realize her business goals. She wishes to have a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional variety of snack foods

location.town: San Vicente, Dapitan City,Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Mrs. Marietta C., 65 years old, is married and lives at Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a farmer and they are lucky to have one son. Her husband's income does not suffice for all their needs in their daily living and that is why, with her small store, Mrs. C. helped him to have other income.

To be able to buy additional commodities for the store, Mrs. C. turned to Paglaum for a loan in the amount of 5,000 pesos. She is praying for the success of her store so that she will give all the best of life to her son, who is a student.

loans.use: To buy additional goods and commodities.

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en:
Lhamsuren P. lives with her husband and three children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Two of her children are still students in a local high school and their only daughter is unemployed and stays home.

Lhamsuren has a small retail business selling dairy products. She buys the dairy products, such as milk, cheese and yogurt, from wholesalers in the countryside and resells them for a profit by going door to door in the family car. Since she started her business in 2000, her working capital has increased from 220,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,400 MNT) to 2,000,000 MNT. She has gained significant experience in this type of business. In the future, she would like to have her own shop with a more diverse selection of dairy products.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more dairy products to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline O. is a 46 year-old mother of five. Her husband, Joel, has been buying and selling livestock for almost 15 years. Their house is near the livestock market of Sibalom, the center of trading in Antique province. However, her husband’s income cannot support the needs of her growing family.   She wants to help her husband support the education of three of her children (one in college, one in secondary school, and one in preparatory school). 

Evangeline applied for this loan to buy one piglet and feed for the pig she is now raising from her first loan from ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.).  She wants to save money to increase her husband's capital and to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: To expand a piggery.

loans.name: Myangantsetseg

texts.en:
Myangantsetseg B. lives with her mother and younger sister in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her mother works in a small barber shop and her sister is a student at a local high school. Myangantsetseg graduated with a bachelor’s degree in law from a local university three years ago. Although she wanted to be a lawyer, she was not able to find a job after graduating.

Myangantsetseg decided to start a small business by herself. In 2006, she rented a small retail stall in a local market and started selling various pants for women and men. She frequently travels to Ereen China, a border town where many goods are purchased, and buys cheap pants for women and men. In addition to her business, she just started an evening masters program in MAU at a local university. She pays the program tuition from her profit.

Myangantsetseg requests a loan to purchase more pants from Ereen, China to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase pants from Ereen, China.

loans.name: Horolgarav

texts.en:
Horolgarav S. is 43, married and has two sons. Her family lives in a ger (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her eldest son married and lives apart from his parents. The youngest son, Ganbayar, is 19 and is attending high school. Horolgarav's family proudly owns the plot of land where they live.

Together with her husband Batmunh, Horolgarav has been running a butcher stall at the local market. In 1996 they bought and opened their first butcher stall at the market, giving them 13 years of experience in the industry. Both she and her husband are well respected by their community and have many repeat customers. At the start, their business working capital was 200,000 tugrik (roughly $US140). Because of Horolgarav's 13 years of hard work, her inventory has increased to 2,500,000 tugrik.

With this loan Horolgarav will buy more sheep and cows from local herders. She is planning to buy another stall soon to expand her family business.

loans.use: To buy sheep and cows from local herders.

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Nyamjav M. is 54, married and the father of four. One child is a university student and the others are attending elementary school. His family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

Nyamjav is a professional carpenter and runs his own carpentry business. In 1990 he started making furniture and "ger" components such as roof poles and latticed walls. When he began his business 19 years ago, his working capital was very small at around 3,000 tugrugs. ($1.00 USD=250 MNT in 1990) Now it has increased to 400,000 MNT.

From his profit, Nyamjav has bought two pick-up trucks. To expand his business, he is planning to build a woodshop on the plot of land he owns. Nyamjav is a humble and hard-working person. He dreams that his children will become well educated and have a happy life when they grow up. He requests a loan to purchase wood to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios L. is a 52-year-old mother of eight. Her husband, Rudy, is a farmer.  She worked very hard to raise her big family.  Despite the many difficulties she encountered, she was able to send three of her children to college, two to high school, and three to elementary school.  She always has had hopes of getting out of poverty, the very reason why she wants all her children to finish their studies. 

Remedios applied for this loan to buy one piglet, pig feed, and assorted foods for her variety store. She dreams of putting up a bigger piggery in the future and being able to get a stall in the market for her store.

loans.use: To support a piggery and a variety store.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren H. is 31, married and the mother of two. Her family lives in a "ger" district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. In 2002, she began to run a clothing business at the local market. When she started her retail business she went to Ereen, a Chinese border city, to buy wholesale clothing apparel with 500,000 MNT.  She also bought a stall at the local market. ($1.00 USD=1400 MNT). 

Since then she has visited Ereen regularly and brought mostly children's apparel. Her husband is unemployed and the clothing business is their only source of income. Her elder daughter attends elementary school and the younger child, a son, goes to kindergarten. She says "I'm trying my best to feed my children and improve my living conditions." With this loan, she will buy mostly men's and women’s shoes.

loans.use: To buy men's and women’s shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa M. is 50 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her family lives in a "ger" (a yurt or nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolian central provinces. Her family proudly owns the plot of land where they have been living for last twenty years.

Since 1999, she has been running a retail business in which she bakes cookies and biscuits at home and sells them by going door to door. After several years of running her tiny business, she started renting a cafe located in a school building and, she now sells to the students at the school. Besides baking and selling biscuits, she also prepares a variety of meals especially made for children.

Tsetsegmaa is a very caring person who is well respected by others. Her hope is to have her own cafe one day. Tsetsegmaa is requesting a loan to buy flour, oil and sugar to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil and sugar

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan Parreno is a 41-year-old mother of six. Her husband, Reynaldo, is a carpenter. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to help support the needs of her family. She is industrious and committed to helping her husband. The hardship she is experiencing today is her inspiration to continue her membership and be able to get higher loans in the future.
  
Susan applied for this loan to buy feed for her pig and another piglet to expand her business. She wants to save more money to finance the education of her four children who are already in school and for the remaining two, who will go to school in the coming years. She will keep up her very good performance to be able to achieve her dreams through the support of ASHI and KIVA.

loans.use: To support a piggery.

loans.name: Urandelger

texts.en: Urandelger T. is 46, married, and the father of four. His family lives in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His eldest daughter is a university student, and the other three attend elementary school. Together with his wife Oyuntsetseg, he runs a clothing business at the local market. In 2003, they started their family clothing sales business by renting a stall. Once or twice every month Urandelger goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city where many Mongolians go to buy cheap goods and children's and adults' clothing. His wife works as a saleswoman for the store. Urandelger is a humble and hard working person. He is now requesting a loan to buy spring clothes to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Fayzali

texts.ru: Исмоилов Файзали, проживаюший в городе Куляб ему 40 лет, женат имеет 4 ех детей, имеет среднее образование. Клиент занимается торговлей, на местном рынке Лола, этим видом деятельности, занимается более 12 лет.Клиент торгует бывше употреблённом товаром.Клиент на полученные деньги хочет увеличить свой товар.От получаемого дохода клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Fayzali I. lives in the town of Kulob. He is 40 years old, married and has four children. He finished secondary school. The client runs a business at a local market named Lola, and has been in this business for more than 12 years. He trades in previously used goods. With the money from this loan Fayzali wants to increase his inventory. He will use the income to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta A., 42, is married with four children. The funds from her SPBD loan were needed to start up her school canteen business: she needed a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a barrel of oil, a gas stove, and pots. She sells to the students five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208). SPBD loans are Elisapeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This is her first SPBD loan.

loans.use: To buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a barrel of oil, a gas stove, and pots.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa S., 23, is married with three children. She does not yet have any years of experience in the food production business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 170 USD).

She has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Lisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a barrel of oil, a bunch of bananas, a frying pan and sacks of taro

loans.name: Logotaeao

texts.en: Logotaeao K., 45, is married with nine children. This loan is for bush knives, small taros, fertilizer, and chemicals for weed control. She has three years of experience selling to the general public, six days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~245 USD). SPBD loans are Logotaeao’s only access to capital because she has  never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase bush knives, small taros, fertilizer, chemicals for weeds

loans.name: Habibudin

texts.en: Habibudin is the son of N. and he lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 45 years old and married. There are five members in his household and all of them benefit from his income. He has a retail shop in which he sells different kinds of things. He would like to expand his business by buying more products to sell in his shop, things that are in demand at the market but not currently available, so he has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani (AFN) for the term of 12 months.  He would like to say that Kiva is an effective process.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera S., 36, is married and has six children. She has four years of experience in the BBQ business, selling cooked meats and other food items to the public six days a week. Sera has taken out and repaid six previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $354. SPBD loans are Sera’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy various food products to sell to the public.

loans.name: Sapani

texts.en: Sapani S., 37, is married and has seven children. She has two years experience in the BBQ business, selling cooked meats and other items to the public six days a week. Sapani has taken out one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $333.  SPBD loans are Sapani’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase meats and other food items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kaiva

texts.en: Kaiva G., 52, is married and has seven children. For the last three years, she has made a living in the fishing business, selling her catch to the public every day of the week. She has three previous loans with SPBD, and expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $354. SPBD loans are Kaiva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, gear and boats

loans.name: Leaso

texts.en: Leaso V., 38, is married and has three children.  She has three years experience running a bingo parlor, which is open to the public two days a week. Laeso has three previous loans with SPBD, and expects her weekly net cash flow from her business to be about $145.  SPBD loans are Leaso’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from a traditional bank. She plans to use her loan to buy bingo supplies, a bingo machine and also to fund improvements to her home.

loans.use: To buy another bingo machine and other items for her business.

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.ru: Курбонова Зебинисо, проживающая в городе Куляб в возросте 27-ми лет, не замужем.Имеет среднее образования,клиентка занимается торговлей на местном рынке Саховат уже более 2-ух лет.На полученные деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар, клиентка занимаясь этим видом деятельности содержит семью.
texts.en:
Zebiniso K. lives in the town of Kulob. She is 27 years old and single. She finished secondary school and has traded at a local market called Saxovat for more than two years. With the money she will receive, Zebiniso wants to increase her inventory. She runs this sort of business to support her family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Letty

texts.en: Letty A., 26, is married and has one child. She has two years experience running a plantation, and sells her produce to the public two days per week. This is her first loan from SPBD.  She expects the weekly net cash flow from her business to be about $145. SPBD loans are Letty’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from a traditional bank. She plans to use her loan to buy tools  to plant her crops and also fund various home improvements.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, sprays and other items used on her plantation.

loans.name: Fagamalama

texts.en:
Fagamalama S., 43, is married with three children. She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public one day per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately 140 USD).

She has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Fagamalama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy her new garden spray and chemicals to kill insects.

loans.use: To buy tools like a shovel, a rake, a garden spray and chemicals to kill insects

loans.name: Wais

texts.en: Wais M. is an experienced farmer and the son of Faqir M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has seven children. He is a hardworking man and always tries his best to better support his family members. He would like to move his business forward and needs to purchase seeds and tools. Thus, he is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani with a term of 12 months. He is glad that there is a useful partnership with Kiva in Afghanistan for the support of the poor.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and tools

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia L., 22, is single with no children. She has 2 years of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to the general public four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 104 Tala (approximately 35 USD).

Rosalia has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Rosalia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, a spade, a wheelbarrow, cabbage seeds, gloves, a weed cutter, a rake and a water hose

loans.name: Fiavaai

texts.en:
Fiavaai E., 30, is married with three children. She has 2 years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the schoolchildren five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (approximately 160 USD).
