Fiavaai has one previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Fiavaai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Some of the loan will be use to purchase home materials.

loans.use: To buy candies plus sacks of flour to make donuts and pancakes for her canteen business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina T., 49, is married with five children.  She has one year of experience in the vegetable garden business.  She sells to the village people and general public, three days per week.  She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~140 USD).  SPBD loans are Marina’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase some vegetable seeds and garden tools

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Курматов Шерали проживаю в районе Восе, поселок Гелот в возрасте 42-ух лет, женат имеет 7-ых детей.Имеет среднее образования, клиент занимается животноводством уже более 19 лет. Клиент покупает молодой скот, откармливает и перепродаёт.На полученные деньги, клиент хочет купить несколько молодых телят.Занимаясь этим видом деятельности содержит семью.
texts.en:
Sherali K. lives in the town of Gelot, in the Vose district. He is 42 years old, married and has seven children. He finished secondary school, and has raised livestock for more than 19 years. Sherali buys young cattle and fattens them for resale. With the money he will receive, he wants to purchase several young calves. By engaging in this sort of work he is able to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Faasalafa

texts.en: Faasalafa P., 51, is married with four children. She has four years of experience in the pork bun business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 208 Tala. SPBD loans are Faasalafa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her fourth SPBD loan, used to purchase lamp flaps, sugar, flour, salt, onion, yeast, soy sauce, cooking pots, and seasoning oil. She reports that her business is doing well.

loans.use: To purchase lamp flaps, sugar, flour, salt, onion, yeast, soy sauce, cooking pots, and seasoning oil.

loans.name: Sophia B Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Sophia, 45 years old, is married with seven kids. She has been selling fresh and dried fish for five years; the major challenge in her business is perishability of the fish.  Therefore, she is using the loan to purchase a refrigerator for the storage of her fresh fish. She is active and dreams of buying a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Mohammad Hashem

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is M. Hashem the son of M. R.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with eight children. He is a farmer and has worked as a farmer since 1990 and he is a very experienced farmer.

He would like take an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy the essential materials for farming. He would like to say this is an effective process that can support the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy the essential materials for farming

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai M., 28, is married with one child.  She is just starting in the plantation business.  She sells to the village people and general public, six days per week.  She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~140 USD).  SPBD loans are Faafetai’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy items to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals to kill insects and tools for planting taro, yam and taamu

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.ru: Назаров Голибджон проживаюший в городе Куляб в возросте 38 лет женат имеет 4-ёх детей, образование среднее.Клиент занимается услукой, такси в городе Куляб, этим видом деятельности занимается уже более трех лет.У него имеется собственная автомашина марки OPEL ASTRA. На полученные  деньги, клиент хочет отремонтировать свою автомвшину.Занимаясь этим видом деятельности клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Golibjon N. lives in the town of Kulob. He is 38 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary school education. Golibjon provides taxi service in Kulob, and has done so for the past three years. He has his own car, an Opel Astra. With the money he will receive, Golibjon wants to repair his automobile. By engaging in this sort of work, he is able to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en:
Faapaia M., 28, is married with one child. She does not have any years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the village people and to the public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately 140 USD).

Faapaia has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Faapaia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a sack of flour, sugar and a tank of oil to start a pancake business

loans.name: Sad Wasay Group

texts.en:
S. Wasay is the group leader of S. Wasay group. There are four members in this group, all of whom hope to expand their businesses:

S. Wasay wants to take out a loan for his general store business in order to purchase more materials for the store, thus significantly expanding its offerings. S. S. would like to obtain a loan for his taxi business and he wants to take on a new mechanic for his taxi. Gul Laden wishes to use his loan for his general store, to which he hopes to attract more clients. Talab Jan would like a loan to use for his car part shop.

The group wants to take out a loan of 56,000 Afghani over a term of 10 months. They are happy to have the opportunity to access the kind of lending process that can support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding the entrepreneurs' individual businesses.

loans.name: Lepopea

texts.en:
Lepopea T., 28, is married with no children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and to the public two days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately 120 USD).

Lepopea has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Lepopea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a garden spray and pesticides and also tools used for planting

loans.name: Roziyamo

texts.ru: Нзирова Розиямо проживаю в городе Куляб  в возрасте 32-ух лет, замужем имеет 2-их детей.Имеет среднее образования, клиентка занимается животноводством уже более 2-ух лет. Клиент покупает молодой скот, откармливает и перепродаёт.На полученные деньги, клиентка хочет купить несколько молодых овец.Занимаясь этим видом деятельности клиентка помогает содержать семью.
texts.en:
Roziyamo N. lives in the town of Kulob. She is 32 years old, and married with two children. She has a secondary school education, and has raised livestock for more than two years. Roziyamo wants to purchase young animals to fatten for resale. With the money she will receive, Roziyamo wants to buy several lambs. She is able to support her family by doing this sort of work.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small-horned cattle

loans.name: Alaimalo

texts.en: Alaimalo S., 48, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to the village people and general public, two days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~140 USD).  SPBD loans are Alaimalo’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy tools and other items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a shovel, rake, bush knife and chemicals to kill insects

loans.name: Evgeniya

texts.en: Evgeniya is married. She has a retail business and sells various small home products. Evgeniya has been in this business for 15 years. Having this great experience in sales she knows how to choose and sell her products well. Evgeniya would like to borrow 1,700 UAH to purchase more goods. She is going to help her children and grand-children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Galulolo

texts.en: Galulolo I., 26, is married with two children.  She is just starting a shop.  She sells to the village people and general public, six days per week.  She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~120 USD).  SPBD loans are Galulolo’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, salt, and other goods to replace all items inside her business.  She also hopes to improve her home.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for a shop

loans.name: Fuao

texts.en: Fuao T., 26, is married with one child. She has one year of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to the village people and general public, six days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~105 USD).  SPBD loans are Fuao’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase popcorn and a tank of oil to start her business

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en: Vasati J., 26, is married with two children. She has had two years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and general public, six days per week. She has not had a previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~120 USD). SPBD loans are Vasati’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and insecticide

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Файзуллоев Абдусаттор проживающий в городе Куляб, не женат.У клиента имеется торговая точка, которая находится на местном рынке Саховат.Клиент занимается торговлей порфемерии более 2-ух лет. На полученные деньги клиент хочет увеличить свой товар.Клиент от получаемого дохода, собирает деньги на свадьбу.
texts.en:
Abdusattor F. lives in the town of Kulob. He is unmarried. Abdusattor has a stand located in the local Saxovat market, and has sold perfume for more than two years. With the money he will receive, Abdusattor wants to increase his inventory. He plans to spend the income on his wedding.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Itaf

texts.en: Itaf T. is 50 years old, married with 5 children, grown and living independently. Her money-earning activity is selling sewing notions; she is asking Ryada for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more buttons, poplin, and fasteners. Itaf says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: purchase more buttons, poplin, and fasteners for re-sale

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia M., 29, is married with three children. She has two years of experience in the plantation/vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and general public, two days per week. She has not had a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~105 USD). SPBD loans are Silia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and seeds for a vegetable garden

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is divorced with two children. She sells children's clothing at the central market in Drogobych city. Her profit is 4,000 UAH per month.

Mariana has been in this business for 3 years. She used to work in sales, as a cashier at a big sales company. Mariana is a very enthusiastic, hard-working and honest person. Her business goal is to start a second location and enlarge her business.

Mariana would like to borrow 5,500 UAH to increase her assortment. Affordable prices and large assortment that is renewed often help her to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to increase her assortment

loans.name: Sapini

texts.en: Sapini T., 43, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public two days per week. SPBD loans are Sapini’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her third SPBD loan. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166). The loan is needed to buy tools for her business (a shovel, rake, garden spray, chemicals, etc.), as well as to improve her home and pay for her kids' schooling.

loans.use: To purchase tools like a shovel, rake, garden spray, and chemicals.

loans.name: Sere

texts.en:
Sere F., 52, is married with five children. She has one year of experience in the laundry business. She provides service to the village people and to the public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 175 USD).

She has three previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Sere’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy another washing machine for her laundry

loans.name: Saloma

texts.en:
Saloma M., 45, is married with four children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and to the public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately 120 USD).

Saloma has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Saloma’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy more tools and some garden spray to expand her plantation

loans.name: Afeez

texts.en: Afeez R. is 28 years old and married with 2 children.  Afeez is a furniture maker. He is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more furniture materials to make more chairs and cabinets to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make furniture to sell

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en:
Kuini S., 28, is married with three children. She has three years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village people and the public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (approximately 160 USD).

Kuini has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Kuini’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and material for puletasi (the traditional formal garment worn by Samoan women)
